info: A photograph which made it into the local press which was said to show a 'faceless monk in a habit' was unconvincing and resembled a sheet behind a window at the church.

title: Grey Monk
info: The pale smoke coloured figure still reportedly drifts around the building.

title: Thomas Sales
info: Thomas, a butler, is believed to have killed himself in 1898 after he was blackmailed by a gang who burgled the building. His short, well-groomed shade has been seen in the bar area after hours, and perhaps more sinisterly, his unseen hands have reportedly tried to push several people downstairs.

title: Gliding Hound
info: The passenger of a van observed an Alsatian-sized dog as it glided towards the vehicle before reaching a hedge, where it stood upright on its rear legs. The passenger and dog watched each other until the van turned a corner and out of sight.

title: Maid carrying a Basket
info: The ghostly maid seen in a bedroom is believed to have been murdered by a former owner, after giving birth to an unwanted baby. The infant has been heard crying, the sounds coming from behind the fireplace. Another figure, this time a cavalier, has also been observed on site.

title: Count Louis Zborowski
info: A figure that disappeared suddenly as it crossed a field was named as the ghost of Zborowski, who once resided at the Higham Park estate.

title: Bloated Face
location: Broadstairs - Boarding School, run by Mr & Mrs Hester
info: Author Dennis Wheatley encountered a man with a white, bloated face while boarding at this school. He thought the figure was a burglar, and a hunt ensured on the property after his sighting. However, the figure had disappeared, leaving no trace. A few years later, during the First World War, Wheatley was told the figure he encountered was an elemental, accidently summoned by the Hesters.

title: White Nurse?
location: Broadstairs - Kingsgate Castle and beach below
info: A photograph taken by artist Malcolm Baker appears to show the upper body of a white figure moving through foliage just outside the castle. Baker believes the figure to be a nurse in 1950s uniform, carrying a tray in front of her. A few months later musician Dan Smith reported spotting a nun dressed in white on the beach just after dawn, the figure quickly vanishing.

title: Blithe Ghost
location: Broadstairs - Playhouse, (theatre demolished in 1980s) Westcliff Road
info: Two of the Blithe Spirit cast reported hearing footsteps outside their door in the upper part of the building, but no person could be found. A former actor told the local press the site was jinxed, and she had been pushed on the staircase by an unseen force. Whispers could be heard from behind the stage during performances, but like the source of the footsteps, no guilty party could be discovered.

title: Woman
location: Broadstairs - Private residence near Nelson Place
info: A newspaper article featured the activities of this female phantom, which included the rustling of an unseen dress, the smell of perfume, and the family cats interacting with something that could not be observed. On one occasion, an occupant heard a piano being played inside the house, although the instrument did not exist on the site.

title: Monstrous Fish
location: Broadstairs - Sandy area, was known as Fishness
info: A twenty-two yard (twenty metre) long fish washed up on the beach, the creature's roar being heard over a mile away before dying. One of the creature's eyes was said to be 'more than a cart and six horses could draw'. It is very likely the 'fish' was a whale.

title: Stooping Man
info: This phantom stands over a small lake in the area, as if looking for something.

title: Woman in Long Gown
info: Seen only a couple of times, it was much more familiar for this entity to be heard walking in the upper part of the building.

title: Coach
info: A horse-drawn coach is said to haunt this road, the occupants unseen and unknown.

title: Mabel?
info: A former landlady, Mabel may have been photographed during a New Year's Eve party in 2001, reflected in a picture on the wall. There are also reports of glasses that move themselves and strange sounds.

title: Ellen Blean
location: Canterbury - Bishop's Finger Inn, St Dunstan's Street
info: Blean, a housekeeper to a Canon in Canterbury, poisoned him and his mistress when she discovered their affair. Blean disappeared soon after, and many years later her body was discovered walled up in a nearby building. The story goes that Blean's ghost haunts the street and appears in the inn itself, although the story's connection to the inn is said to be fictitious.

title: Abigail
info: John Hippisley, who runs the Canterbury ghost walk, tells the story of Abigail. She committed suicide after several years of being beaten by her husband. Abigail ultimately had the last laugh, as her death was mistaken as a murder for which her husband was found guilty and hanged. Her spirit is said to linger in the upper part of the building.

title: Nell Cook
location: Canterbury - Canterbury Cathedral - Archbishop's Palace, the Dark Entry, and other areas
info: Nell was a servant at the cathedral. He discovered his niece was having a relationship with a canon and killed them both. Nell's ghost now walks in regret. Phantom plainchant has also been heard from the area, and the figure of a nun and the ghost of Simon of Sudbury are also reported.

title: One Time Mayor
info: Riding his bicycle around the city he loved, the mayor has proved to be quite harmless.

title: Clouded Leopard
info: An escapee from Howletts Park, this leopard lived for eight months in the Kent countryside, before being shot by a farmer.

title: Girl in Grey
location: Canterbury - Former private residence (now an Estate Agent) along St Margaret's Street
date: Early twentieth century, every Friday morning at 05:00h
info: John Hippisley, who runs the Canterbury ghost walk, tells the story of a phantom girl dressed in grey clothing would be seen to enter the front door and ascend the staircase before vanishing. Eventually, a female's skeleton was discovered under the floorboards, draped in grey cloth.

title: Cobb's Coach
location: Adderbury - Area around Cobb House (no longer standing)
info: George Cobb left death bed instructions that four oaks on his land should never be felled - sure enough, soon after his death the alterations were made, and Cobb's ghost travelling in a funeral coach has been seen since.

title: The Devil Helps Thrice
info: This church is one of three in the area (Bloxham and King's Sutton being the other two) that were paid for by three brothers. One of their workers who helped construct this tower never took any pay, never slept and never ate - he vanished as soon as the tower was built. The brothers were convinced that they were helped by Old Nick.

title: Crying Child
info: Several ghosts are reputed to haunt the house and the grounds. A phantom crying child lurks in the woods, while the stables are home to a groom who hanged himself. A grey lady is said to gaze from a window on the second floor.

title: Mrs Whittaker
info: When the clergy tried to exorcise this shade, they found it so strong the only way to subdue it was to place the ghost in a large barrel of beer. The barrel stayed in the cellar of the house for many years, though its present whereabouts is unknown.

title: Sheppard
location: Bampton - Road between town and Clanfield
info: This figure, dressed in old clothing (although one story says he appeared naked) appears to lonely travellers along the road.

title: Horace
info: A former member of staff, Horace still turns up on occasion to keep an eye on the newer employees.

title: File Flinger
location: Banbury - Co-op Travel Shop, White Lion Walk
info: An entity here locks the toilet door, creates the smell of toast, and knocks files of documentation from the shelves.

title: Dropped Mortar
info: During the construction of the churches at Bloxham, Adderbury and King's Sutton, the Devil was thought to have lent a hand. During the work he slipped and dropped some of the mortar he was carrying, thus creating Crouch Hill.

title: Trap Door
location: Banbury - Private residence along Middleton Road
info: A couple living in a Victorian property were subjected to several months of phantom activity. Footsteps were heard in a room where one witness was sitting, a room was ransacked by an invisible entity, and a solid wood trap door to the attic raised itself 45 degrees for several minutes. The house was finally blessed, but the occupiers moved out not wanting to wait to discover whether the blessing was successful.

title: Cavalier
info: Having vanished for many years now, it is reasonably certain this once gruesome entity has now gone forever.

title: Beast of Banburyshire
info: Named as a big cat hotspot, this area of Oxfordshire has had dozens of reports of large felines over the first five years of the twenty-first century.

title: Highwayman
info: Killed in the seventeenth century, this highwayman refused to leave and continued to ride around the area to the annoyance of locals.

title: Tall Dark Man
info: This poltergeist caused pieces of the ceiling to collapse in every room, although no damage occurred to the furniture. Half the windows on the site were also smashed by an unseen hand throwing stones and pieces of roof tile. The entity appeared only once, manifesting as a tall, dark man to a serving girl who promptly fainted.

title: Whispers
location: Bicester - British Heart Foundation charity shop
info: Staff at the charity shop reported hearing voices and spotting a strange mist. Chairs would be found moved and lights which had been switched off were found turned back on.

title: Blind Algar
info: Algar was blinded after being stoned for touching the hand of the woman he loved. He prayed to St Margaret for help, and she give him the well that restored his sight.

title: Petty Officer
info: A Royal Navy petty officer is said to haunt this pub having drowned himself a short distance away.

title: Old Edwin
info: Edwin Fry, the landlord who ran this public house during the middle of the twentieth century, still returns to look around the place. His hollow footsteps are the only indication of his presence.

title: The Devil Helps Thrice
info: This church is one of three in the area (King's Sutton and Adderbury being the other two) that were paid for by three brothers. One of their workers who helped construct this tower never took any pay, never slept and never ate - he vanished as soon as the tower was built. The brothers were convinced that they were helped by Old Nick.

title: Monk in Brown
info: The phantom monk is only one of several spooky occurrences at this site; another is an unearthly bell that makes itself heard at two every morning, and the dead gamekeeper who patrols the area with his rifle.

title: Black Cloud
location: Burford - Road between Burford and Minster Lovell
info: This cloud has been seen moving against the wind and causes an extreme state of terror if enveloping any witness.

title: Sir Laurence Tanfield
info: The evil Sir Laurence Tanfield and his wife, the Lady Tanfield, are said to travel the area in a fiery coach. To observe the coach is said to bring bad luck or death. One story says Lady Tanfield was bound into a bottle and cast into the river, while another variant of the story says both Tanfields are trapped beneath the bottom stone found under the bridge crossing the River Windrush.

title: The Wardrobe
info: Mrs Barclay advertised for someone to remove a haunted wardrobe in 'The Morning Post' newspaper on 19 August 1937. She had bought the object three years previous, through it was not until the start of 1937 that the wardrobe doors would open and close shut continuously, even breaking string tied around them. A phantom man began to appear around the house, old and bent over, and wearing a deerstalker hat. However, once sold and removed, the manor was never troubled again.

title: Burning Witches
info: Local legend says that a chain would be passed through the eye hole in the stone, enabling witches to be held and burnt at the site.

title: White Stallion
info: Roaming riderless, this white (or grey, according to other reports) horse jumps large hedges and runs wild in the area.

title: Bear
info: A bear was said to have taken up residence in the surrounding woodland. Described as dark brown and the size of a sheepdog, the creature's footprints were also discovered, although it is not known whether they were formally identified as belonging to a bear.

title: Grey Geese of Addlestrop Hill
date: A couple of stones still present; most have been moved
info: An elderly lady driving her geese down the road met a witch who requested charity. The elderly woman refused, so the witch turned the geese to stone.

title: Four Nuns
info: This small procession of nuns silently drifts along the footpaths surrounding the court.

title: Monk
location: Chesterton - Road between village and Weston on the Green
info: A local legend says that the monk who had the affair with 'Mad Maude' from Weston on the Green now haunts the road between two villages and chases anyone he encounters.

title: Former Vicar
location: Chipping Norton - Church and surrounding area
info: Hanged from the church tower for his part in a rebellion, the holy man is still seen walking about his parish.

title: White Woman
location: Churchill - Crossroads close to Lyneham Longbarrow
info: A white female phantom is said to walk this area. It is unclear whether the ghost is that of an old woman who once lived in a nearby cave and watched over a hoard of treasure.

title: Sarah Fletcher
info: This housewife hanged herself during a state of depression - most blame her two-timing husband for her emotional state. She now drifts around her former home, dressed in black, with a purple ribbon in her hair.

title: Opening Doors
info: This entity reportedly creates unearthly sound effects and makes a pest of itself by opening locked doors and prodding people standing at the bar on their bottoms.

title: Amy Robsart
info: The ghostly figure of Amy Robsart is considered to bring death within days to any who see her. Her husband who saw the spirit died ten days later.

title: Madam Dudley
info: It took nine parsons to lay the spirit of Madam Dudley, once quite content to walk this parkland.

title: Amy Robsart
info: Possibly murdered on her husband's orders, the shade of Amy Robsart was seen on the staircase where she was pushed (or did she jump?) and broke her neck.

title: Choir
info: Villagers heard the church organ and a choir singing in the church but found the building empty and quiet when they entered.

title: Force
info: An invisible force would present cyclists and walkers from passing along a road in this village.

title: Dark Clothed Man
info: Seen in the house, the figure may be a former groom who was kicked to death by a bolting horse. He has also been heard walking around.

title: Maurice Frost
info: Bed springs sounded with no one present, clocks would wind themselves, and one man claimed a phantom hand materialised in the drawing room.

title: Runaway Horse
info: While driving into Denchworth, two people spotted a panicked horse, which galloped from a side road in front of their car. The driver immediately slammed on the brakes and turned the headlights down so as not to startle the creature further. Not quite believing what they had both seen, they turned the headlights back up only to see the horse galloping in front of the car for a few more seconds before vanishing.

title: Princess
info: Crew on the nightshift were said to have heard footsteps and seen what appeared to be the imprints of high heeled shoes appear and disappear on the lino floor. The ghost was nicknamed Princess by staff.

title: Distressed Woman
location: Dorchester on Thames - George Hotel, the 'Vicar's Room'
info: This female form, dressed in white, had been observed crying in the hotel. She last appeared at the end of a four poster bed.

title: Lady in White Gown
info: This pale entity was described as rather sad looking when last seen. She may have connections to the hospice which once stood on the site.

title: Man in Overcoat
location: East Hanney - Road close to bridge
info: This road is thought to be haunted by a man who previously died in an accident. Wearing an overcoat and cap, he is seen to run out in front of cars, only to vanish on impact.

title: Petrified Man
info: The three stones standing here are said to be a man, his dog and his horse. The man, the larger stone, is said to wander down to the village stream on Midsummer Eve. The stones are also said to return to their positions if anyone tries to remove them.

title: Monk
location: Fifield - Footpath leading to Shipton Under Wychwood
info: A refugee from a vanished local monastery, the monk has yet to find his way home.

title: Smoky Woman
info: While sitting on the porch of her house, a girl watched as a vale of smoke emerged from the wall and transform into a woman, although the head and lower arms could not be seen. The figure wore a white top, a flowery skirt, navy blue opaque tights and navy blue shoes. The figure then turned back into smoke and returned into the wall.

title: Road Crosser
info: A woman who stopped her car to answer a mobile phone spotted a large black cat cross the road in front. The cat stood three foot high and possessed a long black tail that drooped downwards. The sighting lasted for around five seconds.

title: Sir Lawrence Tanfield
info: Sir Lawrence and Lady Tanfield visited a few places in Oxfordshire in their phantom coach before being banished, this village being one.

title: Heavy Breathing
date: December 2008, early hours of the morning
info: Stopping at the carpark to have a quick sleep in their car before continuing their journey, a driver was awoken by heavy breathing coming from the backseat. The sound stopped as they turned around to look. Closing their eyes once again, the sound started for a second time. The driver decided it was time to restart the journey and promptly left the site.

title: Box Carriage
location: A31 - Hogs Back, Guildford bound. 1 mile Northeast of Tongham junction
info: Travelling home in 2007, a driver watched a horse drawn box carriage cross the road around 100 metres in front of him. The witness reported that he could not make out too many details as it was raining hard, though he was able to see a dim lantern towards the front of the carriage. As the driver reached the spot where he had seen the vehicle pass, he realised there was no side road where the coach and horses could have crossed. Another witness in the 1960s spotted a female figure with long hair, wearing a white dress, standing by the roadside. The witness stopped to see if she was lost or needed a lift, but she had vanished. Mentioning the encounter to a work colleague the following day, the colleague described the figure which was encountered and said the area was haunted.

title: Red Bus
info: Driving towards Pirbright in a convertible, this witness passed an old fashioned bus as it headed in the opposite direction. However, no sound came from the bus, and there was no smell of exhaust or wind turbulence generated as their paths crossed. The driver of the convertible also realised that his headlights did not reflect off the bus, which he later identified as 1920's Dennis J Type of the Aldershot and District bus company.

title: Night Coach
info: The rector wrote that he had been awoken by the sounds of galloping and opened his eyes just in time to see a phantom coach and a team of horses pass through his bedroom. It was said that the phantom occurrence had also been experienced by previous rectors, and that the rectory was built on top of an old road.

title: Old Man in Green
info: This figure that appeared in one of the bedrooms looked real, though when a witness tried to grab him, he passed through the figure. Described as short, and looking like a tramp, the ghost had what appeared to be a slashed throat. The nearby fields are haunted by the sounds of galloping horses.

title: Saucer
location: Bagshot - Two miles past Junction 3, heading towards London
info: Watched for between five and eight minutes, this saucer shaped craft had 'fifty pence piece type edges'. White lights could be seen at the front of the object, and blue lights at the rear.

title: Lord Hope
info: While chasing an escaping prisoner, Lord Hope killed the man, who Hope later discovered was his son. Now the lord walks the area in regret.

title: Female Figure
info: A woman in seventeenth century clothing is said to haunt this churchyard.

title: Major Peter Labelliere
info: The Major requested that he be buried upside down near the summit of the hill. Even though his dying wish was carried out, this has not prevented Labelliere from roaming the area near his grave. A ghostly horse and rider have also been reported as haunting the area.

title: Young Girl
info: This shop has a former doorway out the front which is now sealed up - a phantom girl is said to stand there.

title: Gypsy and Horse
info: A crossroads near to the woods is haunted by an old female traveller and her aging mare.

title: Buckland Shag
location: Buckland - Stream near the village, and rock in the North Downs
info: This water monster set up home in this small body of water, until driven away by a local clergyman. A large rock located in the North Downs is still stained red with the bloody of the Shag's victims.

title: Crashing Car
info: Police called to the scene where several motorists had watched a car crash off the road discovered not a fresh accident, but one that had occurred five months previous. The car was in a ditch, making it impossible to see from the road, and the skeletal remains of the driver were recovered.

title: Former Maids
info: The building is a magnet for female ghosts. A woman appears from a wall in the dining room, while another dressed in blue drifts about in the drawing room. The third female form has been seen outside the house; dressed in wedding lace, she vanishes near the pond.

title: My Spook
info: A family visiting an older relative along this street witnessed a radio turning itself on unaided. The relative declared, 'oh, that's my spook!' and said similar events had occurred in the past.

title: Eight Men A-Leaping
info: Several motorists reported eight figures dressed in black cloaks or cowls running and leaping around, heading towards the dual carriageway. The witnesses said that they moved strangely and silently. In the 2000s, stories began to appear concerning a ghostly woman in white along the road, either standing on the side or running out in front of cars.

title: Monk
info: Home to a ghostly hooded monk, the former rectory is also occasionally visited by an older man in Victorian clothing.

title: Old Lady
location: Caterham - Private house along Godstone Road
info: A ghostly old lady was spotted on the staircase here.

title: Don't Talk
info: Local legend says a witch was executed on this tree, cursing it while dying. Something untoward is supposed to happen to the loved ones of those who talk beneath the branches, while highly superstitious folk hold their breath while scampering past.

title: Footsteps
info: The phantom footfalls have been heard moving across the stage area, several previous managers mistaking the sounds for that of intruders.

title: Bishop Andrews
info: Bishop Andrews occupied this building in the reign of Elizabeth I, and was said to haunt the site for years after his death. While sightings of Andrews have diminished, now the rectory is said to be home to several spirits, including three Cavaliers.

title: Bare Feet
info: The padding of naked human feet has been heard here.

title: Murdered Girl
info: Killed by an evil local monk, this ghost still appears in the room where the crime occurred.

title: Monk
info: An Australian barmaid working at the pub awoke when her bedcovers were pulled off her by a phantom monk.

title: Concealed Treasure
location: Chertsey - Large stone on St Anne's Hill, was known as the Devil's Stone
info: This stone, made of sand and gravel, is said to be unmovable, which makes acquiring the treasure buried beneath pretty damn hard to reach.

title: Print Polt
location: Chertsey - Printers (still operational?) along Charles Street
info: A printing establishment along this road was subject to poltergeist behaviour which interfered with their reprographic service.

title: Former Director
location: Chertsey - Private organisation in northern Chertsey (no longer present)
info: Following the death of a director notorious for working until 20:00h, office workers would hear his office door slam closed on the top floor, the lift ascend before descending to the ground floor, and the front door finally rattling.

title: Heavy Person
info: This entity, normally blamed for moving furnishings around, was felt by a couple of overnight guests as it sat on the end of their bed.

title: Headless Monk
info: A water ride at the park was moved after staff reported encountering a headless monk, amongst other paranormal phenomena. The foundations of the ride were said to have intruded on an ancient burial site. The park has been accused of holding a publicity stunt, having used another ghost story previously to promote its 'Saw' ride.

title: Faceless Rider
location: Chilworth - Between Rices Corner and Percy Arms
info: While returning from work in the early hours of the morning, a cyclist became aware of another man on a bike a short distance behind him. The second rider finally caught up to the cyclist, who called out when he realised the man who had just overtaken him had no lights on. The figure on the second bike turned his head, and the witness realised the rider had no face, just a blurry area.

title: Fleeing Nick
location: Churt - Devil's Jumps (three hills in the area)
info: Local witch Mother Ludlam had her cauldron stolen by the Devil. As the Devil ran, every step he took created a great mound of earth.

title: Field Marshal Lord Ligonier
info: The musical group Peter Bs reported encountering a ghostly figure while driving along this stretch of road. They said the entity wore an army greatcoat, emanated a strange glow, and had hollow eye sockets. After conducting research, the band thought the figure could have been Field Marshal Lord Ligonier, buried at Cobham church.

title: Small Lad
info: A former owner of the property reported encountering the ghost of a young boy in the building.

title: Hermit
info: The ghost of a hermit who once lived in the park is said to still walk around.

title: Blue Donkey
info: This strangely discoloured creature is reputed to haunt the churchyard.

title: Something
info: The mausoleum and the surrounding woodland were rumoured to be haunted, although the exact details are not known.

title: Gliding Woman
location: Cranford - Cranford Park House (no longer standing (demolished 1946) - currently The Berkeley Arms)
info: Two men with the intent of going out with the gamekeepers followed what they thought was a maid around the corridors of the building - until the figure disappeared at a dead end. The ghost of Sir Roger Aston, barber to James I, also wandered the site.

title: Maid
info: A mother and son walking along the river spotted a maid wearing white perched upon a stone seat by the water's edge. On their return journey they noticed that the maid, perhaps unsurprisingly, had gone, but the stone seat had also vanished without trace.

title: Sir Thomas More
info: Executed in 1535, Sir Thomas had his head hidden at Baynard Hall until the heat died down. Still not happy, he drifts without the object in the nearby park.

title: Passenger
info: Workers on the 007 film Casino Royale reported seeing the ghost of a woman moving along the aisles of a 747 they used as a set. It is believed the phantom is of a female passenger who died from a heart attack at least thirty years previous.

title: Blurred Figure
location: Croydon - Addiscombe railway yard - sheds (station demolished in 2001)
info: While the buildings stood, one worker witnessed a grey figure walking from the sheds, the apparition's face blurred and distorted. The sounds of machinery being moved at night were also reported, though the buildings were locked. The grey figure has been seen since the demolition, viewed from the fence along Capri Road.

title: Pilot
location: Croydon - Area around New Addington, and Queen Elizabeth's Drive
info: The ghost of a German pilot shot down over the area during the Second World War is said to remain in the neighbourhood. One story says that a man looking for his lost wallet along Queen Elizabeth's Drive had the object handed back to him by the pilot, who appeared quite solid.

title: Boy in an Orange Jumper
location: Croydon - Council House on New Addington estate
info: A garden attached to a house once owned by a convicted paedophile was dug up after police were tipped off that the bodies of two children were buried there. Though nothing was discovered, another family which once lived there reported they moved out after their daughter saw a ghostly boy in an orange jumper and a girl who would stand at the bottom of the garden.

title: John Carver
location: Croydon - Former cafe in Brighton Road
info: John Carver was found not guilty of the murder of his wife, though most of the community believed he was guilty. After leaving court, Carver found himself hounded by a crowd who wanted him dead. Eventually Carver moved far away to escape. Sixty years after the crime, the owner of a cafe reported seeing the ghost of a tall man in grey, minus head and legs, climb the staircase and hover on the landing. In addition, on each 26 May (the date of the wife's death), the breaking of glass could be heard. The cafe was thought to be one of the locations Carver tried to hide before leaving the area.

title: Pilots
info: It was said a chambermaid working at this hotel quit after spotting a phantom RAF pilot. A guest also reported seeing a group of pilots sitting and singing around a fireplace in the restaurant.

title: Walking Mother
info: Once an orphanage, it is thought the ghost of a woman who walks the corridors is a mother searching for her lost child. It is unclear whether the same entity is to blame for the wailing and screaming also reported onsite.

title: Archbishop Sheldon
info: The grey figure which haunts this church has been variously named as either Archbishop Sheldon or a grey nun. One story says the ghost's visitations ceased once Sheldon's tomb was repaired. A wailing Elizabeth Finch is also said to frequent the site.

title: George
info: George, killed in 1830 by a rogue beer barrel, was 'released' in 1992 by spiritualists. George was said to have been responsible when the beer pumps failed to work.

title: Fifty Pence
info: A witness walking to the nearby college suddenly realised there was no traffic on the roads. Something made him look up only to see a large a fifty pence (heptagon) shaped craft hovering silently in the sky. It had a red underbelly, bright silver sides and moved from left to right. The witness looked down briefly, during which time the craft started to move away at incredible speed. The witness chased it across the road (traffic had appeared again) but it had disappeared. The witness later found out that he had lost an hour of time.

title: Preacher
location: Croydon - Sandrock public house, Upper Shirley Road
info: This public house is said to be haunted by an old man with a long beard, dressed as a preacher. He has reputedly been seen by former staff.

title: Grey Lady
info: Carrying a candle whilst walking down the Tudor Corridor, this spook is thought to be that of a maid who killed herself during the 1930s. One guest caught the reflection of the entity in a mirror as he sat in the bath.

title: Road Crossers
info: A plethora of ghostly figures have been reported on this road, from London to Brighton. Most appear to interact with drivers - one male figure walks in front of a car, only to disappear when hit, while figures dressed in light coloured clothing have also been observed.

title: Old Man
info: An aging man sitting on a stone stood up and walked into the path of an oncoming motorcycle. The cyclist felt the impact but retained his balance and took several seconds to stop and turn back to the scene of the accident. However, the old man had vanished.

title: Horse and Buggy
location: A272 - Goldbridge Road towards Newick, after the bridge and before the bend
info: Two cars driving in opposite directions were forced to perform emergency stops to avoid a horse and buggy being driven by a cloaked man wearing a top hat. The horse and buggy disappeared. One of the drivers left his car quite shaken, running over to the other to ask what had happened to the old vehicle.

title: Running Hound
location: Alfriston - Between the Downs and Town Fields
info: A large black dog is said to run from the Downs to Town Fields - here it stares over a flint wall before retreating the way it came.

title: Little Folk
info: Fairies once made their home here and rewarded a local man with food after he helped one of their kind repair a kitchen utensil.

title: Blue Lady
info: Believed to have been murdered on the site, a woman dressed in blue has been observed on the landing. A dog is also said to haunt the car park outside the building.

title: Modern Looking Lady
info: Seen by the owner and her daughter, this ghostly lady seen at the base of the staircase near the bar was said to be wearing a modern gown.

title: Oxen
info: The layout and shape of this church was determined by the strange appearance of four white oxen on the village green. Their tails all touched, forming a 'x' shape that the church was built in the shape of.

title: White Dog
location: Alfriston - The White Way, road leading from the town towards Seaford
info: This creature is reportedly the dog of a young man murdered while out walking during the 1700s - because the pitiful hound sat by the victim's shallow grave, the criminals killed it also. The haunting is said to have ceased after the bodies of dog and owner were discovered when the road was widened.

title: Tall Woman with Grey Hair
info: This tall phantom lady is said to haunt the stairway and was also seen in the larder. An elderly man with grey hair was seen in and just outside of the garage; he is believed to be the man who once looked after the horses' onsite. Finally, the attic is said to be home to a wispy female figure.

title: Emily
info: This teenager is seen in and around the kitchen area of the hotel - the stories say she died shortly after having an affair with a bishop.

title: Little Girl and Old Man
info: Accompanied by a sense of evil, these two ghosts have been seen several times over the past hundred years.

title: Huge Monk
info: Locals talk of an enormous monk, standing around fifteen foot tall, which walks the vicinity of the manor house. A disembodied voice that would whisper the name of witnesses was reported in the house itself, where a housekeeper had also reported spotting the ghost of a former owner. Another worker heard several people talking loudly, but upon entering the room from which the voices had emerged, silence fell - the room was empty.

title: Grey Girl
info: Appearing to a couple of customers, this phantom girl with dark hair has also been blamed for minor mishaps around the building, such as overnight spillages and items rotating on hooks.

title: Party
info: A loud party has been heard coming from the house, while it was empty. People living in the property reported hearing arguments coming from a stream that runs by the house.

title: Woman in Pale Coat
location: Arundel - A27 Arundel Road, heading into Arundel
info: A woman spotted standing by a road sign along this road wore a pale beige raincoat, smiled manically, and appeared to be illuminated by a bright light from below. One witness felt uneasy by the woman's strange posture, and the police were called as it was thought at the time the woman may have escaped from a nearby hospital. The police did not find anything. In the July of the same year, a husband and wife returning from a wedding spotted a woman in pale clothing as she stepped out in front of their car. They braked and watched as she rose into the air and disappeared.

title: Cannon Fire
info: Several phantom sounds have been reported at the castle; kitchen equipment has been heard in use, though always empty on investigation, and the distant rumble of cannons being shot at the walls is also reported. The library is haunted by a blue man, flicking through an unknown book, and a young girl flees towards a tower, where she once jumped from and took her life.

title: Flitting White Bird
info: It is locally believed that prior to a death in the family, an unidentified white bird hovers and bumps into one of the windows of the castle tower.

title: Rattling in Kitchen
info: This playful spirit would turn on and off electrical items, and push kitchen items off work surfaces. Some people have also reported a semi-naked man running around the building.

title: Priest
info: Appearing on a photograph taken in the church, this phantom priest could be seen standing by the altar. Two women also haunt the church; a nun has been seen (and heard walking) in the bell tower, while a woman in blue has been observed praying at the altar.

title: Old Soldiers
location: Balcombe - Railway tunnel, line to Three Bridges
info: Killed by a train whilst sheltering from a storm, these three (or four, depending on the source) First World War soldiers have made several appearances; they always slowly fade away when approached.

title: Black Monk
date: Late twentieth century and possibly 10 November 2014
info: The monk appears in several places - the guest house, monks' walk, by the walls outside the abbey... A monk has also been seen at the vicarage of St Mary's Church. Back at the abbey, a woman wearing a large red dress has also been seen in the Common House, while King Harold is occasionally reported, complete with the arrow jutting from his head.

title: Charlie
location: Battle - Corner of Netherfield Road and London Road
info: A witness saw his gardener standing at this junction, though several hours had passed since the worker had committed suicide.

title: Floating Cat
info: This small ghostly house cat floats along a corridor in the restaurant before vanishing through a wall.

title: Little Girl
info: Seen in several of the buildings along this road, including the Bayeux Restaurant, a little girl with golden hair has appeared dressed in early twentieth century clothing.

title: Knights
location: Battle - Site of the 1066 Battle of Hastings
info: A phantom knight on horseback appears on the anniversary of the battle, while other figures have been seen more sporadically. The ground is also said to bleed after a storm.

title: Curate
info: After a Sunday service, several members of the congregation asked the Reverend who the new curate who they had seen standing in the sanctuary. In fact, the old curate had left, but had yet to be replaced, leading several to speculate they had seen a ghost.

title: Two Walkers
info: The former home of Virginia and Leonard Woolf was reputedly haunted. The sound of two people wandering and whispering around the house at night was said to have inspired Virginia Woolf to write her short story 'The Haunted House'.

title: Edwardian Gentleman
info: The police station is said to be haunted by this figure, though his motives for returning here are unknown.

title: Imprints
info: A large snake-like creature wrapped itself around Bignor hill and squeezed so tightly that it left imprints of its coils.

title: Gliding Old Man
location: Billingshurst - Crossroads known as Buck Barn, between Billingshurst & Hayward's Heath, and Horsham & Worthing. Now a dual carriageway.
info: Said to look like a traditional tramp or hobo, the old man sits on a milestone by crossroads, before gliding in front of incoming traffic. When the vehicle stops, there is no evidence of the figure existing. The reports have trailed off since the road updates.

title: Anne Starr
info: This ghost which has never made a sound is believed to belong to Anne Starr, a woman who died in childbirth within the building.

title: Lady in Red
date: Unknown, singing heard on Easter Sunday (reoccurring)
info: This spectre stands on the top of a tower, illuminated by bright moonlight, as if waiting for someone. A child haunts the bridge - the young boy disappears when he reaches the halfway point. More stories tell of phantom singing, music, and words spoken in an unknown tongue.

title: Dark Lady
info: A family of eight who moved into this house were subjected to seven years of haunting from a woman in a black dress who carried a white handkerchief. As time went on, sightings of the ghostly figure became rarer, and she was more likely to be heard than spotted. At the end of the haunting period, the ghost had simply vanished.

title: Elmer
location: Bognor Regis - Area around Elmer Woods
info: A local story points to Elmer being a farmer evicted from his home and who now walks around the area. The same locale is said to be haunted by a large black dog.

title: Cuthbert
info: The sounds associated with a person dragging a body across the floor have been heard by guests here. The phantom has been christened Cuthbert by interested patrons.

title: Footsteps
location: Bognor Regis - The Lion Hotel, Nyetimber
info: Moving between rooms 5 and 6, the footfalls could belong to the lady in blue who has been seen on the odd occasion. Her silk dress has also been heard rustling along the corridor.

title: Smuggler Curse
location: Bognor Regis - The Old Vicarage, Sudley Road
info: A curse was placed on this building after the vicar attempted to stop local smuggling activities. The building no longer stands, but the area (which now has shops built on top) is still said to be unlucky and haunted by the sounds of footsteps.

title: Woman in RTA
location: Bolney - A23 near the Queens Head public house
info: A woman in a grey dress stepped out in front of a car and was hit - the car then crashed off the road. However, the woman in grey had disappeared once the three people in the car climbed out. Two other witnesses reported that they too had seen the woman in front of the car.

title: Acting Ghosts Only?
info: The site doubled as Belasco House in the 1973 film The Legend of Hell House, with one contemporary review claiming the site to be really haunted, although any stories supporting the assertion are lacking.

title: Underwater Bells
info: When Danish raiders took the bells from the church, they pushed the Lord too far - he sunk their boat, and now the bells can be heard ringing in celebration.

title: Blue Spheres
info: Steve Hornsby found a dozen jelly-like, small blue balls in his garden following a hailstorm during which the sky briefly turned dark yellow. While the balls were not formally identified, it was suggested that they could be marine invertebrate eggs, discharge from an airliner toilet, or a kind of plant feed gel.

title: Ogre
info: A child eating ogre that lived in the park was impervious to iron weapons. Growing tired of living with the threat of being eaten, all the children in the area united. They made a large keg of beer and left it outside the ogre's home. The ogre consumed the beverage, and after falling asleep drunk, the children cut him in half with a wooden saw.

title: Father John
info: One of several spectres alleged to haunt (or have haunted) this location, this figure is said to be benevolent in nature. A former maid has also been seen onsite (she was hanged for theft), a headless man wanders around, and a woman who looks like she originates from the Elizabethan days. Finally, Sir Goddard has been seen walking around - he was sawn in half by angry villagers when it was discovered he ate babies!

title: Servant Girl
location: Brede - Small hill next to Brede Place
info: This young lady was hanged from a tree which has since been chopped down, though her presence remains.

title: Mad Jack
info: Jack is buried in the large pyramid that dominates the churchyard - he can be raised from the dead by running around his new home seven times. The inside of the pyramid is said to be covered in glass, to prevent the Devil coming to take Jack's body away.

title: Tall Man in Black
location: Brightling - Wooded area north of Darvell reservoir
info: This spooky figure is reportedly the ghost of a local drug dealer murdered in the middle of the twentieth century.

title: Screams
info: Since a tragic train crash in 1862, there have been reports of screams, cries, and the sound of crunching metal emanating from this tunnel.

title: Crying
info: Several strange events were reported in this building, including the sounds of children crying, a woman in black being spotted, items moving on their own accord, and chattering emerging from empty rooms.

title: Flushing
info: This polt practical joker was reported to flush toilets while they were in use. The entity was also reported to break glasses in the bar when no one was close by.

title: Flying Knife
location: Brighton - 7 New Road (was Leadbelly's, currently El Mexicano)
info: A knife was thrown through the air by an unseen hand and a set of keys vanished only to reappear in plain view an hour later, when this restaurant was Leadbelly's. Since that time, banging has been heard coming from the restaurant when empty, and a member of staff reportedly spotted a phantom old man in the basement.

title: Lady in Mackintosh
location: Brighton - A23 southbound, north of town between pylons and roadside cafe
date: Unknown, likely mid to late twentieth century
info: One woman driving home watched as a lady wearing a mackintosh step out in front of the car. There was no impact and, looking back into the rearview mirror, the lady in the mackintosh could not be seen. Many years later, the driver listened to a work colleague  as he described a similar incident that had occurred to his friend. The friend had reported it to the police who told him sightings of the ghostly lady were fairly common.

title: Groaning
info: During refurbishment work in this pub, workmen were said to have heard strange human groans and encountered unexplained cold spots.

title: Pale Woman in Grey
info: This ill looking woman appeared along a pew during a Christmas service, disappearing after a kind gentleman placed his coat around her shoulders, trying to keep her warm.

title: Nuns
info: A former manager is said to have seen three phantom nuns in this property. The entities reportedly glide across the floor before vanishing through the back wall.

title: Known by Name
info: An unknown voice is said to call out to staff and customers using their first names.

title: Screams
info: A German bomb killed many people here during the Second World War. The screams of the injured could be heard for years after the event.

title: Child in Pyjamas
info: Thought to have been killed during a Second World War bombing raid, this small ghostly child dressed in pyjama is said to carry a wooden toy. It is not clear whether the ghost has been observed since the 1990s, when the last of the bomb damaged buildings were fully demolished.

title: Black Belly
location: Brighton - Area surrounding Churchill Square Shopping Centre
info: The area surrounding this shopping centre is reputedly home to Black Belly, an apparition which is normally observed from the corner of the eye. The figure is said to resemble a large bald man, wearing a shirt which does not quite cover his stomach, revealing a bloated and bruised stomach. The figure is also said to hover a few centimetres from the ground. One of the last witnesses to see Black Belly is reported to be a telecoms engineer who reported the sighting to the police.

title: Gaunt Girl
info: One person reportedly spotted this phantom, thought to be the ghost of a homeless girl who died of an overdose, as they stopped behind the bandstand to urinate. The ghost is said to be wearing ragged clothing and be very pale with sunken skin.

title: Barefooted Woman
location: Brighton - Bat & Ball public house, Ditchling Road
info: A witness cashing up at the end of the night watched a barefooted woman wearing a nightdress appear and start to dance. The figure passed through the bar and vanished when reaching the corner of the room. This dancing woman may or may not be the same as the phantom grey haired, middle aged woman who is said to vanish into thin air here.

title: Victorian Man
info: This phantom is said to be a middle aged Victorian man seen standing by a pillar. Another phantom reported to haunt the site wears a tricorn hat.

title: Large White Dog
date: Last dog sighting unknown, tall man seen in Spring 1977
info: Reportedly the size of a small horse, this phantom dog will follow lonely walkers on the beach for short distances before vanishing. A witness reported seeing a tall man in old fashioned clothing and a tall hat walking along the sidewalk during the night in 1977 - the figure vanished into the mist.

title: Grey-Haired Man
location: Brighton - Bears and Friends (no longer present), Meeting House Lane
info: A phantom grey-haired man wearing a knee length coat was said to have made a few appearances here during the 1990s.

title: Mother
info: The inn is reputedly haunted by a woman who died in the cellar where she was locked up by her abusive husband, or after childbirth, or both, or neither.

title: Escaping Extinguishers
info: One story says that certain fire extinguishers in this hotel would be moved around unaided at night, although it is possible that they were moved by a mortal practical joker.

title: Betsy Bedlam
location: Brighton - Belle Vue Field, Regency Square
info: This female phantom is said to have acquired her name from her expression, not too dissimilar to inmates of Bethlem Hospital in London.

title: Deryck Carver
info: Deryck Carver was burnt in a barrel of Tar in 1555 and is believed to have been the first brewer in Brighton and the first Protestant martyr in England to be put to death. Since the 1940s it has been claimed his ghost haunts the cellar, and in 2006 the manager of the building claimed have felt an unnerving presence in that area on several occasions. A builder in the upper part of the building spotted a shadowy figure in 1995.

title: Christine Holford
info: Club owner Harvey Holford was found guilty of manslaughter after shooting and killing his wife. Shortly after Holford's conviction, lights in the building would turn themselves on and off and kitchen utensils moved themselves around the room. The poltergeist was said to have left after a medium visited the club, although there are other reports that it may have lingered longer.

title: White Lady
info: Seen by actors as they rehearse, the phantom lady is described as wearing a long white dress wearing bouffant style hair. A soldier dressed in a red tunic, the sound of disembodied footsteps and the rattling of chains also haunt the building.

title: Coach Driver
location: Brighton - Brighton Rocks public house (formerly Battle of Waterloo), Rock Place
info: This figure, complete with cloak, was seen in the 1990s drifting around the front door and the gentlemen's toilets. He was said to be the driver of a local mayor who was murdered by a highwayman shortly after leaving the pub. More recently, cupboards held shut by bricks have flung themselves open, heavy filing cabinets have fallen over, and a dog is either terrified of nothing or plays with something invisible.

title: Henry Solomon
info: Solomon (the first Chief Constable of Brighton) was killed around the middle of the eighteenth century, after being hit around the head with a red hot poker during the attempted escape of a prisoner in the cells. The former officer's ghost reportedly haunts the basement, while the upper parts of the building are haunted by a monk; a remnant from when a monastery stood on the site.

title: Flashing Lights
location: Brighton - Bugel Inn, St Martins Street
info: This public house was once plunged into chaos by a poltergeist - it played with door locks, moved furniture around, and would flick the lights on and off at speed.

title: Charlie
location: Brighton - Bugle Inn, St Martins Street
info: Locals christened this entity 'Charlie', and blamed him for moving furnishings, flicking lights on and off, locking and unlocking doors, and generating other minor mischief.

title: Name Calling
location: Brighton - Caroline Of Brunswick public house, Ditchling Road
info: An unknown phantom in this pub reputedly calls out to staff using their first name.

title: Pale Man
info: Bottles and glasses would fall off shelves, doors were heard to slam shut, and footsteps were heard climbing the stairs. On several occasions a pale man wearing a long black cloak was spotted by one manager. In addition, the grey nun which haunts the Lanes has been seen just outside the inn.

title: Misty Figure
info: When this building was an hotel, it was said to be haunted by a misty male figure who would sit in the chair in one room.

title: Hooded Figure
location: Brighton - Druid's Head public house, Market Street
info: Always seen from the corner of one's eye, a good description of this spirit was never forthcoming (although it may be the ghost of a smuggler who died after tripping on the staircase in the basement). However, another ghost in the building moves slightly slower - a woman in a red dress has been seen on one occasion in vicinity of the main bar. In 2015 a picture frame flew off a pillar and struck a visitor on the back; no one was injured and the frame did not break.

title: Tim
location: Brighton - Duke of York's Cinema, Preston Circus
info: Tim was a brewery worker crushed to death on this site. After the cinema took over the site, staff have felt Tim's presence watching them, and the smell of brewing beer fills the air.

title: Woman in Grey
info: A worker spotted a woman dressed in a grey dress standing by the fireplace in the empty bar. The figure also had a grey face. She faded away.

title: Tall Man
info: A tall phantom man is said to sit in the corner of the bar watching people during busy periods.

title: Young Girl
info: The basement of this building is said to be haunted by the phantom of a young girl who died in a fire on the site. The ghost is also reported to haunt the building which backs onto this location.

title: Darkroom Presence
location: Brighton - Evening Argus Offices, North Road
info: The photographic darkroom was said to be home to a paranormal presence which climbed upon the back on a man while he worked. Another member of staff spotted a man in a tricorn hat in one of the offices.

title: Disabled Girl
location: Brighton - First floor rooms, Regency Hotel, Regency Square
info: This young girl jumped from one of the upstairs windows - her ghost mirrors her actions, though it now vanishes as it leaps into a wall, as the window was bricked up many years ago. Another female shade that totters around the building is the Victorian landlady.

title: Young Girl
location: Brighton - Fishbowl public house, East Street
info: Seen by a Mr Dutton in 1992, a phantom young girl is said to haunt the cellar. Another witness felt a presence push past while working alone - looking up, the witness briefly spotted the shadowy figure of a tall, twenty-something woman before the entity vanished.

title: Shapes
info: The landlord was reported to have caught ghostly activity on CCTV in this public house. Strange shapes are said to have been seen, and draughts rise and fall without apparent reason.

title: Breathing
info: A man was said to have problems breathing as he lay down to sleep at night, as if something was pushing down on his chest. There were no health related problems, although the case does sound like Old Hag Syndrome, aka Sleep Paralysis.

title: Grey Woman
location: Brighton - Font public house, Union Street
info: Seen peering through the window of this converted church, the phantom woman wears a grey shawl over her head. One witness said the woman looked in her thirties and wore a matching grey dress.

title: Steam
location: Brighton - Former ABC Cinema, King's Road
info: This cinema operated from the site of an old Turkish bathhouse. Cinema staff would report the sound of running water and clouds of steam which appeared from nowhere.

title: Nun
location: Brighton - Former Debenhams store, Western Road
info: Said to have been spotted by staff and customers, the phantom nun wearing a white habit and black cloak would vanish up a stairwell. The east end of the building was a convent.

title: Shadow
info: A former barmaid claimed to have seen a shadowy figure on three different occasions behind the bar while working here. Whether this sighting relates to the rumour the site is haunted by a former owner and his wife is unknown.

title: Victorian Child
location: Brighton - Friends Meeting House, Prince Albert Street
info: Said to be around three years of age, this young girl dressed in Victorian clothing was spotted on the back steps of this building.

title: Grey Smoke
info: A grey mist accompanied by clanking and a drop in temperature was reportedly seen on stage by cleaning staff at this theatre.

title: Female Jailor
info: This woman has been seen on the steps leading down to the cellar, though locals say she has not recently appeared.

title: Seventh Floor
info: The seventh floor of this hotel is said to be home to a phantom, although details are fleeting.

title: Stroking
location: Brighton - Green Yard public house, Black Lion Street
info: A former nineteenth century animal pound, this pub is now said to experience items which fall from shelves without reason, lights which switch off unaided, and invisible hands which stroked the forehead of a female customer.

title: Floor Shadow
location: Brighton - Guitar, Amp and Keyboard (GAK), North Road
info: CCTV taken in the shop showed a ghostly shadow moving across the floor. Cameras also recorded guitars gently swaying from side to side and an item falling off the wall with nobody close by.

title: Stagehand
info: This phantom presence is said to be a stagehand wearing black clothing. While only being seen once, the figure is more likely to be heard climbing ladders.

title: Thrown Glass
location: Canterbury - Maidens Head public house (Room 4 in particular)
info: The pub appeared in the local press after it was reported that keys were taken and glasses smashed by an unseen hand in one of the guest rooms. A jukebox reputedly played while disconnected.

title: Figure in White
location: Canterbury - Marlowe Theatre (original theatre demolished in 1982)
info: This ghostly figure could be seen loitering on the right hand side of the stage during a performance. Please note that the image is of the newer Marlow; the one in which the ghost was encountered was demolished in 1982.

title: Mrs Veal
location: Canterbury - Private house opposite animal market
info: Even though Mrs Veal arrived unexpectedly at the house of her friend Mrs Bargrave, the visitor stayed and chatted for a while before leaving. The following day, Mrs Bargrave discovered at the time of the visitor, Mrs Veal had lay dying twelve miles away.

title: Sheet Removal
location: Canterbury - Private residence along Querns Road
info: The Canterbury Times reported that Dorothy Crawford had lived in her haunted home for thirty years, experiencing shaking furniture and having bed sheets removed at night. Crawford had also observed an old woman dressed in nineteenth century garb in her home.

title: Woman's Voice
info: Locking up late one night with only one other person in the building, a member of staff in the office heard a disembodied woman's voice say, 'I'll be there in a minute'. The witness quickly ran downstairs to find the waiter. The waiter himself stood in shock, having encountered a cold shape which had passed through him.

title: Black Figure
info: A worker in the upper part of the shop heard rustling. When they turned, a black shadowy figure was observed moving towards a kitchen. When the area was investigated, no one was there. The shadow had been spotted a couple of years previous by a cleaner.

title: Grey Robed Man
location: Canterbury - Sudbury Tower, Pound Lane, City wall
info: This solitary figure haunted a bedroom in the tower, reportedly tucking the occupant in at nights! Some believe the figure to be Simon of Sudbury.

title: Bloody Water
info: A pump that once jutted from a wall was said to give out red water, coloured by the blood of Thomas Becket.

title: Grey Lady
location: Canterbury - The Old Weaver's House, currently a restaurant
info: Seen by a domestic assistant, the lady in grey was observed ascending the staircase.

title: Three Children
location: Canterbury - Tiny Tim's Tearoom (restaurant), 34 St Margaret's Street
info: Workmen working on restoring the building during the 2000s reported the sounds of children playing on the staircase, strange noises in the attic, and youngsters whispering in a panelled room where they had found the relics from several children.

title: Black Figure
location: Canterbury - Undisclosed shop along The Parade
info: An employee reported that a customer had seen a black figure walk into and through a wall in the upper part of this shop.

title: Happy Man
location: Canterbury - Unnamed church residence along Burgate
info: A property along this road was haunted by an unhappy man who made himself frequently seen. A skeleton was discovered the area, after which the phantom took on a cheerier disposition.

title: Tall Lady
info: Killed in a large accident which occurred at the site in 1923, this phantom woman has been seen many times; she steps out in front of oncoming traffic, as if deliberately trying to cause a crash. She is most often seen late in the afternoon.

title: Nun in Grey
info: Disappearing from one witness in a puff of smoke, this nun is believed to be one of the order which once ran the hospital.

title: Suicide
info: A popular spot for suicides, several spirits are reported to haunt this disturbing area. One is that of a female figure who calmly steps off the cliff edge; another woman, this time in grey, walks along the cliff path, while locals speak of a ghastly black monk who convinces people to jump.

title: Singing Nuns
info: A heavy rock group recording in this studio, built on the site of a nunnery, claimed their music provoked ghosts of nuns to sing loudly, in an attempt to drown out the contemporary noise.

title: Woman in her Forties
info: This woman has been seen several times, though her exact age cannot be guessed at as she wears a veil. Two more women were seen at the bar before they melted away, and a young girl has been seen playing in a corridor.

title: Albino Dwarf
info: Seen by the novelist Pamela Frankau when at school here, this little creature ran across her bedroom floor and escaped via the landing, fading from view.

title: Violinist
info: This phantom player was once quite a frequent visitor to the theatre, though as of late he has become quiet.

title: Hanged Boy
info: Students here talk of the ghost of a lad who could not hack the pressures of academia and hanged himself in a dorm. His shade is sometimes seen down the corridors.

title: Labrador-Sized Cat
info: Whilst walking his two Yorkshire terriers, John Hescott encountered a large black cat. The feline walked away from a children's play area towards a service road. The sighting was reported to the police.

title: Heavy Breathing
info: After the death of one of the residents here, his breathing could still be heard in the sitting room after the last meal of the day.

title: Grey Lady
info: A phantom woman is said to haunt the stage area and has also been spotted sitting in the grand circle. A man was spotted on the fly floor during the 1990s who vanished without trace, while another witness spotted a heavy iron handle swinging itself for thirty seconds and felt something push past them with such force the witness was turned 45 degrees. In 2014, a grey man/figure was spotted in the wings.

title: Large Black Cat
info: The witness who saw this cat said it was the size of a small pony - he watched it as it passed within three meters of him.

title: Figure
location: Eastbourne - Southern Water treatment plant, Prince William Parade
info: A non-descript figure has been reported lurking in the tunnels of this treatment plant, and workers have also heard voices coming from behind the tunnel walls. A paranormal investigator was called in, though his findings were inconclusive.

title: Emily Kaye
location: Eastbourne - The Crumbles, between town and Pevensey along coast.
info: Murdered in the town, Emily Kaye's (or Emily Bielby in some accounts) ghost, in the form of a white figure, was soon seen near the site of her murder. A blue/white light would also be reported by people walking the area at night. Another ghost, Irene Munro, was also reported in the area - she, too, was murdered.

title: Striding Man
info: A witness spotted a dark, slightly hutched figure striding along this alley. The figure moved silently and despite the appearance of walking, almost seemed to glide across the ground. The witness briefly lost sight of the figure, during which time, it vanished with seemingly nowhere to have gone.

title: Three Hounds
info: Seeing one shuck is often thought of as an ill omen - the three which seem to haunt this area in a pack are a guaranteed bad portent.

title: Screaming
location: Pluckley - Area around the Brickworks, Pluckley Heath
info: To hear the screaming ghost is not uncommon in this area and is reported to be quite bloodcurdling. A witness who heard the scream in 1991 said that they were familiar with fox noises and the ghost's cries did not resemble those of the creature. In 2021 two witnesses were left 'spooked' as they drove past the Brickworks and passed through a localised mist which contained pocket-like holes.

title: Flickering Light
info: Sounds of knocking can be heard coming from beneath the church at night, often accompanied by a flickering and fluttering light inside the empty building. Some say the light belongs to Lady Dering, buried within three lead coffins to prevent her decay. The churchyard is reputed to be haunted by a red lady, wandering the area in search of her missing baby. Finally, the inside of the church is also said to be haunted by a woman in mid-twentieth century clothing.

title: Victorian Woman
info: This pub is said to be home to a phantom woman in Victorian clothing who lurks by the bar.

title: Pleased to Meet you...
info: An unknown bush in the village can be used to summon the Devil, by dancing three (or thirteen) times around it, and/or saying (or not saying) a spell.

title: Headmaster
info: Taking his own life in the 1800's, the phantom headmaster was observed by an author in the mid-twentieth century; the entity wore stripy trousers and an old coat.

title: Walker
info: Blamed for poltergeist activity, a phantom walker was once said to frequent the farmhouse. There are also reports of a haunting smell (burning yarn or wool) and the ghost of Old Bill, who sits on the end of a bed and talks to himself.

title: Dying Highwayman
info: A large spectral tree has been seen here, together with a highwayman pinned to it by several swords. On other occasions, an elderly phantom woman is spotted; thought to be a gypsy woman, she accidentally set herself on fire with her pipe while sleeping.

title: Miller
location: Pluckley - Mill Hill, location where ruined mill once stood, near the Pinnock
info: This location is haunted by both a miller and a gypsy woman, the latter said to have burnt to death on the site.

title: Colonel
info: This woodland, levelled in 1965, was home to a phantom officer who had hanged himself on the site.

title: Alarm
info: Two employees would be woken at 02:15h by their alarms over a two week period, although neither had set their devices. The figure of a young woman quickly vanished after being spotted by one employee, and a cat would appear in the building before disappearing in areas with no possible exist. Finally, men (but never women) would find one room particularly disturbing, with builders refusing to work within and guests leaving during the night.

title: Tutor Lady
info: This reputed female phantom could be heard calling out for her hounds, although it is said that she has not been heard for many years. The woman is said to have committed suicide by eating poisonous berries.

title: Screams
info: A local legend says that the screams which emerge from the woodland belong to those who became lost and died amongst the trees.

title: Dog Walkers
location: Pluckley - Station Road, area around Greystones House
date: Couple unknown, monk reported seen in 1971
info: Victims of the all-too-common love triangle that ends in suicide, this couple and their little dog can be heard walking and chatting down this area of the road. Greystones itself is reputedly home to a phantom monk.

title: Flaming Woman
location: Pluckley - Surrenden House (original house no longer standing)
info: Contemporary newspapers reported that a visitor to the house spotted a burning woman holding a baby running along the driveway. The witness fainted, and by the time she had recovered, the figure had vanished. Another entity, possibly later the same day, was said to have tried to strangle another woman in her bed (although the newspaper speculated this event occurred because of the day's excitement).

title: Invisible Hand
location: Pluckley - The Black Horse Public House
info: This non-alcoholic spirit moves items across the bar, tidies, and sometimes hides coats and wallets. The site is also home to disembodied screaming.

title: Horses & Carriage
info: Seen trotting down the main street, the history of the carriage pulled by two horses (or four, depending on the source) is unknown.

title: Taxi Fare
info: A taxi driver reported seeing a man on the roadside who flagged the taxi down. The fare climbed into the back of the cab, but when the driver turned around to ask his passenger where he was heading, he found the car empty.

title: Fox Terrier
info: Elliott O'Donnell wrote that a medium who receded here believed her home to be haunted by several cats, which were mistreated by a former owner of the property. The medium also detected the presence of a fox terrier.

title: Murdered Sailor
location: Portsmouth - Blue Posts Inn (destroyed by fire in 1870)
info: This inn was haunted by the ghost of a sailor murdered therein. His corpse was secretly buried in the courtyard, though in 1938 a gravestone was placed in the area thought to house the body.

title: Angry Man
location: Portsmouth - Building (since demolished) along Alexandra Road
info: Multiple occupants of this building reported foul smells, scratches, disembodied voices and footsteps, furniture and fixings moving on its own and handprints on walls that would not disappear. Portsmouth City Council are reported to have brought in a medium, although the visit had no effect. Said to have been an angry male, the activity finally ceased when the building was demolished.

title: Jumping Keyboard
location: Portsmouth - Cash Converters, London Road, Fratton
info: Two workers in Cash Converters reported seeing an analogue synthesiser fly three metres across the shop floor, hitting a CD rack. The former owner of the keyboard told the manager she had sold the item because of experiencing similar problems at home.

title: Frog Fall
info: Many tiny frogs were said to have fallen from the sky during heavy rainfall.

title: Buckingham
location: Portsmouth - Former Greyhound public house, now a private residence
info: The site where John Felton assassinated the Duke of Buckingham was widely believed to be haunted by the tragic figure.

title: George and Emily
info: The ghosts of two children, Emily and George, are said to be among the nine (or ten) phantoms at home within this Georgian Theatre.

title: Jack Aitken
info: Hanged for attempting to commit arson in a naval dockyard, Aitken's body was then displayed in a gibbet - the chains of which can still be heard clinking in the wind.

title: First World War Soldiers
info: A woman walking down the road walked by a detachment of soldiers travelling in the opposite direction. She noticed they were wearing an old style of uniform. It was only when she looked back and realised the soldiers had vanished did she know she had witnessed something strange.

title: Shaking Bed
location: Portsmouth - HMNB Portsmouth, HMS Nelson, Saumarez block (now demolished)
info: A witness reported waking up after the room fell cold. He could feel something sitting on his legs, but nothing could be seen. After several minutes, the bed began shaking violently, and the witness felt his legs being lifted slightly, before the top half of his body was also lifted at a forty five degree angle.

title: Flashing Lights
info: It was reported that journalists working on the Navy News newspaper would see flashes of light emerging from the corridor outside their office. An uncomfortable feeling would accompany the light.

title: Buster Crabb
info: One of two hotels claiming Crabb spending his final night here, the Navy frogman is said to haunt the building. Crabb vanished while attempting to spy on a Soviet warship which docked at Portsmouth during the Cold War.

title: Footless Figure
info: Standing alone at the empty station, a commuter suddenly spotted a man wearing a 1940s suit standing at the opposite end of the platform. The slightly transparent figure did not have any facial features and, despite also lacking feet, started to walk towards the commuter, who fled in terror. The commuter refused to return to the site and subsequently used another station to travel.

title: Clothes Thrower
location: Portsmouth - Private house along Agincourt Road
info: At its peak, the entity in the house pushed an occupant down the stairs. It also scattered clothing around rooms and snatched items from people's hands. A blessing performed at the house was said to make things worse.

title: Landing Figure
location: Portsmouth - Private residence, Buckland Park area
info: The poltergeist activity in this home included items being thrown and pictures falling from the wall. A figure observed on the landing may have also been seen walking up the stairs.

title: Scratching
info: A homeowner was forced to move after experiencing several years of scratching noises, footsteps, and having the duvet removed from the bed during the night.

title: Chair Thrower
info: Figures could be seen walking through the kitchen into the larder, knocks would rattle on the doors, and items thrown or occasionally hidden before turning up in unusual places.

title: Man in Navy Uniform
info: A family living in a property here were subjected to kitchen equipment moving unaided, exploding lightbulbs and the smell of cigars, although no-one smoked. A child would talk to a male figure wearing navy uniform with cuts over his face.

title: Victorian Woman
info: A family ultimately decided to move from this property after five members encountered the apparition of a Victorian woman who would manifest in the corner of a bedroom. Poltergeist activity also resulted in items being moved around the house, disembodied footsteps, and a mirror thrown at two people on the stairwell.

title: Chair Thrower
info: Chairs would repeatedly be thrown from a table while the occupant cleaned the kitchen floor. Pictures were also propelled across the room. An eerie sensation could be felt in the back bedroom, as if that part of the building did not belong to the front of the house.

title: Evaporating Man
location: Portsmouth - Railway bridge, St Mary's Road
info: A driver slowed to take a better look at a man who stood on the side of the bridge which did not have a footpath. The driver thought that the man did not 'look right', which was proved correct as the driver watched the figure evaporate in the rear view mirror.

title: Black Mask Attacker
location: Portsmouth - Royal Arena wrestling venue (later became New Theatre Royal)
info: A wrestler known as the Black Mask claimed he was attacked in the Rutley dressing room by an unseen presence. Several dancers also complained about the atmosphere in the room. The building's owner denied the site was haunted.

title: Pool of Blood
location: Portsmouth - Royal Portsmouth Hospital (no longer standing)
info: Local folklore says that the operating theatre had a pool of blood on the floor which could never be cleaned, no matter how hard the staff tried to remove it.

title: Buster Crabb
info: One of two hotels laying claim to Crabb spending his final night here, the Navy frogman is said to haunt the building. Crabb vanished while attempting to spy on a Soviet warship which docked at Portsmouth during the Cold War.

title: Murdered People
location: Portsmouth - Site of the White Garter public house
info: When the White Garter was pulled down, dozens of bodies were found under the building - it is thought that a landlady and a male 'friend' murdered and stole goods from many of their guests. The ghosts of the murdered people are restless and have been seen around the public house or felt as they pull the sheets off beds.

title: Figure
info: While the church was used for storage, a rumour existed of a ghostly figure which haunted the site. More recently, a local legend speaks about ghostly nuns in the area, although there is nothing to suggest there was a nunnery here.

title: Dark Figure
info: Having worked in the building before many times without incident, a member of the chaplaincy team had two fleeting glances of a dark figure standing on the balcony, looking over the edge as if watching the witness. The figure was described as curious and unthreatening.

title: Looking for Child
info: A ghostly woman in a dressing gown was once said to wander the hospital looking for her baby, who had died of unknown complications.

title: Actor
info: A brown coloured figure was once seen sitting in the empty theatre. A piano was recorded playing a single note in the building after closing time when all the doors had been closed and locked. Another story says an actor who cut his own throat here in the 1880's is said to remain earthbound.

title: Stirring
location: Portsmouth - Unidentified house, St Mary's Road
info: This entity created a nuisance by ripping buttons off clothing, thumping on the staircase, and creating a rattling which resembled a shaving brush being stirred in a tin cup. One man twice witnessed a white figure on the staircase.

title: Victorian Barmaid
location: Portsmouth - White Swan inn, Guildhall Walk
info: This unfortunate woman was murdered by her violent husband after he returned from sea.

title: Children
info: The oldest building in the city, Wymering Manor is said to be home to several apparitions and cold spots. The sounds of children whispering have also been reported, although one former resident went on record as saying the phantoms were 'quite nice and quite friendly'.

title: Old Man in Black
info: A couple staying at this bed and breakfast reported seeing an old man dressed in black standing over their bed, looking angry and agitated. Both dismissed the shade as a dream until they spoke to each other the following morning and realised both had seen the ghost.

title: Man in Top Hat & Tails
info: This old man has been seen on the landing, before heading off into the toilet and vanishing.
