title: Shepherd
info: Seen several times around the early hours of the morning, this figure is watched as he walks across the field and heads towards the river.

title: Author Helper
info: One time home of Henry James, he claimed that the ghost of an old lady here gave him assistance whilst writing. Other owners have reported poltergeist like activity, and while sitting in the garden, EF Benson watched a caped man walk by before vanishing. One story says the building is also haunted by Allen Grebell, murdered by a butcher.

title: Duel
info: Several shades haunt this public house. A pair of ghostly duellers have been seen engaging each other with rapiers (the victor then drags the body through the hotel and drops it through a trapdoor), while a female figure dressed in grey haunts the upper part of the building. Room 5 is one of her haunts, while in rooms 10 and 18, a fading man has been seen entering and leaving (often through a wall).

title: Line of Monks
info: The ghostly monks which haunted the hall and garden may have been related to several skeletons dug up in the garden; evidence pointed to the burials being performed on living people.

title: Footsteps
location: Rye - Needles Passage, off Ports Street
info: Echoing footsteps have been heard approaching witnesses as they walk down is passageway, though no one is visible as they pass. A local piece of folklore says it is unlucky to step on the stone with the date of construction unless you have already had your birthday that year.

title: Footsteps
info: Loud footsteps have been heard moving up and down the staircase in the farmhouse, and the phantom of a man has also been reported moving about the house at night.

title: Little Girl Lost
location: Rye - The Union Inn, East Street
info: Seen walking in the restaurant and kitchen of this old building, this little ghost is often mistaken for someone real.

title: Two Women
info: Several spectres are said to haunt this area of town. The two women have been observed walking down Mermaid Street wearing long gowns, while a lonesome girl in blue has been seen crossing the street. Watchbell Street is the haunt of a little boy dressed in a white sheet, and disembodied footsteps (thought to belong to a young girl), through these are no longer heard, and the Olde Tuck Shoppe along Market Street is home to a lady in grey.

title: Gobbling Monk
info: This lane is apparently named after the sounds a monk made when he went mad; this was after he was bricked up alive for trying to elope. He is still seen on the odd occasion, though no longer heard.

title: Kitchen Ghost
info: The kitchen has had its contents rearranged several times, and various food stuffs mixed up and hidden. Sometimes the activities migrate towards the bedrooms, though they always come back.

title: Broken Windows
location: Winchester - Caer Gwent House (no longer standing), Abbey Hill Road
info: After windows were smashed, the occupants who took over the site in 1947 discovered that the military unit which had been previously stationed at the house had experienced moving furniture and other 'such things'.

title: Man in Three Corner Hat
info: Seen by a prisoner in the building, this ghost disappeared as it walked through a wall. As a side point, the hall is also home to King Arthur's round table, though it is likely to be a fake.

title: Limping Monk
info: This brown coloured entity hobbles down the closed street.

title: Man in Silver Suit
location: Winchester - Chilcomb Road, near the A272
info: A couple out driving had to pull over as their car it began to shake out of control. They noticed a large cigar shaped object with three faces peering out nearby, and a bearded man dressed in a silver suit moving towards them. The strange entities then vanished, and the couple were able to drive away normally.

title: Sir John's Father
info: Sir John Fulford claimed to have seen his father sitting in a chair at Fulford House. Sir John asked the figure why he had returned from hunting early, only to watch his father fade away. A short time later news reached the household that the man had died while hunting. Family folklore stated that the ghost of any recently deceased family member would briefly appear in the chair.

title: Clanking Woman
info: This entity has been reported in the part of the building that housed cottages and a small printing press, which has been offered as an explanation to the sound which accompanies her.

title: Starving Woman
info: This ghost, when flesh and bone, was turned away from the Tavern during a cold winter's night. She died soon after, and to take revenge, her ghost took up residence in the building. The spirit now pulls bedding off sleeping guests.

title: Henry
info: Hanged somewhere close to the inn for theft, the shade now torments the bar staff by periodically playing with the pumps.

title: A Man Vanishes
location: Winchester - Office building along the High Street
info: Two men sitting in the manager's room eating lunch spotted a figure climbing the stairs, heading towards the top office. No-one should have been in that area, so both men ran upstairs to apprehend the intruder. However, there was no one present, and it would have been impossible for an intruder to pass the men without being seen.

title: King Alfred
info: King Alfred's remains were originally buried at the Old Minster, but the monks claimed Alfred's ghost would walk around at night - the King was moved to the New Minster.

title: Tall Man
location: Winchester - Private house along Quarry Road
info: A tall man wearing a black cloak, a woman dressed in white, and a figure resembling a nun are all said to have haunted this property. Two exorcisms failed to remove the entities.

title: Running Blood?
info: As the pub closed for installation of a mini-cinema, landlord Rob Plunton said that the site was rumoured to be haunted but did not elaborate further. One story says that blood is said to run down the walls of the cellar.

title: Maid
info: One story says the upper part of the building is haunted by a maid. One visitor reported seeing a head-sized shadow briefly appear on a wall behind a sofa before vanishing; they tried to recreate the shadow but was unable to do so.

title: Lady Lisle
info: Beheaded opposite the pub for assisting local rebels, the tall grey shade of Alice Lisle now haunts the area where she spent her last night on earth. This is one of three locations reportedly haunted by Lady Lisle.

title: Lighting Operator
location: Winchester - Theatre Royal (was the Market Hotel)
info: An apparition was seen dressed in combat clothing. A witness identified the ghostly soldier as a former lighting operator who worked at the theatre before going off to die on a First World War battlefield. The builder of the theatre, John Simpkins, is also said to haunt the building.

title: Ballerina Alien
info: Councillor Adrian Hicks recalled in 2009 his encounter with an alien entity along a busy street. He described the creature as having large oval eyes, looking almost human, and wearing a tutu. The alien shuffled along the street like a penguin.

title: Monks
info: Disappearing at the knees, these phantom monks reportedly walk on the original floor of the building. In 1957 a photographer caught several male figures dressed in medieval garb. Saint Swithun is buried outside the cathedral, as per his wish - on one fateful 15 July, his body was moved inside the building; the rain began to fall and did not stop until Swithun's body was moved back outside. Now, popular legends say that if it rains on 15 July (St Swithun's Day), it will rain for another forty days.

title: Goblins
info: The same is supposed to have been derived from 'Puck walls' and is speculated to come from long-gone haunted ruins.

title: Peggy Bray
info: A former landlady of the pub, Peggy has been known to return to ensure all is running smoothly.

title: Mary the Housekeeper
location: Altarnun - Penhallow Vicarage (now a private house)
info: Mary had an affair with the Revenant Tripp - she ended the relationship by drowning herself in the nearby river. Her grey dressed ghost has been seen standing by the back door and in one of the bedrooms, while the phantom footsteps heard pacing around late at night are thought to belong to Tripp.

title: Knockers
location: Bedruthan - Beach, cliff top, & Bedruthan Steps
info: Some believe these creatures to resemble mutant dwarfs (two foot high, large eyes with deformed and twisted heads), while others call them the ghosts of those killed while being forced to work for the Romans... Either way, they can be heard mining and picking away at the rocks underground in these areas.

title: Guest
location: Blisland - Blisland Inn (was Royal Oak Hotel)
info: A guest at the inn died on the site and took to haunting the inn.

title: Grunting
location: Bodmin - Bodmin Jail (no longer a prison)
info: After spending a night at the jail in 2005, a ghost hunting group reported recording EVP containing a strange grunt. Members of the organisation also reported having stones thrown at them, even though they were alone. A couple of years prior to this, a woman had a feeling of great uneasiness when visiting the site and left perturbed when a door slammed shut in front of her with no visible reason for closing. A 2013 visitor reported a loud grunt in their left ear, also heard by another witness just over a metre away.

title: Golden Coffin
info: Protected by a flock of birds, two golden coffins were believed to be buried under the cairns.

title: Beast of Bodmin
info: Another famous cryptid, the Beast of Bodmin is thought by some to be a large black cat, while others believe the creature is more paranormal in nature. Regardless, dozens of sightings span years.

title: Grey Lady
info: This entity haunts the gallery and the drawing room, the only parts of the original house that still stand (a fire in the nineteenth century destroyed the rest of the house). The building is also said to be haunted by a man hanged by Royalists during the Civil War.

title: Jan Tregeagle
info: As punishment for killing his wife and children, Jan's ghost returns to the pool every night, attempting to empty the contents with a broken shell. A pack of ghostly wild dogs watch over him should he try to escape. One version of the same tale states Tregeagle did escape, but now he sweeps the sand from Porthcurno Cove to Mill Bay; he can be heard screaming as the sea washes the sand back again. Locals would refuse to say Tregeagle's name in case the ghost manifested. The Pool is also the supposed location where Sir Bedivere returned Excalibur.

title: Kobolds
info: One tin mine shaft was nicknamed the Roaring Shaft after the many bangs and thuds heard emanating from the empty tunnel. Kobolds or Bucca were held accountable.

title: Loud Footfalls
location: Bodmin Moor - Manor House inn, Rilla Mill
info: Heard coming from upstairs, these footsteps are always tracked down to the same empty bedroom.

title: Golden Cup
info: Locals told of a ghostly druid that walked this area offering all he came across a drink from a golden cup that could never be fully emptied. When the barrow was excavated in 1818, a gold beaker was recovered next to a skeleton, both thought to be at least 2000 years old.

title: Charlotte Dymond
location: Bodmin Moor - Roughtor (aka Rough Tor), near a memorial stone to Charlotte
info: While Charlotte's boyfriend was hanged for her murder, it is widely believed he was innocent; this could be the reason why Charlotte has returned, dressed in a gown and silk bonnet.

title: Monks
info: This area of woodland has produced an abundance of supernatural sightings over the years, the majority pertaining to ghostly hooded monks. A stooping old man has been observed standing by the water. In July 1981, one witness saw a burning human skull in a tree after hearing many whispering voices, although being alone.

title: Treasure
location: Bolenowe Carn Moor - Uncle Ned's Rock
info: Who Uncle Ned was is unknown, but his name is remembered as a local legend says he buried his treasure somewhere near the rock which bears his name.

title: Drinking Sailor
date: Mostly unknown, large dog in April 2015
info: A sailor who was murdered nearby reportedly returns to the public house to finish his last drink; he has been seen sitting on the wall outside the building. There have also been reports of a ghostly floating cloak, while outside there was a report of a phantom man hanging by his neck from a nearby tree. In 2015 a witness reported seeing a semi-transparent phantom dog, the size of an Irish Wolfhound, running thirty centimetres above the ground.

title: Green Car
location: Bolventor - Road between town and Five Lanes
info: Seen by at least two independent witnesses at different times, this old fashioned car contains four men who appear to be laughing, before the vehicle vanishes.

title: Spinning Maid
location: Bosava - Trewoof Manor House (no longer standing)
info: This shade was said to have been laid in a room which was subsequently bricked up, though released many years later by a curious night worker who could hear noises coming from behind the brickwork...

title: The Devil and the Cobbler
location: Bosava (?) - House no longer standing, location not known
info: Built by a cobbler who made a deal with Old Nick and went back on his word, the house became haunted by the man and the devil. A miller who lived nearby was losing money due to his proximity to the location and asked Parson Corker to banish both entities. The parson brought some friends, set up his magic circle and after a mighty battle (involving a storm which levelled most trees in the area) banished the Devil. The ghost proved more difficult to banish, and in the end the house was demolished.

title: Man in Tweed
info: Fishermen were reported to have encountered a strange man dressed in tweed who would stare at them before vanishing.

title: Plucker
info: Nicknamed Plucker, this poltergeist moves small items, causes pictures to fall off walls, and tugs at people's clothing.

title: Bells
location: Boscastle - Off coast, close to Forrabury Church?
info: Bells made for this church were cast and blessed, but as the ship carrying them approached the church, the captain claimed that he, not God, had transported the bells safely. A storm suddenly blew in, sinking the ship and taking the bells to the bottom of the sea.

title: Colonel Hawker
date: Colonel unknown, horse on calm nights (reoccurring)
info: Footsteps belonging to this officer are said to wander around the property, while a figure has been seen passing by windows. The road outside the house is haunted by a horse, and a piece of local folklore claims secret tunnels connect the building to the beach.

title: Tolling Bell
info: The tolling of a phantom bell said to either foretell a shipwreck in the area, or the sound itself comes from an old sunken ship.

title: Coachman
info: This figure, complete with frilly shirt and ponytail, has been watched as he disappears though a wall near reception. The ghost of a young lady who committed suicide by leaping from a tower attached to the building has also been seen drifting forlornly in the area.

title: Magical Giant
date: Said to have taken place every 01 August (when giant was alive)
info: A giant who lived nearby was said to use this site once a year for magical rites and was happy for local people to watch.

title: Arthur's Table
info: Once a year, King Arthur's table is said to surface from the mound, briefly waiting for the man to sit at it once more.

title: Dorothy Durant
location: Botathan (near Launceston) - Field named Higher Broomfield
info: A young boy encountered the same female ghost on his way to school, as he crossed Higher Broomfield, for several days. After falling ill, the boy told his family about his encounters. They in turn told his teacher, John Ruddle, Vicar of Alternan. The Vicar walked with the boy across the field and also encountered the girl. By convincing other local people to join him, Ruddle identified the girl as Dorothy Durant. Ruddle also became aware that Dorothy was trying to speak, but the words were so faint that no one could hear them. The vicar exorcised the ghost, upon doing so he was able to hear what she said - a great pestilence would descend upon the land.

title: Hang Proof
info: A local legend says that any child baptized in the well water here will not be hanged.

title: Sea Serpent
info: This creature was reported by the vicar of the local parish - he reported it moved at around 25 miles per hour and left an oily wake.

title: Vanishing Figure
info: A gardener spotted a shadowy figure in the locked building, which vanished after he gained access. The bell of the HMS Bude which hangs on site supposedly rings unaided.

title: Fisherman
info: The inn is reputedly home to a phantom old fisherman and a ghostly smuggler. A witness outside the front of the inn, smoking a cigarette after the bar had closed, heard a set of disembodied footsteps pass by and around the pub.

title: Robed Figure
info: This black, monk like figure was seen to rise and float along a corridor near the bathroom.

title: Cure for a Cough
info: This well is reported to cure whooping cough.

title: Lady in White
info: A young lady dressed completely in white is said to haunt this building. The ghost would descend the main staircase. Phantom music has also been reported in the house.

title: Bloodstain
info: A part of the bridge is reportedly stained by blood from a murder that occurred long ago - nothing has ever been able to shift the mark (although it is said to be now painted over).

title: Miners
info: This area of road is said to be haunted by a group of miners wearing out fashioned outfits and carrying candles.

title: Man in Black
info: This ghostly figure standing at the cove faded away as two witnesses approached him.

title: Parson Richards
info: Two miners spotted Parson Richards outside his church, wailing while rattling chains. Concerned for his wellbeing, the miners approached, only to be berated by Richards who claimed to be chasing an evil spirit to hell. The church also contained a well that bestowed wisdom to the villagers, although when mines were sunk nearby, the water drained away.

title: Horse and Carriage
date: 24 December, midnight (reoccurring) every ten years, last seen 1912
info: A spectral horse and carriage are said to pull up in front of this house. A phantom couple exit the vehicle then disappear upon reaching the doorstep.

title: Mr Vivian
info: A man in old fashioned clothing was supposed to haunt this building and was named as a member of the Vivian family.

title: White or Black Figures
location: Camborne - St Martin and St Meriadoc Church
info: Two women passing by the church late at night both spotted something strange but did not mention it until they reached their destination. One said that she had seen a couple of white figures appear by the tower and disappear by the rectory, while the other woman claimed to have seen a procession of figures in black wearing Quaker hats.

title: Turtle Dove
date: Prior to a death in the Basset family
info: An ill-omen, a turtle dove is said to appear to a member of the Basset family before a death.

title: Cyclist
location: Camelford - Road between town and Bodmin
info: This grey figure was seen pedalling away along the road before vanishing without warning.

title: Faceless Man
location: Carbis - Road between village and Lelant, between Longstone and Boskerris Road
info: A woman walking home spotted a man in a tall hat standing by a bush. She expected the man to say, 'good evening', but as she neared the figure, realised he had a blank space where his face should have been. She ran home and promptly fainted upon arrival. No one believed her story until a local preacher admitted he had also seen the figure.

title: Ringing Bell
info: The gentle pealing of a small bell could be heard by many people over a period of years. It was widely believed to indicate the presence of a kindly unknown entity.

title: John of Gaunt
location: Carn Brea - Stones on nearby hill
info: The giant John would often throw boulders at neighbouring giants, who would toss them back at him - hence, the hillside is covered in large rocks. The giant's remains are said to be buried somewhere on the site.

title: No Hanging
info: With its waters tainted with magical properties, no one who bathed in this well would be hanged, so they said.

title: Crushed Friend
info: A giant who once lived here (occasionally named as Holiburn of the Carn) was visited by a human friend. After a few games of quoits, the human had to leave. The giant patted his friend's head in a playful way, unfortunately forgetting his own strength - his fingers pieced the human's head, killing the man instantly. The giant died of a broken heart seven years later.

title: Motorbike
location: A377 - Between Copplestone and Morchard Bishop
info: Two people travelling along this road could hear a motorbike approaching their car from behind. The bike could not be seen, but clearly heard as it overtook the car and accelerated away. Both witnesses were left shaken by their encounter.

title: Glasses
info: As well as the 'normal' sounds of disembodied footsteps, the other phantom sound often reported is the clinking of glasses from an empty room.

title: Fading Monk
location: Abbotskerswell - Area around St Augustine's Priory (no longer standing)
info: The ghost of a monk was reported in the nineteenth century as haunting the roads in this area, though has not been reported as of late. A phantom nun was reported in the same area in 2015.

title: Misty Man
info: After moving in to their flat, a couple were subjected to a manifesting male figure who appeared in their living room. Ornaments would also be moved by an unseen hand. An exorcism drove the ghost out, only for the entity to move into an adjoining flat. The occupants here appear to have been more tolerant and learned to live with the ghost.

title: Ringing
info: At midnight, a ringing church bell woke the Crosse household, who were staying at the manor at the time. The Crosse family asked neighbours about the ringing the following morning, to be told that the bell only rang to foretell of a death in the Pine-Coffin family. It was later discovered that a member of that family had died in India at the time of the ringing.

title: Sobbing Child
info: A crying child has been reported in the upper part of the building, as have sounds of children running around.

title: Floating Lights
location: Ashburton - Skies north of the village
info: Admiralty Intelligence Officers investigated a series of strange lights which were seen in the skies over the area by multiple witnesses. The investigating officers also watched the lights rise into the air and vanish. The officers' report suggested that the lights may have been attached to a balloon used to lift wireless equipment to enable German spies to contact the mainland, although no evidence could be found.

title: Death Warning
date: Prior to a death in the family
info: This shade haunts the upper part of the building prior to family tragedy.

title: Emily
info: Two ghosts haunt this site. The first, Emily, is said to be young, and died after being hit by a cart outside the pub. The second phantom is a former landlady with grey hair, and may have manifested to an old landlord.

title: Fireplace Man
info: This hot shade can be seen in the embers of a fireplace here.

title: Vanishing Man
info: While working late and alone, a witness spotted a man standing in the farmyard. The man promptly vanished.

title: Hanging Servant
info: One of three shades found here, this servant's shade could be seen dangling from a rope over one of the staircases. The other ghosts are of a naval officer (who can be heard shouting and swearing) and that of a ferryman.

title: Walker
info: A ghostly man is said to walk along this road before vanishing.

title: Lady de la Pole
info: Hanged in the garden for being a Royalist during the Civil War, Lady de la Pole now continues to walk the grounds of the building. There are also reports of a phantom feline that looks quite normal, until it walks through something solid.

title: Tom Faggus
info: Two people witnessed the ghost of a man riding a large horse in this area. The witnesses carried out some research and believe they had encountered the ghost of Tom Faggus, a Robin Hood-like figure who operated in the area.

title: Boot
info: A man staying at this inn for a few nights reported being woken by the sound of someone talking in the room. The witness also said that he had photographed 'part of a leg with a dark boot' in the same room, although the image was accidently deleted.

title: Fred
info: The spirit at work within this building could be that of a worker who fell from the roof during repair work in 1931 - he died a week after the accident.

title: Puma
info: This large black cat was seen loitering close to the town centre.

title: Mucay and Justy
info: Ken Mucay and Bob Justy were named by a medium as the two ghosts haunting this council building, both dying in their 50s, though many years separated their deaths.

title: Photographed Figure
location: Barnstaple - Nineteenth century burial site (may no longer exist)
info: After a rumour started that a ghost had been seen in this disused site, a man claimed to have photographed the spirit rising from a grave. The image was displayed in his window; it is unclear whether any copies of the photograph exist today.

title: Jack
info: Jack had a fatal heart attack in the park during the early part of the twentieth century. Since then, his shade has been creating mischief in the green space.

title: Headless Woman
info: While the smell of lavender is often reported, without any apparent source, the headless ghost, dressed in blue silk, has not been observed for years.

title: Smuggler
info: After the sound of an impossible to open trapdoor slamming shut woke a family for fourteen consecutive nights, they called a medium who claimed it was caused by a smuggler/fisherman. The entity was told to leave, but could occasionally return, his presence denoted by the smell of smoke. A phantom old woman is also said to haunt the site.

title: Door Opener
info: This polt is blamed for slamming doors in the upper part of the building.

title: Blue Lady de Pomeroy
info: After being raped by her father, this former member of the de Pomeroy family now haunts the ruins of the building for the crime of killing her own child. The child has also been heard crying and screaming in the building. The castle also lays claim to possessing a phantom cavalier, and a ghostly black dog.

title: Margaret
location: Berry Pomeroy - Dungeon, Margaret Tower, Berry Pomeroy Castle
info: Left to starve to death in the dungeon by her sister (they both chased after the same suitor), Margaret now haunts the area. Visitors have reported feeling something brush past them on the staircase down to the room.

title: Alexander Cruwys
location: Bickleigh - Bridge over the River Exe
info: This shade returns once a year to the place where he murdered a man, throwing the body over the bridge into the waters below.

title: Laughing
info: The soft laughter of an invisible female has been heard around the bar, which is unrelated to the headless horseman who lurks outside.

title: Chef
info: A former owner of the inn watched the shade come out of a cupboard in the kitchen and stand by a side unit, before fading away.

title: Lady Rolle
location: Bicton - Gate of the Dutch garden
info: A gardener reported seeing Lady Rolle after her death by a gate.

title: Spooky Sound
location: Bideford - Old Zoo House (no longer standing?)
info: A group of teenagers visiting this rumoured haunted house felt a presence and heard a strange sound, although one witness acknowledged it may have been their minds playing tricks on them!

title: Figures
info: Over a five year period, the family living here experienced several strange occurrences, including seeing different figures (including recently deceased family members, as well as unknown people) and smelling the overpowering aroma of lavender.

title: Pact
info: A witch once claimed (likely under duress) that she met the Devil in human form along this road, where she made a deal with him. As a side note, the Devil is thought to have tried to hamper the construction of the bridge here.

title: Mrs Bell
location: Bideford - Unnamed Manor House in the area
info: The Edwardian Mrs Bell would be seen around the corridors of this property in the early hours of the morning, dressed in blue and sometimes to Chopin's tunes being played on the piano. The sightings ceased after a portrait of Bell was discovered and returned to the manor.

title: Black Dog
info: This pub may be haunted by a black dog observed near the bar.

title: Battle of Bovey Heath
location: Bovey Tracey - Bovey Heathfield Local Nature Reserve
info: The site of an English Civil War battle on 9 January 1646, it is said the sights and sounds of fighting are occasionally reenacted.

title: Evil Awaits
info: It was said that the churchyard here was unused for a while due to the belief that the first body interred would belong to the Devil. The body of a servant under the employ of a visitor to the area was buried here, after which others believed the site was ready to be used for their loved ones.

title: Golden Frogs
location: Bovey Tracey - St Mary's Well (aka Golden Well)
info: A poor farming couple provided food and shelter to a strange woman who sought refuge from a storm. The woman then cured the couple's sick child and created a well so they would never go thirsty again. The well became home to a colony of golden frogs.

title: Phantom Smoke
info: At least one guest has been awoken by the overwhelming smell of smoke, though on investigation no source has been found.

title: Black Worms
info: During a snowstorm dozens of little black worms also fell from the sky.

title: Chatting Women
info: A former archaeologist from Cambridge University watched his aging neighbour walk by accompanying another woman dressed in early twentieth century clothing. When he approached the old woman later in the day to enquire who her friend was, she replied that it was a ghost she was in contact with.

title: Bandaged Man
info: A man wearing a bandage around his head was seen in the building on one occasion, though one is more likely to encounter the phantom plainchant of monks or rapping from deserted areas of the cottage. A pair of sisters staying at the cottage alone were kept awake by loud snoring; one of the women said 'if you stop that noise we'll leave tomorrow and never come back!', at which point the phantom sound ceased.

title: Sow
info: The building of the church would be undone at night until the foundations were relaid where a sow with her young were found.

title: William de Tracy
info: De Tracy has been condemned to try to make ropes out of the sand - if he almost reaches his goal, a dog appears and burns the attempt. Another ghost, a phantom nicknamed 'Old White Hat', paces along the banks of the river, calling out for a ferryboat which never arrives.

title: White Lady
info: Two witnesses watched a smoky white female form walk through a wall, cross a room, and vanish into the wall on the opposite side. The apparition was also said to have been spotted just outside the inn by a delivery person.

title: Moving Stones
info: The Devil came to the church's construction site night after night and moved the foundation stones to the top of the tor - the builders finally gave up moving them back so built the church there instead.

title: Lady Howard
info: A coach carrying Lady Howard has been spotted just outside the public house, though it is more likely to just be heard by those nearby.

title: Mary
info: The ghost of little Mary can still be heard crying - it is believed she was the young daughter of a former owner, who fell down the stairs and died from her injuries.

title: Young Lady
info: This female form has been observed only a handful of times over the years - more common are the sounds of disembodied footsteps.

title: Little Red Capped Man
info: The author Violet Tweedale reported seeing a twelve centimetre tall man dressed in green, sitting beneath a small plant. He vanished after a minute of her observing him.

title: Running Shadow
location: Abbotsbury - B3157, between Abbotsbury, Portesham and Chickerell
info: A driver hit the brakes as a shadowy figure ran in front of their car. The driver then watched as the figure disappeared, its legs evaporating before reaching the side of the road.

title: Coin Collector
info: This pub is said to be haunted by a coin collector named Charles (his coins were heard jangling by one witness), a phantom woman in the toilets, and a dog that approaches the windows.

title: Romans
info: The ghosts of Roman Centurions are reputed to haunt the hills in this area.

title: Wishing Holes
info: Inside the chapel are four holes, two for knees, two for hands, where people could kneel and make a wish.

title: Lady who Visits the Sick
info: The first floor of the pub is haunted by a former landlady who only makes her presence known to ill people. There are reportedly another two spooks in the bar area - a soldier dressed in fatigues, and a Victorian gentleman who died after a shotgun blew off most of his head in an accident.

title: White Woman
location: Ashmore - Ashmore - area between Washer's Pit and Spinney's Pond
info: A local story says that a woman hanged over the pit was saved by a washer woman. This did not prevent the woman's ghost from returning to the area when she later died.

title: Clashing Blades
info: A member of the Ghost Club and his partner reported being surrounded by the sounds of men fighting, sword clashing with sword, and the moans of the dying. There are also tales of a golden coffin and stolen treasure buried in the area.

title: Gabbygammies
info: These spirits loiter at the village pond (or, according to another report, the village church) where they moved to after their former home, a local barrow, was opened.

title: What Becomes of the Broken Hearted
info: A woman who died of a scientifically implausible broken heart was said to haunt the inn.

title: Leaping Devil
info: For many years, the church tower only had three pinnacles - the loss of the fourth was blamed on the Devil who tried to jump over the tower while giving chase to a local wizard named Minterne.

title: Criminal
location: Batcombe - Cross Hand Stone (aka Cross in Hand stone), Batcombe Down
info: A felon was tortured on this stone and his bones eventually buried beneath it. The ghost of the man is said to make an occasional appearance. A priest is also have said to have witnessed a pillar of fire at this site.

title: John Daniel
location: Beaminster - Beaminster School, now part of St Mary's Church
info: Thought to have died from a fit, John Daniel was buried after being found dead in a field near his home. Soon after, his ghost was seen in the school, a coffin by his side as he sat at his former desk. A new examination of the body revealed John had been strangled, though his killer was never found.

title: Woman with Bright Pink Eyes
info: The witness, a farmer, reported seeing two figures, one a young boy and the other a woman wearing a long white dress, standing in a field by his livestock. When he shone his flashlight at the people, he could see that the woman had eerie pink eyes. Filled with fear the farmer did not move until the figures disappeared towards the local graveyard, after which the witness ran home.

title: Blue Lady
location: Beaminster - Bridge House, Whitcombe Street (no longer standing)
info: This property was haunted by a tall slim lady wearing high heels. Sightings of her were said to be so frequent that she was treated as a normality. Another more violent entity haunted the guest room, keeping visitors awake during the night by removing bed sheets and pushing over the side table.

title: Coach
location: Beaminster - Lane leading to Stoke Abbott
info: Condemned to drive his coach and four horses along this lane, a wicked landowner haunts this area.

title: Footsteps
info: Phantom footsteps attributed to a Monmouth rebel were once said to haunt this site.

title: Black Dog
location: Belchalwell - Unnamed gate in the area (still standing?)
info: A particular gate in the area was said to be home to a black dog once the sun went down.

title: Golden Table
info: The Anchoret's Well, found within the hillfort, was believed to have a golden table (or tablet) hidden under the waters.

title: Bony Guardian
info: Home to the skull of a slave, the object is said to scream if removed from the house. One former owner threw the skull into a pond, only to fish it out two days later after being kept awake at night by supernatural 'sounds'. The site is also home to phantom coach and horses, and/or a phantom funeral procession.

title: Former Soldier
location: Bettiscombe - Higher Filford Farm, near Bettiscombe
info: This insubstantial warrior is said to haunt one of the rooms which was once used to make cheese.

title: Coach
location: Bettiscombe - Road between Manor and the church
date: One night a year (but date unknown)
info: The phantom coach which leaves the manor and heads towards the church is said to be connected to the manor's skull, but the reasons why are unknown.

title: Wishing Stone
date: 23 June (or Midsummer Eve) and following day (reoccurring)
info: The hill is said to be named after a magical stone that grants wishes. Once a year, on Midsummer Eve, the stone propels down the hill, before returning the following day.

title: Shadowy Man
info: Two train drivers reported hitting a shadowy figure while passing through the tunnel - police investigated the scene of the incident but could find no evidence of an accident.

title: Fairy Song
info: Local superstition states that if you place your ear to the ground here at midday, you can hear the soft singing of fairy folk.

title: Man in Cloak
info: A shadowy figure in a cloak has been observed in the inn.

title: Doggett
location: Blandford Forum - Area near Eastbury Park (no longer standing)
info: A corrupt manservant who stole thousands of pounds from his employer, Doggett finally killed himself, and now drives his phantom horse and carriage along this area. One local story says he returned as a vampire; after his body was exhumed many years after his death (from St Mary's Church in Tarrant Gunville) it was found to be uncorrupted, with a rosy tint to the cheeks.

title: Raped Nurse
info: This figure dressed in white is reportedly a nurse raped and killed near the barracks - her shade has been observed floating around the area, her facial features almost blank.

title: Carriage
location: Blandford Forum - Ashley Wood Golf Club
info: Maybe a story from the nineteenth hole, this golf club is reputedly home to a horse and carriage that can only be heard.

title: Suicides
location: Blandford Forum - Bridge over the River Stour, close to The Crown
info: A small cross on the bridge is said to be the marker where a person committed suicide. A few people have been named as the suicide (including a nun and a nanny), though there is little evidence indicating exactly who the ghost seen here is. A phantom hound it also said to haunt the area, though it is unclear whether is it a shuck.

title: Stone Dogs
info: The stone hounds sitting upon the gatepost are said to occasionally animate at night, going to the nearby river to drink. A floating white figure was reputedly seen along the road near Bryanston woods by a dog walker.

title: Snooker
location: Blandford Forum - Coupar House (now British Legion)
info: This building is said to experience the moving around of small items in the bar, and snooker balls which roll under their own impetus.

title: Woman in Black
info: Wearing a black crinoline dress, this ghostly woman has been observed on the first floor. One of the cleaning staff spotted a woman in black enter a room, but upon investigation, the room was devoid of life. The hotel is also home to a phantom highwayman who hangs about in the courtyard.

title: Decapitated Rider
location: Blandford Forum - Edge of Cranborne Chase, Iwerne Steepleton
info: This unlucky jockey was decapitated by a low hanging branch - he continues to ride the route that killed him.

title: Woman in White
info: A child told her mother that she had seen a white woman drifting towards the house. Her mother dismissed the claim, until they received word that her father had drowned around the same time as the sighting.

title: Dragon Train
location: Blandford Forum - Fields in area which were replaced by railway station (now Edward Street / Alexandra Street area)
info: Baron Ryves was said to have had a vivid dream of a fiery dragon which passed roaring over his land, its chest filled with holes in which people could be seen. The creature disappeared into the ground. The area of land later became a railway line and tunnel. Prophetic or coincidence?

title: Funeral
info: The site of a battle which occurred long ago was said to be home to phantom pallbearers.

title: Flying Bottle
info: It is speculated that the presence that has been known to throw around bottles was a female prisoner. There are also reports of children crying in the upper part of the building.

title: Teenage Girl
info: While in bed hoping to fall asleep, this witness spotted a teenage girl wearing jeans and a striped top standing by a bookcase. The figure vanished and the witness screamed. The witness's parents ran in and told the witness that it was a dream, although the witness was adamant that they had been awake for some time.

title: Fred or Mary
info: Once known as Fred, the ghost that moves small objects and creates phantom footsteps and cold spots was renamed Mary. It is believed she was a local woman due to marry a Second World War US serviceman. Mary was murdered just before her wedding day in the area where the museum was later constructed.

title: Sheep
location: Blandford Forum - Sheep Market Hill and/or Damory Street
info: A herd of phantom, ruminant animals are reputed to walk along this street. Some say the sheep are to be headless, while another version says there is in fact only one sheep (complete with head).

title: Footsteps
info: When devoid of occupants, a neighbour reported hearing loud footsteps and dragging sounds from within the house. Police were called but found nothing untoward.

title: Hand on Shoulder
location: Blandford Forum - Unnamed shop in the town
info: While browsing a shelf, a shopper felt a large hand on her shoulder. She assumed it belonged to her husband who was in the same shop, but as she turned, no one was near her.

title: Hunt
location: Blandford Forum - Woods in the area
info: Thought to be part of a phantom hunt, these ghostly dogs have been heard running and yelping through woodland. It is also thought that a headless shuck haunts the area, though it is less sure whether the entity is connected to the hunt pack.

title: Normal Treasure
location: Bloxworth - Barrows on private field (currently in varying states of damage)
info: It is said that treasure remains under these barrows, though there is no evidence to support this.

title: Human Torch
info: Prior to restoration, the grounds of the manor house were reportedly haunted by the tall, glowing apparition of a man.

title: First World War Soldier
info: This incorporeal soldier of Indian heritage appears here once a year to help himself to a drink of water. There are also a few reports of phantom horses and carriages being seen outside the building, while a ghostly cat is also said to haunt several of the town hall rooms.

title: Figures in Brown
info: Seen in a garden on this estate, several little people dressed in brown played in and around the bushes before being scared off.

title: Lillie
info: The story is that this building was commissioned in 1877 by Edward VII as gift for his mistress Lillie Langtry. The house became an hotel in the 1930s, and during the 1970s, the grey form of a woman, thought to be Langtry, was spotted several times by the hotel's chef. All this told, there is no historical documentation which links the building to Langtry - the story looks as if it was constructed around the 1940s, which means that the ghostly grey lady remains unidentified.

title: White Lady
location: Bournemouth - Millhams Lane, and surrounding Longham area
date: February (reoccurring); last confirmed in 1970s, but legends say she continues
info: The area around the A348 bridge is reportedly haunted by a ghostly white (or grey) woman, killed when hit by a horse and trap along the road. One story says she tries to entice men to jump off the bridge.

title: Woman in White
location: Bournemouth - Outside West Howe Baptist Church, on the corner of Holloway Avenue and Anstey Road
info: A lady dressed in a white gown floated across the road before disappearing through a wall which led to a garden.

title: Coach
info: Possibly the same entity that haunts the park, a coach and team of horses are said to erratically travel along the road which skirts the woodland.

title: Crump
info: Sir John Dutton, nicknamed Crump because of his hunched back, is said to drive a phantom coach and horses under the gates to the park. A white stag may also haunt the parkland.

title: Mrs Budge
info: The ghost of Mrs Budge, wearing traditional Victorian housekeeping garb, was seen sitting in the church. When spoken to, she vanished.

title: Little Old Lady
info: Wearing black clothing and a white lace cap, the phantom old woman who has been seen in these buildings is said to give off an icy aura.

title: Grey Lady
info: One owner of the property reported to the local press that she had seen a lady wearing a long grey dress around the house. Poltergeist activity was also reported.

title: Funeral Procession
location: Arlingham - Through village, heading towards Arlingham Manor
info: Exactly a year after the phantom funeral procession was seen pulling up outside the manor house, the last heir of the family living here died.

title: Funeral Procession
info: This funeral was said to be an ill omen for the family who owned building - exactly a year after the manifestation was seen by several people, the last male heir died.

title: Screaming Parliamentarians
location: Aust - Area near the Severn Bridge
info: This group of phantom soldiers are said to have bullied a ferryman into taking them across the river - he tricked them into leaving his boat too early, and they were washed away.

title: Running
location: Avening - Long Stone (Hampton Fields) and Tingle Stone
info: Both these stones are said to run around their fields as the clock strikes midnight.

title: Lurking Figure
location: Avening - Road between village and Minchinhampton
info: Thought to be the shade of a suicide, this ghost waits alongside the road, but for what is anyone's guess.

title: Edward II Screams
info: Murdered on orders of his wife Queen Isabella (her fate is documented elsewhere in this database), the anniversary of the King's death is marked by his screams echoing around the castle. The skin of an animal was once on display near the entrance; a local legend said it belonged to a giant toad discovered in the dungeon, although it was more likely to belong to a seal.

title: Jenner
info: BBC photographer Chris Sandys caught a strange humanoid shape on film while creating a panoramic photo within the museum. Some believe the image to show Jenner himself, while others believe the image to be an illusion caused by shadow and light.

title: Seaweed
info: Seaweed rained down on this street during a storm. It was speculated that the seaweed was picked up by a weather spout from Clevedon Beach in Somerset, although media outlets did not say if the seaweed was accompanied by any other beach debris, such as sand or marine animals.

title: Coffin
info: A golden coffin is said to be buried in this long barrow.

title: Three Skeletons
info: Three skeletons, two male and one female, were discovered here in 1879. Objects found with the bodies included a silver brooch and a mirror, the value of which led some to speculate the grave belonged to Boudica.

title: Moved Church
info: The church once stood at Church Piece until someone (Devil or angel) moved the building to where it now stands. As a side note, a Roman structure was found at Church Piece, and parts of a Roman altar found in the church walls.

title: Headless Men
info: Two people passing the trump reported seeing several phantom headless men. Treasure is said to be hidden here.

title: Financial Conversation
info: A witness recalled how he stood outside the vestry door, listening to two men talking about money. When he knocked and walked in, the conversation stopped, and the room was empty.

title: Footsteps
info: Two brothers photographing the church by night heard footsteps approaching them on the gravel. They moved aside to let the person pass, but it quickly became apparent no one was there. The brothers could then make out the faint outline of a hooded figure coming closer to where they stood, vanishing when six feet away. The footsteps also ceased, and the brothers were left in silence.

title: Banging
info: Initially, the family living here believed the bangs and crashes they heard throughout the house were created by their neighbours. One visitor heard crockery being smashed, although not a single broken item could be found.

title: Old Man in Trilby
info: After modernising the building, the owners became aware of the presence of an old man, who materialised before the mistress of the house.

title: The Mourning Woman
location: Charfield - Charfield graveyard, memorial to those killed in the Charfield Station rail crash
info: This woman in black, who covers her face with her hands, is widely believed to be the mother of two children killed in a rail disaster which occurred in 1929. Ten people, including the children, who were killed in the train crash could not be formally identified and are buried in a mass grave.

title: Man in 1940s Suit
info: Walter Charnock, a builder working on the renovation of the theatre, encountered a figure wearing a 1940s suit leaning on a banister. Within thirty seconds, the figure vanished. Music is also said to be heard within the building when none should be playing.

title: Nun
location: Cheltenham - Former private school in the town, now flats
info: A teacher and headmaster at the school, working late, both saw a phantom nun crossing the playground - they approached the figure to speak to it, but when their torch ran out of batteries, they ran away.

title: Tall Lady in Black
location: Cheltenham - Garden Reach house, Pitville Circus Road (currently called St Annes?)
info: During the original ten year spell, the woman in black was seen dozens of times, during both daylight and night-time hours. Those who could not see her often reported disembodied footsteps walking down corridors. The ghost may have returned briefly mid-twentieth century; a similar figure was seen by a man, and then again by his brother a couple of years later.

title: Nanny
location: Cheltenham - Hotel de la Bere (former girl's school)
info: A nanny who worked for the school hanged herself in her bedroom, and now walks along the corridors checking rooms to ensure her charges are asleep.

title: Ticking
location: Cheltenham - House along St James Street
info: A ticking could be heard inside the walls of this property, moving from room to room. One of the occupants watched a pram leap into the air, causing the baby inside to start crying. One newspaper said that a 'ticking spider' could be to blame (as a sidenote, ticking spiders were sometimes considered a death omen).

title: Devil's Chimney
info: This limestone outcrop is said to lead straight to hell.

title: Man and His Dog
info: A landlord asked a man standing at the bar with a dog what he would like to drink, only for the patron to vanish when he turned away for a second. The landlord was later shown a picture of a man long dead, who he identified as the disappearing customer.

title: Janitor
info: Several entities are said to haunt this theatre, including a former janitor, a young girl, and an older couple who sit in the auditorium. A photograph taken in 2011 appears to show a small figure sitting on the balcony.

title: Figures
location: Cheltenham - St George's Vaults public house
info: After landlord Del Barnes claimed to have spotted a ghostly figure wearing tweed and had glasses shatter for no reason, a ghost hunting group staked out this public house. Other than 'orbs', aka dust, seen on CCTV, nothing was detected.

title: Tapping
info: Heard in the cellar, this playful spirit knocks whenever anyone goes down into the darkness. As with so many other pub ghosts, she is blamed when items disappear.

title: Kiss Me
location: Cheltenham - Thomas Hardy's House, Victoria Walk
info: The house of Captain Thomas Hardy is reputedly haunted, though by who is unclear.

title: Rattling Chains
info: Large gusts of wind were felt rushing around this public house, normally accompanied by clanking chains in the 1930s, and events grew so bad that the landlord and his family fled. A lady in a blue dress and pinafore, with either long dark hair or a hooded cloak, has been seen more recently; in 2002 she was seen carrying a tray of bottles through a back door.

title: Fisherman
location: Cherington - Unnamed pool in the area
info: A phantom fisherman was reputed to haunt a pool of water around the village - local children were warned against approaching him.

title: Lock Out
info: Many motorists with remote control keys found themselves unable to open their cars until the vehicle was towed to the outskirts of town.

title: Opening Doors
info: Volunteers at the community radio station which moved into the building claimed the location was haunted. Doors opened unaided and strange noises were reported.

title: Relocation
info: The church was due to be built elsewhere, but night after night unseen hands moved the building materials to the top of the hill. The village once self-identified as 'Chosen', perhaps after the supernatural intervention.

title: Waiting Figure
location: Cinderford - Bus stop outside Dilke Hospital (Dilke side of the road)
info: A driver spotted a figure standing at the bus stop - knowing that there was no bus due, the driver stopped to offer the figure a lift, but on doing so, no one was in sight. Eighteen months later, the driver once again drove by the bus stop and the same figure stood there. The driver stopped, but the figure was nowhere to be seen.

title: Betty
info: Betty was executed and burial at a crossroads for the crime of witchcraft. Her ghost has failed to find those who killed her, and now wanders lost around the area near her grave.

title: Old Woman
location: Cirencester - Black Horse Inn, Castle Street
date: 1933, signature existed until 1992 (until window was smashed)
info: A guest awoke in her bedroom only to see an 'evil looking' older woman bathed in green light. The guest screamed and the older woman vanished into a wall, just prior to other people entering the room to investigate the commotion. The following morning the word 'W John' was found scratched into a windowpane, albeit upside down. As the writing was not there the night before, it was assumed the name was scratched into the glass by the ghost.

title: Faceless Figure
info: This ghostly monk has reportedly scared one member of staff into quitting her job and has upset several members of the public with inopportune manifestation and subsequent disappearing. Another ghost, a cavalier, has also been seen by staff members.

title: Grey Lady
location: Cirencester - Parish Church of St John Baptist
info: A piece of local folklore says that the church is haunted by a grey lady. The ghost, carrying a small posey of newly cut flowers, looks for the grave of her child who fell victim of smallpox.

title: Old Woman
info: An older woman was spotted looking out from a window by one resident, while another had a dream of the same figure walking around the property holding a mug in one hand and a cigarette in the other.

title: USAF Pilot
location: Cirencester - Queen Anne's Column, in the park
info: Standing against the monument, this young man has been known to talk to members of the public, only to vanish after his first sentence.

title: Armoured Soldier
info: A couple of local men exploring the hill discovered a secret entrance. It led to an armoured fighter inside a concealed room. The fighter held a flame within a glass lamp which, for an unknown reason, the men shattered. They escaped as the room collapsed around them, the entrance vanishing.

title: Cloaked Figure
info: While recording 'Sabbath Bloody Sabbath' at the castle, Black Sabbath guitarist Tony Iommi and another member of the band spotted a cloaked figure walk into a room. Iommi followed the figure to see who it was, but the room was empty. It had been claimed that the ghost of Elizabeth Raleigh, wife of Sir Walter, haunted the site, although one version of the ghost story incorrected claimed Elizabeth had killed herself after the arrest of Sir Walter.

title: Floating Lady
info: While washing up, a witness turned to see the apparition of a lady float up the stairs and turn into one of the bedrooms (a recent addition). Occupants also reported the sound of footsteps, doors opening and closing unaided, and a blast of chilled air when no doors or windows were open.

title: Butler & House
info: A lost woman driver stopped at this building and asked the butler for directions, which he gave. However, she soon found out that the house had been empty for many years. She returned and found the building in a disused state, completely different from when she first called in.

title: Little Man
info: A little man-like figure was found in crawling around in a coal scuttle. The figure was carried out and left on the driveway, never to be seen again.

title: Running Boy
info: While driving fast along a straight stretch of road, a driver his wife and child spotted a young boy holding a goldfish bowl run up an embankment at superhuman speed and into the road. The driver hit the brakes as the boy passed in front of the car, thinking it was too late to avoid collision, but there was nothing. The boy had gone.

title: Suicide
location: Abbots Leigh - Old Leigh Courthouse (no longer standing)
info: The courthouse was supposed to be haunted by a woman who cut her own throat. The bangs and crashes which her spirit created were so alarming that parts of the building were locked up at night. The courthouse was later demolished. The creative image of the ghost is from 'The Astrologer of the Nineteenth Century' (1825).

title: Dragon Slayer
location: Aller, Curry Rivel - Exact area unknown
info: The village is named after a local hero who slew a dragon but died as the beast released a final breath of flame. In another version of the tale, the hero survives and finds a brood of hatchlings in the dragon's cave, which is subsequently blocked up.

title: Elizabeth Maronne
location: Almondsbury - Bowl Inn and other areas in the village
info: Elizabeth was said to have been abused by her father and died young. Her phantom voice has been heard singing nursery rhymes or otherwise sobbing gently. The inn also claims two other female ghosts, though little is known about them.

title: Redcoat
info: This property was once thought to be haunted by the ghost of a soldier in a redcoat carrying a musket. A neighbouring shop reported hearing pacing footsteps, as if someone were guarding the site.

title: Tabby Cat
info: This feline apparition has been observed padding around on the first floor, vanishing when it sits down. A white Elizabethan lady is also reported to haunt the same floor, seen sitting in a chair.

title: Trio
location: Axbridge - Shute Shelve Hill, Hanging Field
info: The three ghosts lurking here, two men and a woman, were all hanged for murdering the lady's husband.

title: Sight and Sound
info: Patrons at this inn would report seeing apparitions, hearing noises and footsteps, and having objects moved around rooms by unseen hands.

title: Cloaked Figures
info: One witness recalled, as a child, a figure who led him across his bedroom at night and helped him throw up (he was suffering from an illness at the time). There are also reports of phantom footfalls in the hallways and of cloaked figures being seen moving about the abbey.

title: Beast of Banwell
info: While walking her dog, Helen Stokes encountered a large black creature that she described as 'very fast'. Both owner and pet ran away from the creature.

title: Blown Cross
info: It was believed that the villagers tried to erect a massive cross on the hill, though the Devil visited every night and blew it down. Exasperated, the villagers carved the cross into stone, preventing further destruction. It is now thought the cross was the base of a Roman hillfort.

title: Stubborn Bell
info: When the priory bells were removed from the site, the Great Bell did not want to leave its location. Eventually the bell was dragged away (after a single unhappy peal) by man and ox to its new home in Exeter Cathedral, where it promptly cracked once mounted.

title: Blacksmith
info: A giant blacksmith is said to appear if you call out his name while standing on this hill.

title: Chained Hound
info: Buried in nearby woodland by an owner, this phantom hound is now reputed to roam the area, a large chain around its neck.

title: Robinson
info: The disembodied footsteps occasionally heard on site are attributed to Admiral Robinson.

title: Howe
info: Dressed in his naval uniform, Admiral Howe has been observed and heard moving around his former home.

title: Monks
info: Phantom monks are reputed to haunt this area. A photograph taken by Russ Cribb on Flickr purports to show a ghostly cowled figure standing in front of the abbey's main door.

title: Naked Roman
location: Bath - Area around Abbey Church, and other areas within the town centre
info: The figure of a naked Roman soldier (how do you tell without a uniform to assist you?) has apparently been seen running around the centre of the town. On one occasion, a police officer gave chase, but the pursuit abruptly ended when the figure faded into the air.

title: Admiral Phillip
location: Bath - Assembly Rooms, Saville Row and 19 Bennett Street
info: Phillip, the first governor of New South Wales, has been seen dozens of times over the past fifty or so years, always wearing the same black hat and long cloak.

title: Nurse
location: Bath - Bath Royal Mineral Water Hospital
info: Said to have committed suicide on the site, this grey phantom nurse has vanished as of late.

title: Tiny the Dog
info: William Beckford's pet dog, Tiny, was once buried by the tower, though the creature's ghost returned after the remains were moved. It is also said that William's ghost haunts the graveyard surrounding the tower.

title: Bunty
location: Bath - Beehive public house (currently Grappa's Bar)
info: A former Victorian worker at the pub, Bunty makes fleeting appearances around the hallway dressed in a blue/grey gown. Her presence was said to be non-threatening.

title: Monkey
location: Bath - Brassknocker Hill and surrounding area
info: There was a brief flat of monkey sightings here, the creature said to stand between 3 - 4 feet high (90 - 120cm) and had bright rings around its eyes.

title: Soldier
info: Dressed in a First World War uniform, this phantom would appear in a darkened corner sipping his drink. The haunting is said not to have lasted.

title: Monk
location: Bath - Crystal Palace public house, 10 Abbey Green
info: This figure is reported to materialise when building work is carried out inside the property. The ghostly monk is said to be quite transparent.

title: Moving Items
info: The poltergeist at work in this pub plays around with beer casks, taps and pinches staff, and moves pool balls.

title: Cellar Dweller
info: The basement of this public house is reportedly haunted by a girl killed on the nearby railway lines. One member of staff reported feeling invisible hands tugging at their clothing.

title: Dueller
info: This former duelling site is said to be haunted by a sword handling Dueller. The whispers of the deceased fighters and strange mist are said to emerge from a nearby holly bush.

title: Footsteps
location: Bath - Festival Office, Linley House, Pierreont Place
info: Staff and visitors to the building have heard footsteps coming from an empty room here.

title: Housekeeper
info: As the guide on the Bath tour bus will tell you, this hotel is haunted by a former housekeeper who, in a state of depression, hanged herself. Two guests at the hotel in 2013 spent a restless night after scratching and tapping from inside their room kept them awake, and a hot water bottle was swept off the table.

title: Man
info: A man with his long hair tied back with a ribbon is said to haunt this street. He can only be seen by other men. Two houses along the road are said to be haunted, one by disembodied voices, though details of the other haunting are not forthcoming.

title: Bladud
info: The city of Bath is said to have been constructed around waters that cured Prince Bladud of leprosy and his pigs of skin complaints.

title: Raining Jellyfish
info: Some parts of the town were covered in thousands of jellyfish that apparently fell from the sky.

title: White Haired Man
date: Sightings said to have been around 20:45h, several in 1976
info: This white haired man has appeared several times, only to suddenly vanish.

title: Older Lady
info: The upper part of this building was home to a phantom older woman with antisocial tendencies. The entity appeared to one member of staff who popped upstairs to move some stock, causing the witness to quickly retreat.

title: Misty Lady
info: The appearance of this female phantom is accompanied by a sharp drop in temperature. Footfalls are also reported.

title: Moaning
location: Bath - High medieval wall near Theatre Royal
info: A local myth states that the long drop on the other side of this wall is where plague-infected bodies were thrown - the upset spirits are still heard complaining about their treatment.

title: Horses
location: Bath - Laura Place and connecting streets
info: The sound (never the sight) of horses and drawn carriages is said to linger here.

title: Banging
info: Paranormal investigators were called to this theatre after strange bangs and other unexplained sounds were heard around the site.

title: Juliana
info: Juliana Popjoy, the mistress of eighteenth century fashionista and dandy Beau Nash, is reported to haunt this restaurant, as is another ghostly woman wearing clothing from the 1960s. They say the latter figure looks perfectly solid until she suddenly vanishes without trace.

title: Curious Old Man
info: While living in a bedsit with a shared kitchen, one witness spotted an older man standing on the landing of the staircase. The witness jumped and the old man vanished, although the witness was left with a very vivid impression of the ghostly figure - grey hair, blue eyes, baggy trousers, olive green waistcoat, and shirt sleeves held up by expanding metal bands. The witness said the figure's head was slightly cocked to one side, as if curious.

title: Julia
info: Dressed in her wedding dress, Julia walks around this area. It is possible she searches for the man who jilted her at the altar.

title: Eloping Elizabeth
info: The phantom coach and horses reputed to haunt this area contain Elizabeth Linley and Richard Brinsley Sheridan as they elope time after time.

title: Flying Glasses
location: Bath - Salamander public house, John Street
info: As per polt normal, this spirit is said to throw glasses around, create disembodied footfalls, and generate cold spots.

title: Old Fashioned Lady
location: Bath - Second floor flat at Grosvenor Place
info: Seen by a husband and wife couple, this monochromic figure silently drifted through their living room, terrifying the pet cat. More recently, she has been observed on the staircase.

title: Voices
info: Radiohead stayed in this recording studio while producing OK Computer. Singer Thom Yorke would later state to the press that ghosts would talk to him while asleep.

title: Playing Ball
location: Bath - Stone Lions at entrance to Royal Victoria Park
info: Two lions stand on the gate posts here, each cat with a paw on a ball. Locals say when the clock strikes thirteen, the lions kick the balls at each other.

title: George
info: George is said to take a female form and haunt the cellar, close to a well which was once thought to be bottomless.

title: Grey Lady
location: Bath - Theatre Royal & Garrick's Head Hotel
info: An actress killed herself in the hotel in the 1880s after discovering her husband had murdered her secret lover. The actress's last performance at the theatre occurred a few hours before her death, a role which required her to wear a grey feather dress - the same clothing her ghost still wears as it patrols the theatre and hotel. Her phantom may have last been seen in 1975. A dainty butterfly is also reported to haunt the theatre, manifesting briefly once a year on Christmas Day.

title: Old Servant
info: This faithful servant now refuses to leave the house, suffering guilt for allowing two children to starve to death. One of the children is said to still be around, as is his mother who manifests as a Grey Lady.

title: Henry Watts
location: A4 - Memorial between Marlborough and Hungerford (now relocated)
info: Henry Watts erected a memorial along this road to his son Alfie after the boy was killed in a cart accident in 1879. Four people spotted a tall man in a long coat standing by the memorial one evening as they all travelled home, but he vanished when they stopped the car nearby. Some speculated the ghost was concerned that the cross would be destroyed by the planned widening of the road, but instead the memorial was carefully relocated close by.

title: Hanging Man
location: Aldbourne - Dor's Grave, aka Dyer's Grave, aka Doll's Grave
info: This area is said to be haunted by a man who hanged himself. His ghost was said to appear either dangling from a tree between the memorial hall and social club or walking down the hill.

title: Pony
location: Aldbourne - Road leading to the village from Braydon
info: A white pony silently galloped past two men as they returned to the village. It has been speculated that the pony was King Arthur's mount Sigral (ridden at the Battle of Baydon) or belonging to a local man who committed suicide.

title: Monks
info: A secret tunnel is rumoured to connect this pub with the nearby church and is haunted by phantom monks.

title: Barn Gates
location: All Cannings - Area behind the village hall (was the reading rooms)
info: A barn that stood in a field behind the reading rooms may have been demolished many years ago, but some people still reported the sound of its gate creaking open after it had gone.

title: Woman in Green
info: The occupier of the cottage at the time reported sitting in bed and spotting a young woman in a green dress with fair hair who materialised in a corner of the room. The woman in green appeared to descend two steps (though there were no steps in the room) before vanishing from view. The owner of the cottage in 1910 believed his home to be haunted by a woman murdered by her husband after she was caught having an affair.

title: Green Woman
info: After finding his wife in the arms of another in their bedroom, a husband dispatched the unfaithful woman and tried to burn down the house to conceal his crime. However, the fire was quickly put out, and now the woman dressed in green returns to the room where she was murdered.

title: Leaper
location: All Cannings - Footpath between village and Allington, near the canal on the All Cannings side
info: This corpse way was home to a violent entity which leapt out at people and pushed them into the cold canal waters.

title: Joshua Cowdry
location: All Cannings - House opposite Cliff Farm
info: Observed by a neighbour, Joshua walked up his garden path and appeared to enter his house. The neighbour discovered a few hours later that Joshua had died in hospital around the time of the sighting.

title: Elizabeth Bynge
info: Manifesting as a grey lady with a beautiful face, this wraith has been seen by several people over the years, once observed standing at the foot of a bed.

title: Ruth King
info: After Ruth died, many villagers believed that her ghost had returned to protect the money which she had hidden in her home. One subsequent owner reported a woman in black who moved from bedroom to bedroom. Eventually the sightings died away, but no money has ever been found (only an empty purse concealed behind some plaster).

title: Man in a Red Cap
info: Described as a smallish man wearing a red floppy hat, this figure walks the streets in this area of the village.

title: Hound
location: Allington - Area between village and All Cannings
info: The story of the black dog was used to frighten children in this area. One man may have been chased by the creature (though it was dark and stated it might have been a pony), while another couple who spotted the hound said it stood almost as tall as their pony.

title: Parson
info: After the death of the local parson, several villagers pushed his body down a nearby well. The justification for this action was never given, and all concerned died before they gave up their reason. For many nights after the parson's death, horses in the village were released from their stables, and the parson was blamed.

title: Woman in White
location: Allington - Road to Horton, near Tan Hill
info: Seen by two lay preachers driving a horse and trap, this phantom was mistaken for a real woman as she walked towards them in the rain. They could see she had auburn hair and a beautiful face, before she vanished without trace.

title: House
date: House seen 1962 or 1963, coffin seen around 1940, and previously in 1870s
info: A young girl walking on the hill came across a horse which appeared to be empty. She later discovered that the building had been demolished many years before her encounter. Twenty years previous, three shepherds watched a phantom funeral procession, complete with a horse-drawn hearse and figures carrying burning torches. Upon the coffin sat a golden crown. As a side note, the hill once had a carved white horse upon it.

title: Sound of an Army
location: Alton Barnes - Adam's Grave, aka Walker Hill, aka Walker's Hill, aka Walkers' Hill
info: Close to the hill, Miss Muriel Cobern heard dozens of horses galloping, as if an invisible army were passing. The sound suddenly stopped as she fled the area. The site is also said to be the resting place of a giant, who will awaken if the hill is run around seven times.

title: Devil's Trackway
info: This causeway was said to have been constructed by the devil. There are also reports of buried treasure in the area.

title: Saint Mylor's Relics
info: A sadistic uncle cut off Mylor's left foot and right hand to prevent the lad from becoming king. A silver hand and a bronze foot were made to replace the missing body parts, and they started to work as flesh and bone. Unfortunately, Mylor was executed soon after. His relics are currently housed at the abbey. There are also reports of phantom figures and ghostly hounds on the site.

title: Soldier
info: A soldier from the First World War is reputed to haunt this site, and the sound of horses trotting can occasionally be heard from the courtyard outside.

title: Whooshing
location: Amesbury - London Road area where railway line once ran
info: Two friends heard steam being released, as if from an old engine which could not be seen. One of the people had previously heard clanking and a whistle in the same location.

title: Outlined Lady
location: Amesbury - Lords Walk, along London Road
info: This petite phantom lady, grey in colour but with a brighter outline, was observed by two friends taking a shortcut through the woods - they ran away from the figure, turning to look back only to see the woman had vanished. The walk may also be home to a ghostly Gypsy caravan that was briefly spotted before vanishing.

title: Farm Labourer
info: This phantom farm labourer is reputed to periodically appear to have a drink. Once he has finished his beverage, he promptly vanishes.

title: Children
info: A man walking his dog spotted some children playing near the river, the dog edging away from the nearest child, who was a girl who wore a long white dress. The man assumed the children were from a party at a nearby house, but soon realised that the path and area were very muddy, but the girl in white's dress was pristine. On the return walk, the children had gone.

title: Rider
info: A driver was forced to brake hard when a horse and rider emerged from a hedge on one side of the road and crossed in front of him. The apparition then vanished into a wall on the opposite side of the road.

title: Green Lady
info: The phantom green woman which was once said to haunt here has not been reported for many years.

title: White Lady
info: A white lady drifts around the grounds of the manor and sometimes the nearby henge and stone circles. The phantom woman's face is covered by a large hood. The inside of the manor house is said to be haunted by several other entities. One spirit would scatter rose petals across the floor of the Crimson Room, and a phantom monk was once spotted in the library. A ghostly Cavalier occasionally makes an appearance, and in 2014, a visitor was left with a sinking feeling after seeing (but not physically) two Victorian-era children swinging from the bannisters.

title: The Haunt
location: Avebury - Buildings constructed from Avebury stone
info: Houses constructed from stones mined locally are thought to be unlucky and subjected to poltergeist-like activity from an entity known as 'The Haunt'.

title: Figure
location: Avebury - Bus shelter along Swindon Road
info: Three local people spotted the silhouette of a person standing in the bus shelter as they walked towards it. As they approached closer, the figure disappeared, with no reasonable explanation to where they could have gone.

title: White Figure
info: A witness on a bicycle spotted a large white figure in this churchyard. Other stories tell of phantom monks, a female form, and a ghostly young boy dressed in Victorian garb spotted in the same area.

title: Crossing the Road
location: Avebury - Diamond shaped stone (outer ring) by the roadside
info: This large stone is reputed to cross the road at midnight.

title: Tall Blonde Men
info: An off-duty police officer spotted what we thought were three forensic officers, tall with blonde hair wearing white coveralls, walking around a newly formed crop circle. He went to investigate, but as he reached the edge of the field, could hear crackling electricity. The officer tried to enter the field, at which the men in white ran off quicker than any human could run.

title: Lady in White
info: A government worker walking from Avebury Manor reported encountering a ghostly woman in white lace and a white hood at an iron gate close to Truslow. The witness said the woman appeared from nowhere, took his shoulders, and spun him around before pushing him away.

title: Florrie
