info: The shadowy figures reported here are those of criminals who made full use of the old passageways to escape from the law in the nineteenth century.

title: Woman on Staircase
info: A red staircase and the surrounding passageways towards the back of the building are haunted by a rarely seen woman moving silently between them.

title: Woman in Lace
location: W1 - Marylebone Station, switch room on Platform 1
info: While trying to sleep, a maintenance fitter saw a young woman hovering in front of him. The figure had a lacy top, and her face was blurred. The man ran from the room, and met a cleaner, who asked if he had seen the ghost of the woman who appears there.

title: Assistant
location: W1 - Maskelyne's Theatre of Mystery (St George's Theatre), demolished 1966
info: Magician Jasper Maskelyne claimed that a shadowy figure manifested in the wings, an area no one could have reached unseen, and helped a struggling magician on stage successfully finish their act.

title: Mary Janet Kelly
location: W1 - Miller's Court, Dorset Street (street no longer present)
info: Mary's shade hung around the scene of her death for many months after Jack the Ripper attacked her; dressed in black, she would enter her house and gaze through the windows.

title: Major Henry Bradell
location: W1 - Naval and Military Club, Piccadilly
info: Killed in the Blitz, the Major is often seen smiling as he walks post-mortem through the club.

title: Angels
info: The artist William Blake experienced visions during his time here, including a tree filled with angels and angels walking towards him along the road.

title: Red Haired Woman
info: A journalist recalled the story of helping a wealthy socialite from a taxi in Piccadilly, only to discover a few hours later that the woman in question had died three days before the event.

title: Angry Figure
info: An actor reported seeing an angry looking figure glaring at them from the wings.

title: Murder
location: W1 - Private flat along Old Burlington Street
info: A bedroom in a flat along here is reportedly so haunted that no one has ever spent two nights in the room.

title: Blue Light
info: A flat was supposed to be haunted by a blue light which moved from room to room and by a man who stood motionless by a staircase.

title: Electricity Problems
location: W1 - Private property along Brendon Street
info: This property was home to strange and erratic gas and power outages, an external door which would open by itself, and a low-toned voice which would talk in the kitchen.

title: Fleeting Vision
location: W1 - Radio studio, Wogan House (was Western House)
info: Presenter Rylan Clark claimed his studio became home to an entity that could be felt by him and production staff, occasionally being glimpsed out of the corner of an eye.

title: Prisoners
location: W1 - Rose and Crown public house, Old Park Lane
info: Once housed in the basement of this pub prior to hanging, the shades of those killed are still lurking here.

title: Faraday
info: Home of the famous Christmas Lectures, Michael Faraday's spirit has been felt by several scientists while in the main lecture hall.

title: Actor or Highwayman?
info: This tall, dark stranger has often been observed standing in the shadows, his face obscured to make identification impossible, though it is speculated he is either a highwayman or a thespian.

title: Grey Lady
location: W1 - St George's Hospital, Hyde Park Corner
info: This phantom grey lady was thought to be a former nurse. While anyone could hear her footsteps echoing down corridors, she was said to only appear to the very ill, some of whom claimed to have spoken to her.

title: Praying Figure
location: W1 - St Thomas' Church, Regent Street
info: The ghost of a previous rector has been seen several times either praying at the altar or walking down the aisle.

title: Kneeling Priest
location: W1 - St Thomas's Church (no longer standing), Tenison Court
info: This phantom was observed praying before the altar, before silently moving off and vanishing.

title: German Officer
location: W1 - The Langham Hotel, Room 333, Langham Place
info: BBC Workers staying in room 333 have been awoken at night to find a man dressed in uniform standing in their room - it is reportedly a German officer who killed himself by leaping from the room's window just prior to the start of World War 1. The upper floors of this building are haunted by a butler dressed smartly, carrying a tray. It has been speculated that he is not a butler, but an early radio presenter wearing a dinner jacket. The hotel hit the news again in July 2014 when tabloid newspapers reported that members of the England cricket team had experienced strange happenings.

title: Shelley
info: Harriet Westbrook Shelley drowned herself in this lake. Her ghost, as well as others who had also taken their lives in the waters, were said to occasionally walk the edge of the lake. One story has it that a ghostly hand once rose from the lake and was spotted by two women who continued to watch the apparition until it sank back into the water.

title: Housemaid
location: W1 - Unidentified house in Hyde Park Place
info: A lady in the house reported seeing a maid ascending the staircase, a mere two steps in front of her - the servant vanished once the guest reached the top.

title: Giant Black Bird
info: Elliott O'Donnell wrote (albeit briefly) about a large, phantom black bird which appeared so frequently that the residents grew accustom to it.

title: Clock
location: W1 - Upper Gloucester Place, Portman Square
info: A house located in the square was haunted by a clock that chimed prior to a death in the family.

title: Double Decker Bus
location: W10 - Between Cambridge Gardens and St Mark's Road
info: This phantom variant of the well known large red mode of public transport was spotted several times in the 1930s, fading from view as it reaches St Mark's road. When the road was altered and improved, the bus was thought to have gone, though it began to appear again in the 1990s.

title: Vanishing Man
info: A tourist came across a homeless man sat along the road. As the tourist approached, the man suddenly stood, tried to speak and then ran into the middle of the road where he promptly vanished.

title: Footsteps
info: A couple who lived at Number 001 for several months in 1915 reported hearing footsteps and the sounds of a scuffle, although investigations never turned up anyone else on the site. A woman in a dress dating from around the mid-nineteenth century was said to have been spotted.

title: Frightened Woman
info: A woman in a dress dating from around the mid-nineteenth century was said to have been spotted on the staircase of this building. The figure was seen heading towards the front door where she vanished. A story said she had been murdered on the site and, as the main suspect had an alibi, no one was charged with the crime.

title: Emma Louise
location: WC1 - Arthur Tattersall House, 119 Gower Street, University College London Halls of Residence
info: An urban myth, it is said that Emma Louise was murdered long ago in tunnels around this building, and that if you say her name three times, her presence makes itself known.

title: Reader
location: WC1 - Blooms Town House Hotel, Bloomsbury - Room 1
info: This part of the hotel, built on the site of a garden, is thought to be haunted by the spirit of a man who once enjoyed sitting in the sunlight reading books from the nearby library.

title: The Case of Amen-Ra
info: Two fables can be found here. The first concerns a haunted mummy case - as well as the traditional curse, the casket in question was accompanied by acts of poltergeist like behaviour and the manifestation of a female figure. Thirteen mysterious deaths and suicides have been attributed to the sarcophagus. The second dates to when the museum was Montague (or Montagu) House. Two brothers fought a duel in the land behind the building (known as both Long Fields and Southampton Fields). So intense was their fight that no grass ever grew again in their footprints. According to T F Thiselton Dyer (Strange Pages from Family Papers), the footprints were located 'about three-quarters of a mile north of Montague House and five hundred yards east of Tottenham Court Road'.

title: Egyptian Princess
info: Connected to the 'curse' of the Amen-Ra's tomb, this Egyptian Princess would return from the grave late at night and would wail and scream in the tunnels. A more recent report states that these sounds can now be heard further down the track, in Holborn station.

title: Colin Evans
info: Over a period of around two years, Evans would use the hall to demonstrate his power of levitation - he would hover between three feet and fifteen feet off the ground for periods up to sixty seconds.

title: Dickens
location: WC1 - Doughty Street, road outside Dickens's museum
info: Dickens' ghost, dressed in black with a top hat, has been seen pacing along the street where he once lived.

title: Dr John Cumming
info: A Scottish clergyman, Cumming preached that the End of Days would take place between 1848 and 1867. Cumming's ghost may still loiter waiting for the end to come.

title: Anthony Babington
info: Once a popular place for the populace to view the public executions, this dark figure seen lurking around the area at night could be one of those hung, drawn and quartered on the spot.

title: Mabel
info: Mabel was a former landlady who is now said to return to the tavern. She has moved boxes in the cellar, and been heard calling out the name of the newer landlady and operating a dumb waiter, even though the equipment had previously been removed from the pub.

title: Crying Man
info: A crying man dressed in eighteenth century garb has been seen on the new site, and builders reported the sound of chains during construction.

title: Black Winged Creature
location: WC1 - Old Chambers, Lincoln's Inn (no longer standing)
info: Charles Appleby was found dead in his room, large claw marks on his arms and neck, the door and windows locked from the inside. Witnesses outside the building who could see into his room through a window said they could see the man fighting a shadowy bird like creature, though it was at least the same size as Appleby. Reports of the creature continued for a while afterwards, and one team of investigators who put down chalk dust during their stakeout recording finding large claw marks in the powder the following day.

title: Robert Perceval
location: WC1 - Private chambers, Serle Street, Lincoln's Inn
info: While a student here, the young Perceval watched as a doppelganger entered his room, blood covering the head and chest. Perceval fainted, and when he came to, the figure had vanished. Several days (or months, depending on the storyteller) later he was found dead, battered around the areas where his double had been seen to bleed. After his death, Perceval's ghost was said to manifest in his former room, still covered in blood.

title: Unearthly Sounds
location: WC1 - Private flat, Great Coram Street (now known as Coram Street)
info: Harriet Buswell was found dead on Christmas morning, her throat slit. Her killer was never found. The room in which her body was found became so haunted that it was kept permanently locked, although unearthly sounds would be heard emerging at night.

title: Hospital Visitor
location: WC1 - Private flat, Red Lion Square
info: A female guest at her friend's small flat was woken by another girl who wanted to know why her bed was occupied. The guest apologised and explained that she was invited, after which the girl left the room and the guest fell back asleep. The following morning, she mentioned the incident to her friend - he paled and explained his flatmate who normally slept there was in hospital after a suicide attempt. They later discovered the girl had died during the night.

title: Knocker
info: An entity hear would start knocking when a person entered the bathroom. The knocking would stop once the entity was acknowledged.

title: Chess Hater
location: WC1 - Private residence off Grays Inn Road
info: Chess player William Winter claimed that he shared this property with a poltergeist that would pull his chess books from the wall, knock over chess pieces, and pull down pictures of famous players. Non chess related items would remain untouched.

title: Cromwell, Ireton & Bradshaw
location: WC1 - Red Lion Square, Drake Street
info: These three ghosts have been seen in the square, walking side by side, heading towards the gallows. On one occasion they were seen walking straight through a set of railing, vanishing shortly after.

title: Magpie
location: WC1 - Residence along Great Russell Street
info: A phantom magpie is said to tap on the window of a house along this street before manifesting inside. The bird then perches on a floating stick, both bird and baton vanishing the moment a sound is made.

title: Catholics
location: WC1 - Ship Tavern, Gate Street, Kingsway
info: Once a secret meeting place for Catholics, it is thought the ghosts of those executed nearby still returned for their rendezvous.

title: Decaying Man
info: A man on an early morning walk through the square watched as a tall, slim figure walked by him. The figure wore a black and white hat with a monocle in one eye. The figure also had a corpse-like face and the man recognised the figure as resembling an old friend who was overseas. A nurse walking close by screamed and ran off when she spotted the figure. A week later the man discovered his friend had died.

title: Forty Footsteps
info: The area of land that existed here before the square was built upon it was named the Field of Forty Footsteps. Two brothers fought and killed each other over for the love of a girl, each step they took during battle killed the grass, and it never grew back.

title: Footsteps
location: WC1 - Unidentified residence, Great James Street
info: A flat along this road was said to be haunted by the sounds of footsteps, with the occasional manifestation of a male figure dressed in evening wear with a white handkerchief covering his face.

title: Jeremy Bentham with Dapple
info: Bentham named his walking cane Dapple, and it never left his side during life. Much the same can be said post-mortem; the man and his stick can be heard or seen walking down the corridors of knowledge after dark.

title: Marcus Beck
info: Before being stolen in January 2001, the portrait of Beck was considered cursed. People who fell asleep under the painting quickly became ill, and in some cases died. It was also said that if the shutters were not closed on the painting at night, a patient would unexpectedly die.

title: Lizzie Church
location: WC1 - University College Hospital, Gower Street
info: Lizzie accidentally killed her lover with a morphine overdose when he was admitted as a patient. Years later, her ghost would appear prior to morphine injections as a reminder to be careful. Two buildings along Gower Street itself reported the ghost of a man with a heavily bandaged head.

title: Mrs Samuels
location: WC1 - Unnamed residence, Cartwright Gardens (was known as Burton Crescent)
info: Whoever killed Mrs Samuels was never found, but the flat where the crime was committed became so haunted and notorious that the number was changed in an attempt to lose the reputation.

title: Anne Yeats
location: WC1 - Unnamed residence, Cartwright Gardens (was known as Burton Crescent)
info: Anne's body was discovered in the back room of one of the flats. Her murderer was never found. The flat became haunted, although the haunting seemed to fade when the Crescent was renamed.

title: Woman in Nightdress
info: Seen floating along the street by a witness looking out of their window, this pale figure had her arms held out in front of her.

title: Samuel Pepys
info: Number twelve Buckingham Street was the home of Pepys, and his blurred, smiling phantom has been reported near the staircase of the building.

title: Dashing Woman
info: Number Fourteen is home to a female ghost, described as 'pretty', who is said to dash into the house as if late for an appointment.

title: William Terriss
info: Although William Terriss was murdered in 1897, several thespians have since heard or seen William walking about the building or playing around with lights and props. Other people name the ghost as that of Edmund Kean, another famous actor of yester-year.

title: Sir Charles Wyndham
location: WC2 - Albery Theatre, St Martin's Lane
info: Sir Charles built the Albery, and his grey haired shade now walks between its walls, normally lurking near the dressing rooms.

title: Suicide
info: The owners of the building reported hearing strange banging's and scrapings from the floor above them - the sounds were attributed to the ghost of a man who had committed suicide there a few years previous.

title: Displaced Actress
location: WC2 - Aldwych Underground Station (no longer operational)
info: Built where the Royal Strand Theatre once stood, it is thought the female ghost seen standing on the tracks migrated from the original building to the station shortly after it became operational. She is normally reported by cleaning staff working the night shift.

title: Climbing Footsteps
info: Mentioned in Dickens's Bleak House, this building is reputedly haunted by phantom footsteps that move around on the staircase heading towards the legal chambers.

title: Woman
location: WC2 - Bow Street Magistrates' Court (no longer operating as a court)
info: This building was said to be haunted by a woman who would suddenly vanish when seen.

title: The Man in a Tricorn Hat
location: WC2 - British Optical Association Museum, Craven Street
info: While engaging in redecoration of the building, one of the decorators encountered a crouching figure of an old man. Another ghostly figure was spotted a couple of days later, this time of a middle aged man wearing a dark blue coat with a tricorn hat, who asked the witness 'Where's Mary? I can't find Mary'.

title: Fruity
location: WC2 - Cheshire Cheese public house, Little Essex Street
info: The polt at work in this pub is reputed to move the fruit machine.

title: Human Foot
info: A human footprint was once visible in the stonework of this hospital. It was said to have been created when a ghostly beadle's wife stamped her foot in response to a disrespectful human.

title: Tall, Dark Stranger
info: A tall, dark, male figure leaps over the edge of the embankment wall here, but the sound of him hitting the water is never heard. The man is thought to have committed suicide, and one of several entities found along the Thames who took their own lives. There are also reports of laughing coming from the area, the source of which cannot be discovered.

title: Trench Trooper
info: A small group of friends out for an evening's entertainment observed a man they knew walking down an aisle of the theatre, but he quickly disappeared. They later discovered that he had been killed in trench warfare around the time they saw him. He has been seen in the same area periodically since.

title: Kids
info: Once a Mecca for toy sellers and buyers, the sounds of joyous children can be heard briefly once a year. Another entity, claiming to be an Elizabethan nobleman, was exorcised during the early 1990s - he was thought to be either the Earl of Essex (executed in 1601) or Thomas Howard, Duke of Norfolk.

title: Legless Woman
info: A photograph taken by Mr Webb of his young daughter shows a woman dressed in black floating legless in the background. While it is possible that the woman's legs are concealed behind a post, the angle at which she leans does create doubt that the lady is corporeal.

title: William Terriss
location: WC2 - Covent Garden Station, Piccadilly Line
date: Around midnight, winter months (reoccurring). Last seen 1972?
info: An actor, Mr Terriss was stabbed to death in December 1897 at a nearby theatre. His ghost, tall in stature, has been seen dressed in a grey suit with white gloves, standing on the platform late at night.

title: Man in Grey
date: Prior to a long running show (grey man)
info: Seeing this ghost, dressed in a long grey coat with a Tricorn hat, is considered a good omen; if it appears either in the morning or afternoon during rehearsals, the performance will go on to be a great success. King Charles II is also supposed to haunt the building (he was a great theatre lover), as does the shade of Joe Grimaldi who helps anyone struggling with their lines. The backstage corridors are home to the wraith of Charles Macklin, a murderer never found guilty, and now walks the scene of his crime. Finally, actors have been known to experience a chill and simultaneously catching a whiff of lavender while on stage, the sensations blamed on a ghost.

title: Violet Melnotte
location: WC2 - Duke of York's Theatre, St Martin's Lane
info: The builder of the theatre, Violet was known to watch the performances from her own personal box. After her death in 1935, a presence could be heard from within her seating area, and her phantom spotted in the green room in 1967.

title: Anne Boleyn
location: WC2 - Durham House (no longer standing) Durham House Street
info: This building held Anne during her last days, and while the house no longer stands, its basement remains, and it is here the ghost still resides.

title: Oppressive Feeling
info: Staff who walk along the long dark tunnel known as Page's Walk complain of cold winds, doors which open and slam shut, and an oppressive feeling.

title: London Subterraneans
info: This legend, which seemingly 'does the rounds' every few years, states that a group of Londoners began to live underground in the late nineteenth century, and now they have mutated. These subterraneans live off the junk food we discard in the underground tube stations and the odd commuter if they are discovered alone on the train.

title: Silent Woman
location: Other London - Railway line between London & Carlisle
info: Dressed in black and wearing a veil, this figure has been seen sitting quietly and disappearing without warning. She is believed to be a bride whose new husband had stuck his head out of a window and was decapitated. Found holding his body once they reached London, totally insane, her spirit has been making the journey since.

title: Fiery Sword
location: Other London - Skies over the city
info: The start of the great Cholera Epidemic in 1832 was accompanied by a vision witnessed by thousands, of a burning fiercely sword hanging over the city.

title: Darkness
location: Other London - Skies over the city
info: London was briefly covered by a darkness during the day, blacker than an eclipse.

title: Footsteps
location: Outer London: Acton - King's Head public house
info: Father Finear Buckley from the nearby church blessed the pub after the landlady reported ghostly footsteps and a door which opened unaided.

title: Edward Benson
info: This former Archbishop still drifts around the building where he listens to the church music. It is said he is only seen by choirboys.

title: German Pilot
info: Dying after his aircraft crashed nearby, this the Second World War pilot is still occasionally seen walking around this former village.

title: Digger Harry
location: Outer London: Addington - Wooded area near Courtwood Lane
info: Harry was so upset when his wife died that he buried her close to his cottage without telling anyone. The authorities, believing Harry had killed her, locked him up for several months before releasing him because of his age. During his incarceration, Harry forgot where his wife was buried, and spent the remainder of his days trying to find her. His tragic phantom was said to continue to roam the area carrying a shovel.

title: Capybara
info: Normally found in South America, a capybara was spotted by actor David Dayan Fisher and his nephew and niece while walking through this area.

title: Distressed Girl
location: Outer London: Barnet - Field just south of A1081 junction with Trotters Bottom
info: Over a period of around twenty years, calls would arrive at Barnet Police Station from witnesses who claimed to have seen scantily dressed girl in distress standing in a field. The reports would be made early in the morning, and the police were never able to find anyone when they attended the scene, leading them believing the girl to be a ghost.

title: Turpin
location: Outer London: Barnet - Finchley Common (no longer exists, now suburbs)
info: The common was said to be one of the homes to the ghostly form of Dick Turpin.

title: Maidservant
location: Outer London: Barnet - Red Lion Public House
info: This woman died after falling down the stairs - her shade remains earthbound.

title: Johnson
location: Outer London: Barnet - Road between Barnet and Enfield Chase
info: A man by the name of Johnson was said to have been murdered along this road, and the spot where the crime occurred was thought to be haunted for many years after the event. The same road was also said to be haunted by another man, a Mr Danby, who on at least one occasion, caused a horse pulling a carriage with two occupants to bolt. The ghost continued to run alongside the panicked horse until stopping by a gate - it was only then that the horse calmed.

title: Airmen
location: Outer London: Bexley - A2 London-bound between Heath turn-off and Black Prince turn-off
info: Several witnesses were said to have seen a couple of airmen standing on the hard shoulder of the A2. One wore a leather flying helmet while the other appeared to have a medal or piece of metal near his throat. A local tale says that a Heinkel bomber crashed nearby, killing the crew who could not bail out in time, and it has been speculated that the figures belong to this aircraft.

title: Beast of Bexley
location: Outer London: Bexley - Bexleyheath Golf Club
info: A teenager reported seeing a giant black cat trotting across the grass here - police were called but could find nothing. The creature was photographed by a woman from the bottom of her garden in Feb 2006.

title: Bright Woman
location: Outer London: Bexley - Foots Cray Meadows
info: This bright white female form is reported to walk the meadows scattering flowers for her husband who died during wartime. She is said to have killed herself soon after hearing the news in the same area.

title: Lady Constance
date: Constance unknown, Edward in October 1931, poltergeist 1950
info: One of several ghosts reported here, Lady Constance killed herself after watching her husband die when a stag gored him. Her pale white shade now frequents the grounds. Lady Limerick reported seeing the ghostly Edward, the Black Prince during the First World War, and he popped up again in 1931. The spirit of a servant haunts the loft, while a poltergeist outbreak in 1950 resulted in furniture being tossed around.

title: White Woman
location: Outer London: Brentford - Banks of the Grand Union Canal
info: A torso of a female murder victim was discovered here, with her legs found in a train carriage at Waterloo. Her ghost remained in the area for a while, manifesting as a tall woman wearing a white dress.

title: Playful Child
location: Outer London: Brentford - Clitheroe Lock, Grand Union Canal
info: A young boy with a connection to Boston Manor was said to have drowned here during the 1820s. Always 'felt' but never seen, the entity is said to be playful and can assist (or hinder, depending on his mood) with the lock gates as boats pass through.

title: Walking Woman
location: Outer London: Bromley - Bromley North Line
info: This small stretch of line is reputedly haunted by a woman struck by a train.

title: Murdered Girl
info: Many ghosts are said to haunt the caves, including a woman drowned in a pool who was seen in 1961 - the witness knocked himself out on the cave roof while trying to escape the apparition. Other 'people' have been seen within, and the sounds of children and sometimes horses are reported. One myth says that a priest who spent the night at the site was found dead, the cause of death - fright!

title: Michael Jackson
info: Several news outlets reported on the photograph of 'Michael Jackson' manifesting near an impersonator which was snapped by a fourteen year old boy, although the entity is more likely to be lens flare.

title: Severed Arm
location: Outer London: Bromley - Downe Court Manor
info: Several shades reside here, though the scariest is the ghostly severed arm that once appeared, placing itself by the side of a woman while she was in bed. A young girl dripping wet (she drowned in a lake) haunts the butler's room, and finally, many people have reported feeling unnaturally terrified while standing at the top of the staircase where once a man hanged himself.

title: Unseen Force
info: Three visitors to the pond heard a whooshing sound which grew stronger until it formed a physical force that pushed two of the visitors backwards. Ripples also formed on the surface of the pond. The three visitors left the area scared.

title: Dark Figure
info: A drone operator caught a figure in black standing within the priory grounds, although there is little to suggest that the figure is not 'real'.

title: Charlotte
location: Outer London: Bromley - Queensway Village Bakery (aka Plaxtol Village Bakery), Petts Wood
info: This bakery hit the headlines after it was reported to be haunted by an entity named Charlotte. She was said to be harmless, although she was blamed for throwing baking trays and bread, flicking lights on and spelling the first three letters of her name in spilt caster sugar.

title: Sea Captain
location: Outer London: Bromley - United Services Club
info: An old sea captain reputedly haunts this site, possibly from the building's time as a post First World War military hospital.

title: Unknown Male
location: Outer London: Bromley - Viola, Crescent Road
info: The spectral image of a man was seen several times in a bedroom in his house.

title: Royal Messenger
location: Outer London: Carshalton - Convent of the Daughters of the Cross, Pound Street
info: Killed by a fall down the stairs (he was pushed after delivering bad news), this former courier now haunts the steps on which he died. Two more ghosts haunt the long galley; a butler murdered a housemaid in the area, and their earthbound souls have been watched re-enacting the scene.

title: Man's Voice
info: It was reported that while crossing the park at night using phones as torches, two witnesses also recorded the voice of an unhappy man saying 'vanity' and 'get out', amongst other short statements.

title: Young Woman
info: The building is reportedly haunted by a woman who stands by the fireplace.

title: The Ghosts' Promenade
location: Outer London: East Barnet - Church Hill Road
info: So many phantom encounters along this road led to a Justice of the Peace to name it 'The Ghosts' Promenade'. The ghosts were said to include headless humans and dogs, and phantoms in the trees.

title: Grey Lady
info: Up until at least the early twentieth century, locals believed the area to be haunted by a grey lady.

title: Sir Geoffrey de Mandeville
location: Outer London: East Barnet - Oak Hill Park
date: 24 December 2026, midnight, next due, then every sixth year (reoccurring)
info: Sir Geoffrey, complete with red cloak and jangling spurs, appears here on horseback and heads towards the church to disappear through its wall. Even though the ghost is said to appear on Christmas Eve, the last verified sighting of Sir Geoffrey was on 17 December 1932.

title: Cricket Pavilion
location: Outer London: East Barnet - Oak Hill Park
info: Walking his dog through the park, this witness spotted what looked like a cricket pavilion with a veranda about 100 yards from him. The building was quite brightly lit, illuminated from the outside. The witness was a little surprised never to have seen the building before, but being new to the area, was not perturbed. Walking back the same way a little later, the building had gone. Neighbours told him that they could not recall a pavilion ever being on the site.

title: Joanna's Tree
location: Outer London: East Barnet - Tree in Oak Hill Park
info: The oak tree under which eighteenth century prophetess Joanna Southcott once sat and received a vision that she was mentioned in the Book of Revelation burst into flame on a clear summer's day.

title: The Enfield Poltergeist Case
info: In a case covered by the world's media, the Enfield poltergeist reportedly centred itself on a young girl named Janet, using her vocal cords to communicate. She claimed the entity would throw her out of bed at night, and other witnesses reported spontaneous fires and items moving themselves.

title: Black Coach
location: Outer London: Enfield - Bell Lane, Enfield
date: Varies: weeks leading up to Christmas (reoccurring), last seen November 1961
info: A popular local story tells of the Phantom Coach of Enfield, flying two metres off the ground where the road once lay. Seen a couple of times in the twentieth century, the ghostly passengers are said to be quite clear and distinct. A 14 year old boy cycling close to Albany Park School claimed to have passed through the apparition.

title: De Mandeville
location: Outer London: Enfield - Camlet Moat, Enfield Chase
info: Dying in an accident while trying to bury his treasure (or by suicide by drowning himself in the moat), Sir Geoffrey De Mandeville has returned to watch over his fortune, dressed in his knightly armour.

title: Old Lady
location: Outer London: Enfield - Crown and Horseshoes public house
info: Thought to be a former landlady, this ghost prefers to be heard walking around and knocking on doors, rather than be seen.

title: Following
info: It is said that the sensation of being either watched or followed by something unseen exists in this seventeenth century building.

title: Floating Figure
info: Jason Hollis in Haunted Enfield wrote that this location was haunted by a floating figure dressed in black. One witness who encountered the entity was left traumatised by its maggot eaten face.

title: Old Witch
location: Outer London: Enfield - Hadley Road, Enfield
info: An old woman who once lived along this stretch of road was executed in 1622 for being a witch - on cold misty nights, her ghostly form now returns.

title: Nimbus
location: Outer London: Enfield - Hadley Wood railway - south tunnel
info: Since being cut up for scrap in 1980, the diesel powered 'Nimbus' has been spotted running along the tracks.

title: Pin Stripped Trousers
location: Outer London: Enfield - Myddelton House, Bull's Cross
info: Speaking in an interview, a former caretaker said she had seen a few ghosts on this property, including a pair of pin striped trousers (the upper part of the body was not visible) and lights flickering around near the stables.

title: Moving Picture
location: Outer London: Enfield - Private flat, Bush Hill Park
info: Many experiences were reported by the family living here, including a picture which was taken off a wall (even though it was nailed there), voices and noises heard from the loft, and another voice which said, 'get out of my house'.

title: Mr Danby
location: Outer London: Enfield - Road between Enfield and Barnet
info: Mr Danby died on the road in 1832, his throat slashed by an unknown assassin. A few years later his ghost returned and gave chase to a passing horse-drawn carriage (much to the horror of the occupants).

title: Turpin and Bess
location: Outer London: Enfield - Rose & Crown public house, Clay Hill
info: Reportedly once owned by Dick Turpin's grandfather, the highwayman would visit the family when he needed to hide out. His ghostly form has been seen both inside and out, sometimes accompanied by his horse.

title: Founding Rabbi
location: Outer London: Enfield - Synagogue, Wellington Rd
info: The phantom that was reported to haunt this site, opening windows and knocking on doors, was named as the Rabbi who founded this Synagogue.

title: Uneasy Sound
location: Outer London: Enfield - Unidentified house on the edge of Enfield Chase
info: This site was haunted by a sound which only one person at a time would hear. The noise would follow the person around for a while before ceasing and disappearing for weeks or months at a time before manifesting again.

title: Faceless Woman
info: One story claims that an employee encountered this ghostly blonde woman who wears a dress, with no face, on the platform. She faded away after being seen.

title: Cries and Screams
info: A station master working alone in the station office late at night heard the soft sounds of children crying. As time went by, the cries grew louder and were joined by the screams of women. He ran from the office. One hundred and seventy-three people died in the station in a single accident during the Second World War, the vast majority being women and children.

title: Ashen-faced Girl
location: EC4 - Northern Line into St Paul's tube station
info: On four consecutive days, a commuter on an early train sat opposite a girl whose long black hair covered her face, with only the tip of her nose visible. On the fourth day, as the commuter left the carriage, he realised that the ashen-faced girl was looking straight at him. The commuter never saw the girl again but was convinced that she was a ghost.

title: Churchill
location: Outer London: Queensway - Queensway Station, Central Line
info: Witnessed waiting on the platform, Sir Winston Churchill once lived quite close to the station.

title: Woman with a Red Scarf
info: This ghostly figure stands at the end of the platform, close to where she fell and was electrocuted. She sometimes waves to attract attention before vanishing.

title: Reflection
location: SE17 - Bakerloo line, Elephant & Castle and other stations along the line
info: It is reported that occasionally, while travelling northbound, some passengers can see the reflection of someone sitting next to them, even though there is no one in the seat.

title: Tube Traveller
location: SE17 - Elephant & Castle Underground Station, Bakerloo line
date: Woman seen late twentieth century, photograph taken in 1980s
info: Seen by both staff and commuters, this young woman enters the train's carriages, but is never seen leaving. Some also allocate the blame on the same entity when invisible footfalls create loud echoing around the station after hours.

title: Bricked Up Train
location: SE19 - Area below Crystal Palace Park
info: A local urban legend states that there is a train bricked up under the park, complete with dead passengers and crew - sometimes the hands of the dead reach up from the ground and try to grab the living. It is said that the story is based on the fact that an experimental railway was constructed here that worked by compressed air but was abandoned after failure.

title: Rail Worker
location: SE24 - Tulse Hill Station, platform one
info: Killed as he walked on the tracks, the worker's footfalls are sometimes heard echoing through the station late at night.

title: Workman
info: A man dressed in dark, old looking workman's clothing has been spotted early in the morning and late at night. He walks to the end of the platform before disappearing.

title: Worker in a Reefer Jacket
location: SW7 - South Kensington Station, westbound line
info: a spectral locomotive was seen by a person who had just disembarked the last train of the night. A ghostly worker in a reefer coat and flat cap held on to the side of the phantom train. The ghost train gave a whistle and then disappeared into the tunnel.

title: Workman
location: SW9 - South Island Place, Northern Line, near Stockwell Station
info: A trainee manager sent to walk the line by himself as part of his training encountered an old man with a tilly lamp working at South Island Place. They exchanged a couple of words in passing. When the trainee reached Stockwell Station and commented that he had seen someone else along the line, a search party was dispatched to find the worker as no maintenance work was scheduled. No one could be found, and the trainee later discovered that the old man had been seen dozens of times over the years. The ghost was believed to be that of a worker killed on the spot during the 1950s.

title: Man in a Trilby
info: This underground station is said to be haunted by a man in a trilby hat and overcoat, seen on the escalator and vanishes when spotted.

title: Striding Grey Man
location: W4 - Acton Green common, near Turnham Green tube station
info: This semi-transparent entity was observed walking parallel to the railway line, wearing a knee length cape. The dark grey figure vanished when the witness momentarily looked away.

title: Hands
info: Although said to be haunted, details of the entity at this station are fleeting - a phantom is said to appear late at night, while hands are said to be 'felt' on the escalator.

title: Egyptian Princess
info: An Egyptian Princess was said to haunt the British Museum underground station, but when it closed in 1933, her ghostly screams could still be heard emerging from the tunnels at Holborn.

title: Raleigh
location: EC3 - Tower of London: 7 Tower Green
info: Sir Walter Raleigh is reputed to haunt this Beefeater home and is said to have been heard walking through the building.

title: Beckett
location: EC3 - Tower of London: Traitor's Gate
date: Becket circa AD 1240, monk unknown, hand in 1995
info: Traitor's Gate, Tower of London. Around AD 1240, the phantom of Sir Thomas Becket was observed by a monk, who claimed the ghost held a crucifix while hitting the walls and protesting the newly constructed gate. The story goes that the ghost became placated when the building attached to the gate was named after Becket. The area remains haunted though - the ghost of a monk is reported to walk this area of the tower, while a tourist who photographed the gate in 1995 found a strange hand dressed in a lace cuff on his image, thought to belong to a yeoman.

title: Cursed Building
info: After several unconnected and violent deaths of people who worked at 71 Queen Victoria Street, the company which was based at the address closed.

title: Wall Crawler
info: A black shape has been spotted crawling along the wall that backs onto the location where people executed at Newgate prison were once buried.

title: Escaping Prisoner
info: The faint grey figure seen on a nearby wall is thought to be that of a convict who escaped (but was caught again and executed) when this place was Newgate Prison.

title: Tall Clergyman
info: A former vicar was said to stand in the Sanctuary; other than his paleness, the phantom was said to look quite real.

title: Passenger
location: EC4 - Corner of Water Lane and Fleet Street
info: A Hackney carriage driver picked up a dark figure who wanted to go to Lower Church Yard. The horses, whoever, refused to move, and when the driver asked the passenger to leave, released that the figure had transformed into a bear with flaming eyes that quickly vanished in a flash.

title: Dead Prisoners
location: EC4 - Former site of Newgate Prison
info: Newgate was haunted by several ghosts. Footsteps were reported along Dead Man's Walk late at night, one warden reported seeing the face of a decaying, hanged man in a cell, while others reported seeing an aging female form in the yard.

title: Cavalier
info: This figure is said to have appeared several times in the cellar, spotted when staff have been changing the gas for the beer.

title: Isabella and Hungerford Fight
location: EC4 - Greyfriars Churchyard and ruins, Newgate Street
info: Queen Isabella and Lady Alice Hungerford are said to engage in a bout of fisticuffs in this churchyard, both jealous of each other's beauty. A small ghostly greyhound is reported to run between the gravestones, while on occasion, groans and odd lights were reported to emerge from the land. Finally, a female figure in white with hateful eyes once lurked floating around the churchyard.

title: Cat
location: EC4 - House of Mr Edward Pitts, Puddle Dock
info: A phantom cat seen in this house was said to be the size of a mastiff hound, but it had no legs. The family were also subjected to a poltergeist outbreak, which opened doors, moved items around and lit candles.

title: King Lud
info: Ludgate Hill has been named as the settlement where King Lud laid the foundations of what is now London. The King's body was said to have been buried in the area.

title: London Stone
location: EC4 - Opposite Cannon Street station, in the wall of 111 Cannon Street (as of 2016, moved to Museum of London)
info: The London Stone is reputed to be the location from where the Romans calculated all distances in Britannia. Some believe that the stone is part of an altar constructed by Brutus as he founded London, and it is said: 'so long as the stone of Brutus is safe, so long shall London flourish'.

title: Sir Edmundbury Godfrey
info: Murdered on the hill by persons unknown, Godfrey's shade remained for many years after his death.

title: Woman and Small Boy
info: Sharleen Spiteri, vocalist in the group Texas, claimed her home was haunted by a woman and a little boy. Spiteri would often see the female entity sitting at the end of her kitchen table, occasionally joined by the child.

title: Gabriel
location: EC4 - St Andrew by the Wardrobe, Queen Victoria Street
info: Gabriel, one of the bells in the church and once at home in Avenbury (Herefordshire), is reported to ring when death strikes the Rector of its old parish.

title: Clergyman
info: Haunting the All Soul's chapel area, the holy man is wears archaic clothing, thought to be hundreds of years old. His whistling is known to be so loud it upsets people who have come to the church to find peace. There are also reports of children crying which sounds as if it comes from the far east section of the crypt, and the sound of footsteps in various parts of the building, heard when there should be no visitors to the site. In 2019, a staff member working in the North Transept reported a figure or figures on the South Transept walking along behind the iron barrier, fifty feet from the cathedral floor. The figure(s) appeared holographic, slightly luminous and were not fully formed, and moved from west to east twice within five minutes. St Paul's is also home to the bell Great Tom, which is said to strike incorrectly prior to the death of a royal.

title: Sir Henry Hawkins
info: Complete with gown, wig and an armful of paperwork, this lawman has been seen by late-working commuters as he strides along the lanes.

title: White Woman
info: A white female phantom is said to hover over the graves of the fallen knights on the site. Another tale says a Knight Templar also haunts the church.

title: Woman in Bonnet
info: A shadowy figure in a bonnet and the sound of footsteps along empty corridors have been two spooky manifestations reported within this courthouse.

title: White Lady
info: Appearing soon after the sun goes down, this pale unknown figure drifts around the courtyard.

title: Man in Long Coat
location: EC4 - White Horse public house, Fetter Lane
info: This figure, said to be connected to the coaches that were once used here, rattles bottles in the cellar.

title: Oliver Goldsmith
location: EC4 - Ye Olde Cock Tavern (back door), Fleet Street
info: Goldsmith's smiling disembodied head appeared to a girl working here as she stood around the back of the building, her scream being heard by all in the bar.

title: Hanging Man
info: An exorcist was called to the hairdressers after a customer reported seeing a man hanging from the upstairs room. While the ceremony appears to have banished the hanging man, the ghost was soon replaced with that of a small child.

title: Shadows
info: From the ruins of this once proud house come reports of shadowy figures that quickly vanish if seen. The sound of several galloping horses pulling a coach have also been heard on the site.

title: Housekeeper
info: A property here was haunted by a phantom housekeeper. The entity was spotted a couple of times and blamed when items were moved around.

title: Man in Old Fashioned Clothing
info: This pub is said to be haunted by a man wearing clothing dating from the Eighteenth Century.

title: Knight in Armour
location: Ampthill - Road from Ampthill to Millbrook, and Ampthill Great Park
info: This glowing ghostly knight appeared in front of several witnesses along the road in the early twentieth century. Soldiers at a nearby barracks also reported the figure around the same time, observing the ghost from a distance as it descended a hill. At least one local man reports seeing the ghost several times around the park; on this site it is said to depart the site of a castle (now marked by a cross) and move towards a brook where he vanishes. A phantom woman in white has also been reported in the park.

title: Coachman
info: A caped coachman is rumoured to haunt the bar, while in a room elsewhere, doors and windows open unaided.

title: Dark Figure
info: While out running, a witness spotted a dark figure around one hundred metres ahead of him. As the distance closed to around twenty metres, the figure vanished. A friend of the witness said that his uncle had encountered a phantom woman along the same stretch of road.

title: Imprint
info: A table on site reportedly contains the imprint of a ghost's hand - the female phantom once hit the table creating the indent, before vanishing forevermore.

title: Elderly Woman
info: A former owner of this mill reported encountering an old lady with long grey hair on two occasions; each time she waved a bony finger at him, as if wanting the witness to follow her. He did not.

title: Monk
info: This church was said to be home to a phantom monk or lay friar and was spotted a couple of times during the mid-twentieth century.

title: Steward
info: The steward overcharged his customers when selling milk and was condemned to haunt this area. The ghost appears to have vanished since the destruction of the building.

title: Arms
info: Two witnesses out cycling saw a disembodied pair of arms throw a small log over a hedge - one of the pair swerved to avoid the piece of wood.

title: Knocking on the Door
info: Many times has the sharp rapping at office doors been heard in this building, only for the door to be opening and nothing found beyond. Invisible feet have also been heard padding along the corridors.

title: Gliding Girl
info: In 1972 two nurses watched an attractive girl in a long dress and coat glide into a toilet on the south wing of the hospital. They followed, only to find the room empty. The same entity may have been observed 28 years later when three members of staff reported seeing a lady in a long dress walk through the wall of a storeroom. The Shand Ward is said to be haunted by shuffling footsteps.

title: Samuel Whitbread
info: The ghost of the 1903 headmaster Samuel Whitbread is reported to wander the corridors of the higher floors of the main building (which he commissioned) at night. On numerous occasions he has asked people who enter the building at night for directions out; one boy when leading him to the exit found he suddenly disappeared.

title: Man in Bowler Hat
info: This building is thought to be haunted by several entities, including a man wearing a bowler hat dressed in 1930s clothing, another man but this time wearing a dark suit, and a stable boy who walks around the library. Minor poltergeist activity is also reported.

title: Monk
info: Both Screen 4 and the toilet area are reputed to be haunted by a hooded figure. Cold spots and strange sounds have also been reported. The cinema stands on the former site of Newnham priory.

title: Black Tom
location: Bedford - Junction of Tavistock Street, Union Street and Clapham Road
info: A nineteenth century highwayman, Black Tom was executed and buried at this junction with a stake driven through his heart to prevent his return. The ritual failed, and both he and another unknown ghost were seen countless times for years following his death. A 1960s sighting of Tom took place in broad daylight, with witnesses stating they saw a gruesome figure with a broken neck staggering down the road, vanishing into thin air seconds later. The witness who spotted Tom during the 1990s thought he was just a drunk man in fancy dress, until he suddenly disappeared.

title: Young Man
info: Built on the site of a morgue (!), there are any number of contenders who could be the source of this young looking spectre. An older looking man is reported to haunt the cellar.

title: Creeping Man
location: Bedford - Methodist Church, along Newnham Avenue
info: A witness reported seeing a well-dressed man creeping along the back of the church. This figure walked through a wall, leaving a thin veil of smoke in his wake. A few years prior to this, another entity had been seen around the same place, though the witness said the ghost had worn tweed clothing.

title: Soldier
info: The ghost of a Second World War soldier who died when this building was used as a hospital is said to occasionally appear to staff. The ghost also has been known to open doors.

title: Record Player
location: Bedford - Private flat along Tavistock Street
info: A man using the flat came home after work to find a record playing on his music system. Furniture would also rearrange itself.

title: Nan
info: Awaking to see her grandmother sitting by her bed, this witness briefly forgot that her grandmother had died a couple of years previous. The witness then noticed an orange glow outside. The window - a car outside was on fire, blocking the exit and filling the building with smoke. The fire brigade soon had the blaze under control, although the witness was convinced that her grandmother had saved her from dying of smoke inhalation.

title: Black Tom?
location: Bedford - Private residence along Gladstone Street
info: A man at this property awoke to find what he thought was an intruder in his bedroom. The man's shouts awoke his wife, and they both witnessed a dark shadowy figure in a black cloak and floppy hat move to the opposite side of the room and vanish. A few months later they heard the legend of Black Tom, the local horse rustler hanged close to their home.

title: Hand
info: A baby's screams awoke the mother, who spotted a shadowy hand cross the wall of the room and come to rest on the baby's face. The baby screamed again. The mother quickly grabbed the child, and from that day, they shared the same bed.

title: Footsteps
info: A former occupant reported experiencing loud breathing, disembodied footsteps and items which would fall over unaided.

title: Handle Rattler
info: For five consecutive nights, door handles in this house would violently rattle, terrifying all occupants. The sounds would suddenly cease if candles were lit. After the fifth day, the handles never shook unaided again.

title: Brainy Dobbs
info: Returning to the barracks, one witness was hit by a cold wind which pushed him back. The witness found his room trashed, so called the police, who disbelieved his story. An officer later told him that the barracks was haunted by a parachute designer nicknamed Brainy Dobbs, and that there had been many other reports identical to that which the witness experienced.

title: Nun
location: Bedford - Sister's House (former nunnery adjacent to St Luke's church), owned by Pilgrim's Housing Association
info: A male member of staff was woken as someone sat on the end of their bed. Raising their head to see who had entered the room, the man saw a nun sitting at the end of his bedcovers. The nun then stood up and walked through the bedroom wall.

title: Cat
location: Bedford - The Square public house (was the Bullnosed Bat)
info: A member of staff once reported seeing a ghostly cat that appeared in his bedroom.

title: Ball of Light
location: Bedford - Two private residence, Fenlake area
info: A mother and daughter watched a glowing ball of light move down the path towards their property. The mother later discovered that her niece and niece's boyfriend had also seen a glowing ball on the same day outside their home (once again, moving towards the front door), which was around half a mile away.

title: Whispering
info: After site security reported strange happenings, the Luton Paranormal Society investigated the site. They reported the sounds of whispering, a scream, and smells with unidentifiable sources.

title: Chime
info: The sounds of footsteps and the soft ringing of a bell haunt this old building.

title: Locked In
info: Customers have reported being trapped in the toilets after an unseen hand locks them in. Bottles of spirits have been known to fall off the shelves for no reason, and the taps on beer barrels are turned off.

title: Cloaked Figure
location: Begwary - Public footpath between Begwary and Colesden
info: A man walking alone along this path felt something behind him. Turning to look, the man spotted a male figure wearing a black cloak hurrying towards him. No one had been on the path previously, and the man felt a sense of menace from the figure who seemingly emerged from thin air. Breaking into a jog, the man reached a fork in the path. Quickly choosing a route, the man continued to jog before turning once more to see the figure had gone.

title: Singer
info: Singing has been reported coming from an empty bar, and footsteps have been heard in other vacant areas.

title: Stable Boy
info: Dying after falling from a hayloft, this young stable lad is now thought to haunt the kitchen area. He is blamed when small items go missing, often reappearing a short time later.

title: Thrown Objects
info: The site has picked up a spooky reputation, most likely influenced by its ruined state. The Luton Paranormal Society claimed to detect spirits on the site, while other groups have experienced poltergeist-like activity.

title: Sir Lewis Dyve
info: Sir Lewis Dyve is said to walk within the church, ensuring his boots and sword remain inside. The churchyard is also home to the phantom laughter of children.

title: R101 Airman
info: The old airship sheds from which the R101 departed, are reputed to be haunted by at least one airman from the ill-fated airship which crashed in France.

title: Galloping Horses
info: A pair of galloping horses are said to charge down the hill, vanishing as they approach the bottom.

title: Horseman
info: A driver passing through the woodlands encountered a horseman who passed through their car. When the Luton Paranormal Society investigated the area in 2015, they reported no evidence of a haunting, though noted the site had an 'odd feeling'.

title: Older Man
location: Clapham - Glenn Miller Museum (was RAF Twinwood Farm)
info: Luton Paranormal Society wrote that spooky occurrences are reputed to have occurred here, including a sighting of a phantom older man in RAF uniform, and the sound of disembodied footsteps. During their own vigil, the group reported several strange feelings and perceptions.

title: Hooded Monk
location: Clophill - Between Haynes Church End and Clophill Road
info: A hooded monk on horseback holding a lantern was seen by a man delivering newspapers in the early hours of the morning. He said that the horse passed straight through his car.

title: Pregnant Nun
location: Clophill - Chicksands Priory (currently owned by the Ministry of Defence)
info: After a secret liaison with a male superior, Bertha Rosaca became pregnant - her spirit now appears once a year in protest of her subsequent treatment. The spirit, when last seen, wore black and disappeared through a wall.

title: Sophie
info: A woman named Sophie is thought to be one of the ghosts that haunt this church. Her coffin was discovered hidden in the nave. A First World War air force mechanic named George is also thought to wander around the headstones, looking for his friend's grave. The church was heavily vandalised in the 1960s and 1970s, with a grave being opened and the human remains placed in a ritual circle - maybe because of this activity, many people report the church has an oppressive atmosphere.

title: Vanishing Car
info: Five occupants of a car driving along this road spotted another car a short distance in front of them. The vehicle ahead followed the winding road around a cutting; as the car behind did the same, the occupants realised that the other car had vanished, with nowhere to turn off or pull over.

title: Sailor
info: Smoking a pipe and wearing his hair in a pigtail, the ghost of a sailor was seen several times by a former landlady as he sat by the fireplace.

title: Floating Hat
info: Two men walking along the lane watched a legless and armless shape wearing a large hat drifting along. They stated the entity stood just over two metres in height and changed colour from white to black.

title: Lady Snagge
info: While riding her horse, Lady Snagge was decapitated by a thin piece of rope pulled across the road by robbers who plundered her body before leaving it. Snagge's ghost is still reported as it repeats her final journey, sometimes with head intact, and sometimes without.

title: Benjamin Jones
location: Alconbury - Road between Alconbury and Alconbury Weston, near the church
info: Murdered by a soldier (Gervase Matcham), the ghost of the little drummer boy, Benjamin Jones, was said to be heard walking and drumming behind anyone travelling this stretch of road after sunset.

title: Nun
info: This stretch of road is reportedly the haunt of a nun who steps out in front of incoming cars and causes them to swerve. There is also another report of three ghostly crashed cars that silently burn at night.

title: Footsteps
info: A flying saucer-shaped restaurant (sadly no longer standing) became home to a poltergeist that knocked on walls and threw items around. The owner of the restaurant remained sceptical until he heard footsteps that followed him around late at night. The spooky activity ceased after the performance of an exorcism.

title: Hood & John
info: Two stones in this churchyard are named Robin Hood and Little John, both thought to be markers where arrows fired by the famous bandits fell.

title: Lady in Red
location: Arringron - Hardwick Arms hotel, Ermine Street
info: A lady in red is reputed to haunt a guest room, while a monk is said to manifest by the fireplace next to the bar. Poltergeist-like activities have also been reported in the dining room.

title: Grey Mist
info: Grey mist being the only physical manifestation of the haunting, a family living here were also terrified by objects moving on their own accord, footsteps and bangs coming from every corner of the house, and an invisible force prodding their beds at night.

title: Chatty Fellows
info: A local legend tells of talking skulls found in this graveyard, though what became of them is not known.

title: Shug Monkey
info: For reasons unknown, the shuck which has been observed in this area is believed to have a bald head and wide eyes, like that of a monkey, while the body is that of a large black shaggy dog. It leaps out in front of cars travelling along this road, only to dart out of the way at the last possible second, either on all four legs or standing upright.

title: Nun
info: This grey misty ghost drifts slowly around the house; the nun is said to have come here during her life to secretly meet her lover. There was a brief poltergeist outbreak in 1959, with bedcovers being violently removed.

title: Cromwell's Wealth
location: Bartlow - Bartlow Hills, aka Three Hills
info: A chest full of treasure is said to have been hidden by Oliver Cromwell in this area. It has also been said that people have reported feeling something brush against them while on one of the hills.

title: B-17 Crew?
info: There were a handful of reports of a phantom aircrew made during the 1960s, at this base once used by the USAAF. The B-17 may have been seen in 1994, moving silently overhead. More recently, a man who lived on the site of the former airfield reported seeing a pair of legs in dress uniform which manifested in his home, and the sounds of aircraft starting up.

title: Observing
info: An occupier of this property has reported the feeling of being watched and of doors closing themselves, although the presence is non-threatening.

title: Farmer
location: Bourn - Area around Wysing Arts Centre
info: A phantom farmer reputedly wanders the fields around the area looking lost and frustrated. He is said to be occasionally joined by the smell of burning.

title: Gervase Matchem
info: Matchem was executed at Huntingdon and gibbeted in Brampton after murdering a young drummer boy in the village. Matchem's spectre was (or maybe still is) reputed to walk around the area.

title: Dancing Statues
location: Burrough Green - School and village green
info: Once a year the two statues standing above the door of the school come alive and dance on the village green - sometimes their footsteps are visible in the grass.

title: Shove
info: Visiting the house for a party, one guest was shoved from behind by an unseen force. The guest had been standing with their back to a table, which in turn was against a wall; only one other person was in the same room at the time, who stood in front of the guest.

title: Ghostly Black Dog
location: Burwell - Burwell to Snailwell - path southeast, by a belt of trees leading to the A11
info: Another shuck legend, though details are sketchy.

title: Geoffrey de Mandeville
info: Killed while trying to storm the castle with a gang of thieves and robbers, de Mandeville dying words can sometimes be heard on the wind.

title: A Nun and Brown Dog-Thing
info: It is claimed that Abbey House is, or at least was, the most haunted house in Cambridge. While I'm not a fan of 'most haunted' titles, when you look at the number and type of the ghosts supposed to haunt the site (a poltergeist, ghostly echoes of chains, a butler, a woman in white, a grey lady, a squirrel, a dog, and a hare all amongst the entities which have popped up), one can understand why the title has been applied here. An exorcism was performed in the 1980s, which may have laid the entities.

title: Drug Induced Ghost
info: The story is that a ghost appears to those who are being administrated morphine; the psychological effects of the drug would appear to be ignored in this tale...

title: Unlucky Shuck
info: This road, and area, are said to be frequented by a shuck that brings ill luck to all that see it.

title: Womaniser
info: The studio is reportedly haunted by an old man renowned for his womanising ways - he was never seen, though his presence felt. In the early 2000s the BBC invited local ghost hunters and psychic mediums to investigate. Armed with crystals, dowsing rods, a piece of paper on a string, and an EMF meter, the attempt to reach the other side resulted in both male and female presences being detected.

title: Second World War Pilot
info: A few buildings on this site have reports of phantom pilots in their flying gear or RAF uniforms. Sounds of footsteps in empty areas are not uncommon, and there is also a story of ghostly singing.

title: Police Officer
info: Taking a shortcut through a car park and past an office block, this witness looked up to see a police officer in 1940s uniform with a gasmask case slung over his arm. The officer was floating. The witness froze briefly in terror before taking haste.

title: Mr Round
location: Cambridge - Christ's College, Mulberry Tree in Garden
date: Midnight on nights of the full moon (reoccurring)
info: A tall, elderly gentleman wearing a beaver hat, Round is said to have murdered the only doctor who had the skill to save his dying girlfriend - thus his ghost walks the grounds in the area around the mulberry tree in regret.

title: Dr Butts, Dark Mark on Throat
info: Doctor Butts took his life on Easter Sunday 1632 (found hanging by his garters in his room), after suffering from what now would be identified as depression. The Doctor has appeared several times during the early 20th century; described as being dressed in white, having long hair and a gash around his neck. The story goes that an exorcism was attempted, but it failed. The kitchen of the building is reputedly haunted by the lover of Dr Spencer's daughter - he suffocated in a cupboard while hiding from the Doctor.

title: Open Window
info: One story says a window in the upper part of the pub is cursed; if it is ever closed then ill fortune follows. Like so many other pubs, the site was also once home to a poltergeist, and is also said to be haunted by the ghosts of two Second World War airmen.

title: Heavy Stamping Footsteps
info: Rumoured to have been a suicide victim, the stamping footsteps of the deceased plagued several families that lived there over a period of years. The original building no longer stands, and it was said that the replacement had yet to yield any phantom footsteps, until 2020 when a student tweeted that he had heard someone walking around the empty site.

title: Animated Stone Lions Drink from the Gutter
info: On the stroke of midnight, the lions that stand outside the Fitzwilliam Museum leave their posts to drink from the gutters a few meters away. Other sources say they disappear inside the building they guard.

title: Witch
location: Cambridge - Former home on site of former Woolworth's shop
info: A phantom witch was reputedly haunting a building which was demolished and replaced with Woolworth's.

title: Grey Lady on Staircase
location: Cambridge - Girton College, Taylor Knob Staircase
info: The Grey Lady was seen in the late nineteenth century but has not been seen since. She is rumoured to be Miss Taylor, a young girl who died before starting Girton. The college was also briefly home to a Roman Centurion when first built, though little has been heard from this soldier since.

title: Monkey
info: A phantom monkey which haunted this region was reported in the dim and distant past.

title: Pink Light
location: Cambridge - Guest house in the area
info: A guest here reported their room was filled with an intense pink light after they switched off the bedside lamp. When the lamp was turned on again, the pink light vanished.

title: Wallaby
info: Seen from a distance of one metre, the wallaby left the witness and was last seen heading towards the allotments.

title: Girl in Blue
info: A fast moving, slightly out of focus, young girl with light brown hair and in a blue raincoat looked at this witness and disappeared into a bush, creating no noise. The witness looked for the girl, but she had gone.

title: Barrett
location: Cambridge - King's College, The Gibbs Building
info: One story says that Barrett was a strange fellow who stored a coffin in his room. After a night filled with screaming, Barrett's friends found him dead the following day, his body laid out in the coffin. On the anniversary of Barrett's death, his screams are said to echo around this building. Peter Haining claimed the cries likely belonged to a Mr Pote, who cursed the building after being forced to move away.

title: Man in Top Hat
info: Author T C Lethbridge reported seeing a ghost during his time at university. He mistook the figure as a porter, though upon reflection realised that the man was wearing a top hat (which porters only did on a Sunday, and it was not Sunday!). Lethbridge's friend, present in the same room during the sighting, failed to perceive the figure.

title: Large Furry Penguin-Like Creature
info: Once seen in Merton Hall, this strange creature has been more recently reported waddling along the Newmarket Road. A local paranormal group examining the case came to the plausible conclusion that the ghost may be that of a doctor in a cloak, wearing a beak-like mask which they believed would protect them from the plague.

title: Francis Dawes
info: Dawes was a former Peterhouse bursar who hanged himself in September 1789 after an election scandal resulted in an unpopular fellow becoming Master of Peterhouse. In April 1997, a butler and a waiter spotted a white figure as it moved between the spiral staircase and the centre of the Combination Room, the location where Dawes is thought to have committed suicide. In November of the same year, unexplained knocking was heard and once again a strange figure was spotted by butlers. Around the same time, Andrew Murison, the college treasurer, also heard knocking prior to seeing a benign figure in the dining room. At the time an exorcism was considered if the entity appeared again, but Dawes appears to have fallen silent once again.

title: Man Moaning
location: Cambridge - Private building along Newmarket Road
info: A former student who stayed in this residence reported that one room (her bedroom) was always freezing cold. The witness also reported hearing a moaning sound close to her head as she lay in bed, unsettling her so much she could not stay in the room any longer, and moved out of the building soon after.

title: Woman in Green
location: Cambridge - Private house along Trumpington Street
info: Several witnesses were said to have encountered a ghostly woman wearing a green dress with a red feather in her hat. One man commented on a portrait of the woman that hung in a room he had just left, only to be told that no such painting existed.

title: Dark Figure
location: Cambridge - Private house off Hills Road
info: A resident here felt the bedroom had an extremely eerie feeling, as if someone wanted them to leave their house. Eventually the resident moved their bed into the living room to avoid the presence, although on one occasion they spotted a dark shadowy figure standing in the living room doorway.

title: Frail Young Woman in a Hammock
info: A witness saw a young lady in the summer house lying on a hammock. Sometime later he was told the description matched that of his aunt, who had died of tuberculosis a few months before his visit.

title: Young Boy
info: A residence who started seeing a young boy in mid-twentieth century clothing researched her neighbourhood and found ten people, including children, died in a bombing accident.

title: Goat Headed Monster
location: Cambridge - River Cam close to Stourbridge Common (or not, as the case may be)
info: Lady Eveline Camilla (Newton) Gurdon claimed this monster encounter possibly happened in Suffolk, while the 'Every Day Book' placed it in Cambridge. They were both wrong - it comes from Poland; the story is from 'The Doome Warning All Men to the Judgemente' and reads: Fishers toke a disfigured divell, in a certain Stoure (which is a mighty gathering togither of waters from some narrow lake of the sea), a horrible monster with a goat's head, and eyes shyning lyke fyre, whereuppon they were all afrayde and ranne awaye; and that ghoste plunged himselfe under the ice, and running tippe and downe in the stoure made a terrible noyse and sound.

title: White Lady
location: Cambridge - Sherratt & Hughes, Trinity Street (closed in 1991)
info: Once said to be the oldest bookshop in the UK, the building claims to have a white lady who walks silently down the aisles. Her history is unknown. There are also reports of a man in Victorian evening dress.

title: Pale Yellow Head without Ears
info: Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge. A spectral pale-yellow head without ears was apparently spotted floating around Chapel Court in 1967 by John Emslie. The head is said to be that of Cromwell; his skull was finally laid to rest under the college's antechapel in 1960, its exact location a secret. As far as I can tell, the head was only encountered once, although around the same time other students were said to have experienced cold spots and the smell of rotting meat. The other ghost reputed to haunt the site, somewhat lacklustre compared to Cromwell, is that of an elderly University Don dressed in grey who moves from this campus towards Christ's College.

title: College Cat
info: Both a caretaker and the groundsman saw a massive black cat on the grounds. It has been speculated the creature was the so called 'Fen Tiger', a large cat-like cryptid for which sightings around Cambridgeshire date back at least 30 years.

title: Sounds of Murder
info: A sweet shop was supposed to be haunted by the sounds of screaming from someone being murdered with an axe. As a side note, around the same time two other shops along the road were also said to be haunted, although one had been demolished and the other was empty and run down.

title: Old Man
info: A phantom old man is reputed to haunt the basement of this bookshop.

title: Dark Feline
location: Abberton - Abberton reservoir, south of Colchester
info: A large black cat was seen at the reservoir.

title: Grey Greyhound
info: After seeing a creature in his chicken coop, a farmer fired a shotgun at the creature - it ran through the wire netting and escaped. Examining the scene in the morning, the farmer could find no holes in the netting or footprints of the dog.

title: Fighting Soldiers
info: Perhaps connected to nearby Linton's Royalist stronghold, the fields in this area were said to be haunted by fighting phantom soldiers from the Civil War.

title: Drowned Lady
location: Ashdon - Pond known as Lady Well (no longer present) in private residence along Dorvis Lane
info: A local myth says that a pond which was once in a garden at this village was haunted by a phantom woman. She drowned in the pond after a storm caused her horse to bolt, throwing her into the water.

title: Moaning
location: Ashingdon - Hill on which Saint Andrews Church stands
info: The hill is said to be the home of ghostly moans which belong to dying soldiers.

title: Great Cry
info: The story goes that two men walking past the church had a heated argument which resulted in the murder of one of them. The killer, in turn, killed himself in an asylum; the haunting scream in the area is said to be his, rather than his victims.

title: Bloodstained Hill on which No Grass Grows
location: Ashingdon - Saint Andrews Church, Hill on which it stands
info: It is said that an incredibly vicious battle was fought on this site, the blood running so thick that no grass could ever grow here again. The hill is currently grassy...

title: Phantom Coach
location: Audley End - Audley End Road & Chestnut Avenue.
info: The coach departs the Lions Gate and is driven along the local streets until it reaches the B1383. As normal, the coach driver is said to be headless.

title: Unknown
info: The Campaign for Real Ale website mentions this site is haunted, although the finer points are not stated.

title: Hairy Creatures with Large Pointed Ears
location: Aveley - Road in the area, exact location not known
info: While driving home, a family of four were abducted by a blue UFO; the occupants described as four foot high hairy beings, with large eyes and pointed ears. After 3 hours, the family were returned to their car.

title: Opening Doors
info: A door in one of the rooms would open and close by itself.

title: Man in Checked Coat
info: The ghost's history unknown, he caused poltergeist activity in a council home, throwing toys around and slamming doors open at night. When visible, the spirit was often seen heading towards a bedroom of a four year old boy.

title: Blue Workman
location: Basildon - Ambassador Bowling Club, Alley 17 (now a bingo hall)
info: The figure of a man dressed in blue overalls has been observed on lane 17, standing by a bench. The machinery along the lane has a history of behaving erratically, and there have been reported drops in temperature.

title: Screams
location: Basildon - Cash's Well (aka Vange Well No.5) and surrounding area,  Langdon Hills country park
info: The area around the well has gained a spooky reputation with disembodied screams heard in the surrounding woodland.

title: Hit by a Cart
