info: The decaying hall is one of several sites which is supposedly the site of the legend of the Mistletoe Bough - a bride who died on her wedding day after being locked in a chest during a game of hide and seek was found many years later in skeletal form.

title: Everard Digby
info: Although not seen for over fifty years, it was said that Digby, a member of the Gunpowder Plot would return home once a year.

title: Priest
info: This grey ghost would be seen gazing from a window in the building, and occasionally banging to remind people of his presence.

title: Hungry Witch
location: Stoke Dry - Area around the church
info: This woman haunts the place where she was held against her will; denied food and water, it was not too long before she died.

title: Small White Dog
location: Stretton - Stocken Hall Farm (now part of an open prison?)
info: This pallid mutt was seen by many people on the site who would try to interact with it, only realising it was a ghost when it vanished before they could touch it. The building was also home to a woman in black who would be seen moving quickly down a corridor, and a ghostly hanging body that dangled from a tree on the grounds.

title: Chained Man
info: Thought to be the shade of Richard Thorley who murdered a woman here, his victim's ghost is also seen around the area, dressed in blue.

title: Sounds of a Running Battle
location: Derby - Alvaston area, near the castle
info: Three girls reported listening to the sounds of a small battle here in the early twentieth century - gunfire, galloping horses, and men shouting. Four people also heard the sounds while out late at night during the 1980s, and two brothers passing through the area in 2009.

title: Decapitated Man
info: A headless gentleman walks around this road.

title: Children Playing
location: Derby - Assembly Rooms, the Darwin Suite
info: This suite is reportedly haunted by a group of spectral children, singing and dancing. Elsewhere in the same building, a Victorian woman has been seen walking.

title: Maid in Derby
info: A former employee at the hotel, the maid dressed in eighteenth century clothing continues to work post-mortem. A Victorian woman has also been reported as she slowly fades away before witnesses.

title: Lady in Blue
info: One of three entities purported to lurk within these walls, the lady in blue is dressed in Victorian clothing, while a phantom maid wears a uniform which dates her back to the eighteenth century. The third presence takes the form of a poltergeist that throws small items around when distressed.

title: Roman Centurion
info: Though only one has been seen, many believe this area to be haunted by a division of Roman troops who can be heard matching late at night.

title: Unknown
info: A brief article from the Ghosts_UK Newsgroup only mentioned this shop was allegedly haunted.

title: White Lady
info: Seen on the steps behind the structure, this white lady is known to make brief appearances. A woman in tears has also been seen near the cathedral, carrying a young child. The same location is home to a man wearing old fashioned clothing, not forgetting the former executioner who killed his father and brother who jointly haunts the area.

title: Joseph Moss
info: In 1859 PC Moss became the first police officer to be shot and murdered in Derby. His ghost haunted the police station, and when it was demolished and replaced by the fish market, Moss remained in the area.

title: The Condemned
info: An Australian tourist who decided to spend the night in this haunted building, a former jail, reported hearing strange sounds during the night. She also reported that her pillow moved by itself.

title: Ghostly Presences
location: Derby - Eagle Centre (no longer operating under that name)
info: Members of the council and local clergy were called in the help after a few paranormal occurrences occurred in the centre. It was said that three exorcisms or blessings were carried out in various shops - one in December 1983, another during the Summer of 1984 and finally during August 1992. Other people who did not experience any paranormal phenomena directly reported the site, prior to renovation, had a strange and uncomfortable atmosphere.

title: Figure
info: A certain Class 222 train was reputed by workers to be haunted by a shadowy figure which would move around on board, though the engine was known to be empty. The 222 was said to have been involved in several incidents that had resulted in deaths.

title: Fish Fall
info: A mixture of fish, some 50 mm in length, and ice fell on the city.

title: Irish Bare Knuckle Fighter
info: This pub claims to be haunted by four separate ghosts: a young boy, an ex-landlord, an Irish prize-winning bare knuckle fighter and a sergeant major. In addition to these spooks being seen, items are moved and hidden, electrical appliances are switched on and off.

title: Slamming Doors
info: Once housing prisoners in the basement, the cell doors can still be heard being slammed closed - even though they were removed years previous. People have reported seeing an apparition that could be a former guard or a prisoner, though why the shade of a little child heard crying is here is anyone's guess.

title: Black Monk
location: Derby - Friary Hotel, currently the Friar Gate Hotel
info: One of the corridors in this building, built on the site of a friary, is haunted by a monk dressed in black robes. Other witnesses claim to have seen more than one monk here, sometimes headless. Another shade is that of a Victorian gentleman, who may have killed himself on site.

title: Man in Blue Coat
info: This man with long hair is normally seen on the landing. It is unclear whether he is responsible for the poltergeist activity which throws items around the bar and shattering beer glasses.

title: Pin Striped Man
location: Derby - Georgian House Hotel, Ashbourne Road
info: A phantom guest of this hotel, the man in the pin striped suit is blamed for slamming doors and falling items.

title: George
info: After several Saxon bodies were discovered under the pub, there was a brief paranormal outbreak - the landlord encountered a figure standing by the piano (which was also moved), a pan containing food flew across the floor (emptying the bar), lights were switched on and off, and banging and thumps at night ensured the landlord had very disturbed sleep.

title: Alice Wheeldon
location: Derby - Guildhall, tunnels that run underneath the building
info: A suffragette who tried to poison a Prime Minister, Alice has since been seen lurking in these tunnels. Workers down here have also spotted a ghostly young lad passing though.

title: Soldiers
info: The owner of this salon claimed that the sound of marching soldiers could be heard in the shop, the sounds perhaps connected to the legend of secret tunnels running from the area to the cathedral.

title: Monk
location: Derby - Jimmy's public house, St James Street
info: While the sound of plainchant haunts this pub, outside a ghostly monk heads towards his monastery that was demolished many years ago.

title: Black Clad Figure
info: This entity, wearing a long black raincoat, reputedly emerges from a wall after first appearing in Miss Selfridge clothing store.

title: Cloaked Man
info: During a nightshift, a worker at the site spotted a black cloaked figure glide by a glass door. The figure turned to look at the witness and they reported seeing his Adam's Apple.

title: Black Clad Figure
info: This entity, wearing a long black raincoat appears in this store before vanishing into a wall, only to reappear in MacDonald's.

title: Old Soldiers
info: Squadies tell tales of seeing strange people in the newer buildings who vanish if approached, while outside a phantom horse and cart are occasionally seen.

title: Drink Obsessed
location: Derby - O'lafferty's public house (once known as The George), Sadlergate
info: This entity, which enjoys switching the barrels off and causing general mischief, could be related to the thousand year old skull discovered in the basement.

title: Lady
info: The owners of the house claimed to have seen a ghostly lady walking down the central corridor of this building.

title: Former Workers
info: A long dead gardener still walks along the lawns he once worked so hard on, while a woman haunts the kitchen. The child seen dancing in the house is thought to be a member of the Pickford family.

title: Slumped Man
location: Derby - Private house along Derby Road
info: The haunting first came to light during a housewarming party, at which a visitor to the house spotted the body of a man slumped over a banister. The figure was seen again a bit later, reflected in the mirror in the bathroom. Doors would also unlock themselves.

title: Asian Man
location: Derby - Private residence along Dexter Street
info: A family sold their house for less than market value to escape the haunting apparition of a young Asian man. An elderly woman was also seen, and crying heard from the attic.

title: Grey Lady
location: Derby - Private residence, Canal Street (original residence since demolished)
info: A witness living in this house would hear the name 'Jack' be spoken as they lay in bed. On one occasion the witness awoke to see a woman in a grey laced dress standing in the room, laughing hysterically, her hands on her forehead. Muttered conversations and the sound of furniture being moved around could also be heard on the site.

title: Cloaked Figure
location: Derby - Royal Hospital, built on site of Derby City Hospital
info: Staff had reported seeing a figure wearing a black cloak in various parts of the new hospital, particularly around the morgue. While initially the media reported that an exorcism would take place, a later statement from the hospital denied this. Some believe the figure to be a Roman soldier who died nearby, as the old Derby City Hospital was constructed on an ancient Roman road. In November 2011, a witness reported seeing two nurses in old fashioned clothing, one male and the other female, standing by the foot of her bed. They watched the witness in a caring way.

title: Lady in Grey
info: Said to be a non-threatening presence, this elderly woman dressed in grey is accompanied by the smell of lavender. Mild poltergeist behaviour is also reported, with small items disappearing, only to reappear days or weeks later.

title: Tortured Woman
info: Interrogated by having heavy weights placed upon her chest, the 'questioning' proved too much for this woman who returned to haunt the holding cells.

title: Figure in Overalls
location: Derby - Showroom, West Meadows Industrial Estate
info: While working as a security guard, this witness and his dog observed a figure dressed in white overalls walk along the side of a building. The guard and dog followed the figure who disappeared around a corner. When the guard turned the corner, he was faced with a dead-end - a locked gate with barbed wire along the top. Two days later the guard spotted the same figure, once again at two in the morning. The guard chased the overall clad stranger, taking his eyes off the figure momentarily, only for him to vanish.

title: Crying Infant
info: Pushed to his death, this child can now be heard crying in pain.

title: Young Woman
info: A young woman is said to walk the streets calling out for her brother who died during a war. The form is said to be faint and blurry.

title: Monk
info: Seen in the building, the monk is not the sole haunter - a ghostly girl has been seen running through the corridors. Workers in the building who have been there alone have reported hearing a mysterious voice whisper their names.

title: Lady in Blue
location: Derby - The Haus, once known as the Jacobean House
info: Around 400 years old, the Jacobean House is home to a headless coachman who drives his carriage through a former archway of the building. Also seen is a lady in blue, who descends the main staircase, while another man (believed to have committed suicide) has also been spotted on the upper floors of the building.

title: Screaming
location: Derby - Well Street - St Mary's Bridge
info: The bridge was once used to display the bodies and limbs of executed criminals and priests - their cries are a reminder of the method of their deaths. Another ghost, that of a nun travelling in a royal carriage, passes over the bridge and vanishes shortly after reaching the other side.

title: I Live Here
location: Derby - William & Glyn's Bank, Corn Market
info: Three builders demolishing walls within the bank's basement knocked through to a hidden cavity where they spotted a young boy. One of the men asked the youngster what he was doing there. The boy replied, 'I live here', before vanishing before their eyes. Ten years later the building was a DHSS office - stories were told about the cellar being haunted by a maid, while another witness claimed to have entered an office which contained a sitting man; the witness was never able to find the office again. Finally, a member of staff reported seeing a hand on a rail of a staircase coming down towards them, but when they expected to see the owner of the hand, no one was present.

title: Bump
info: A family sitting at one table felt it move slightly, as if someone had bumped into it, although no one could be seen. At the same time a picture on the wall moved slightly. The inn is said to be haunted by a grey figure, seen in the restaurant.

title: Thin Woman
info: Returning over the hills from a friend's house, a driver spotted a woman on the side of the road. She was thin, tall, and eerie. The driver was scared and drove on, only to see the same woman two hundred yards (180 metres) further down the road. The driver did not use the road again.

title: Child with Blonde Hair
location: Glossop - Co-Op food store, town centre
info: After this young girl was seen by staff in the building, she quickly faded away. The figure may be the same entity spotted in the Norfolk Arms public house. Another ghost, a more shadowy figure, is also reported to haunt the food store.

title: Malevolent Shadow
location: Glossop - Former Woolley Bridge Inn, now a private home
info: The lounge area of this public house was said to be home to an apparition who never made itself fully visible. Former landlords of the building also claim the upper part of the building was haunted by a child whose talking would wake them up at night.

title: Young Girl with Golden Hair
info: One of two ghosts sighted here, the jolly spirit of a young girl with golden hair runs and plays in the bar area. She was last heard laughing in 2020. The other entity, a former coachman, was observed in two places during the 1990s - sitting in a corner near the bar and standing by the side entrance.

title: Man with Thinning Hair
location: Glossop - Pickering buildings - no longer standing
info: Dressed in 'old fashioned' clothing, this ghost only managed to scare a former worker at the plant once the witness realised the ghost's legs ended at the knees.

title: Old Man
location: Glossop - Private residence along Queens Drive
info: The family here experienced several strange occurrences, including seeing a large old man smoking in the bedroom, the sound of footsteps running up the stairs, and loud bangs.

title: Rocking Man
location: Glossop - Private residence along Talbot Road
info: An occupier reported several paranormal occurrences here, including a stained glass crucifix which shattered, balls flying off the snooker table, and tapping on windows. Another witness spotted a man sitting on a rocking chair in the bedroom. The site was eventually blessed by a priest, although it is not clear whether this service was successful.

title: Murdered Priest
info: The appearance of a phantom man in black robes caused the family cook to hand in her notice. Around the same time, a thin woman wearing a dark dress with an indistinct face was seen several times by the parson, his wife, and other witnesses. The ghostly man was thought to have been a former priest murdered by his wife, who in turn also returned to haunt the building.

title: Flying Square
location: Glossop - Road between Glossop and Chapel-en-le-Frith
info: Teacher Michael Valance encountered a flying box hovering over the moors. He reported the UFO as glowing and having four bright windows. The craft vanished after several minutes.

title: Marching Soldiers
location: Glossop - Road between Glossop and Hayfield
info: A small group of spectral soldiers were once said to march between Glossop and Hayfield, their presence marked by beating drums.

title: White Horse
info: It was once said that a phantom white horse haunted a spot at the hall where a former owner had concealed a cache of riches.

title: Hilda Knight
info: A great theatre lover, Hilda died in 1958. However, it is widely believed her ghost remains at the building, playing with lighting rigs and sometimes manifesting in the form of a butterfly.

title: Engineer
info: An engineer fell to his death in the beam engine house. His spirit still lingers, playing with lights and making noises in the basement.

title: Man in Overcoat
location: Leicester - Admiral Beatty public house, Wellington Street (no longer standing)
info: The ghostly figure of a man wearing a long coat would be seen looking out a window. Even when not present, the area where he stood would be colder than the rest of the pub (although it could just have been draughty).

title: Human Sacrifice
location: Leicester - Area of land north-east of the Hoston Stone, Humberstone (was known as Hell-hole Furlong)
info: How the area of land gained its name was unknown even to nineteenth century folklorists, so it was conjectured that it was an area of human sacrifice.

title: Woman Dressed in Black
info: A phantom woman dressed in black with a white face was spotted by a park ranger while on night patrol.

title: Bel's Grave
info: The area is said to be named after a giant who died in the area - he tried to travel between Mountsorrel to Leicester in three leaps but failed.

title: CCTV Figures
info: Recorded by CCTV, two ghostly figures were briefly seen in the grounds. Though the image was later explained as being 'leaves caught in the light', the building is reportedly haunted by a middle aged woman in a pale dress, who gives off a friendly aura.

title: Headless Men
location: Leicester - Between Leicester and 'Bambury, upon Dunmothe' (ed note - latter place cannot be located on modern maps)
info: An old account states that several men encountered a headless phantom crying out 'Bowes! Bowes!'.

title: May
info: Several phantoms are reported to haunt this area, including a young woman in white who walks the corridors. She is named as May, who died aged eighteen of tuberculosis. Other phantoms are said to be carriages pulled by black horses which vanish into the trees, a groom who hanged himself in a room above the stables, and a sad looking boy who glazes from an upstairs window.

title: Richard III
info: Philippa Langley felt a strange sensation crossing this car park, on a location marked by an 'R', and virtually on top of the location where Richard III's body was later found (the 'R' has been in the car park since the eighties and was painted by an attendant). The offices of Denham Foxon & Watchorn which overlook the car park were reported to be home to mysterious noises, also (now) blamed on the king.

title: Cat Anna
info: The bogyman-like witch known as Cat Anna was said to live in the cellars of the ruined castle. It is likely that this legend and the story of Black Annis are connected.

title: Hooded Figure
location: Leicester - Cathedral Church of St Martin (aka Leicester Cathedral)
info: This hooded phantom was said to glide around the churchyard and periodically kneel with its head on the ground, as if listening to the earth. Around the start of the nineteenth century, two houses on the site became home to bells which would ring without visible cause.

title: Pools of Water
location: Leicester - Council house on Netherhall Estate
info: A family living in an unnamed council house on the estate reported mysterious pools of water which would form before quickly disappearing again. The liquid was said to be 'silky' when touched. A woman with dark hair was reportedly seen when an exorcist came to visit. It is unknown whether this report is connected to the Bell Lane haunting.

title: Hooded Monk
location: Leicester - Crown & Thistle public house, Loseby Lane
info: Secret tunnels supposed to connect the pub to the cathedral and castle are reputedly haunted by a man who quickly vanishes if seen. More recently a witness reported observing a hooded monk kneeling as if in prayer, with a small posy of flowers laying on the floor, in the residential lounge above the public bar.

title: Black Annis
info: A local monster, this old hag possessed iron claws that were used to skin children. She lived in a cave hidden somewhere amongst the hills, now thought to be buried under the city. Some believe the myth to be a continuation of Danu, an entity so old that stories no longer exist about her.

title: Ivy
location: Leicester - Donisthorpe Mills, Bath Lane (as of June 2009, in process of being demolished)
info: The yard was said to be haunted by 'Ivy', a short woman who wore dark clothing, had grey hair, and whose face was covered in warts. A nightshift worker who ventured out of a quick cigarette encountered her, ensuring that he never went outside alone again.

title: Changing Shape
info: An exorcist was summoned to this building after staff reported seeing a strange ghost which would change shape.

title: Shadowy Figure
location: Leicester - Friar Lane (though topographical area has changed since report)
info: Normally manifesting as a set of footsteps which would follow people as they walked down this road towards St Mary's church, the shadow of this ghost once manifested and revealed itself to be headless and humped to one witness.

title: White Woman
info: This pale woman has been seen moving around the headstones.

title: Disconcerting Monk
info: There are mixed opinions to whether the library here is haunted by a grey monk or a white lady. A tormented Cavalier has been seen in the Great Hall, a phantom policeman haunts other parts of the building, a ghostly dog has been reported in the courtyard, a black cat in the Great Hall, and at least one witness claims to have been shocked to see a pair of legs manifest from the portrait of Henry Earl of Huntington hanging in the Major's Parlour. Ghost Scene Investigations and Leicester City Museums released video footage in 2006 of what appears to be a ghostly figure crawling across the floor in one room.

title: Edwardian Child
info: This small boy has been seen several times dressed in a sailor's suit, normally during a rehearsal. Before the theatre was built, a child once drowned in a well on the land and the shade has been named as his.

title: Reverend Norbert Wylie
info: Shortly after dying, the Reverend Norbert Wylie started to appear around the church. Witnesses claimed to have seen the man at the altar, outside the confessional box, and walking through the cloisters. Father Fabian Dix encountered Wylie and heard the ghost say, 'Pray for me', a message he passed on to the congregation.

title: Mrs Smalley
info: Mrs Smalley, who died in 1727, refused to leave her home post mortem until banished by the Vicar of St Martin's Church.

title: Shag Dog
location: Leicester - Kilby Road (was once Black Lane)
info: Black lane was patrolled by a large black dog with bright eyes and a large, fanged mouth which glowed like burning coals. It once saved a local girl from being attacked by a robber.

title: Manageress
info: The theatre is reputedly haunted by a former manageress dressed in Second World War garb.

title: Factory Worker
location: Leicester - New Pingle Street, Britella factory
info: The workers at this factory threatened to go on strike unless the management attempted to exorcise the ghost which took up residence here. The author does not know the outcome of their demands.

title: Empty
info: This property had a spooky reputation and stories said it remained empty for many years due to a haunting.

title: Typing
info: Many poltergeist-related events took place in this building, including disembodied footsteps, light fittings falling and shattering, alarm sensors triggering, sounds of and a blood-curdling scream. Nothing was ever seen, and the events occurred for around a year before ceasing.

title: Footsteps
info: A visitor to the courtroom reported an oppressive feeling, as if they were a prisoner on trial. This lifted as soon as they entered the lower part of the building. The person the visitor was with felt fine in the courtroom, but later heard footsteps walking towards them although no one could be seen.

title: Water Games
location: Leicester - Private house along Bell Lane
info: The haunting presence at Bell Lane made the occupier's lives hell. It flooded rooms, squirted water from walls and ceilings, drenching the family every time they sat down to eat. When the family moved next door, the water followed them. After a few months, the water activities lessened and finally ceased by Christmas.

title: Gnomes
info: For several weeks, explosions were heard in the Highfields area, although no source could be found. One man, rushing to investigate a loud bang, spotted several, grotesque gnome-like entities dematerialising.

title: Post Man
info: More often felt than seen, the phantom which haunts the station is reputedly a postman. The ghost is said to be non-threatening and has been nicknamed Henry.

title: Spit Fire
info: Seen flying and spitting fire, the dragon passed over the town many times during the month.

title: Balls of Fire
info: These balls of flame where seen many times during the winter months, spinning like wheels.

title: Woman
info: One 1960s psychical researcher claimed the church tower to be haunted by a woman who had fallen from the structure.

title: Tall Cloaked Man
info: Spotted at various times by the verger, a curate and the maid, this ghostly figure would also be heard walking around an empty room. Small items such as teaspoons and gloves vanished, and closed and barred doors would be found open.

title: Seated Child
location: Leicester - The Talbot public house, Thurcaston Road
info: Several shades have taken up residence here. A young child sits on a bar stool, a phantom woman vanishes into the wall, an old man in a large raincoat walks towards the bar before disappearing, and shadowy figures lurk in the car park.

title: Mrs Smalley
location: Leicester - Unidentified house near East Gates (likely to be no longer standing)
info: After Mrs Smalley died in 1727, her ghost took up residence in her former home. The entity was banished by the vicar of St Martin's.

title: Footfalls
info: An invisible person with heavy boots was said to have taken up residence in a home along this road.

title: Not Known
info: It was reported that a house here became haunted, although the finer points are not known.

title: Veiled Lady
location: Leicester - West Chapel at Crematorium, Groby Cemetery
info: Wearing Edwardian or Victorian mourning dress, a shadowy veiled woman was spotted by two witnesses. The figure disappeared into a hearse, and when the witnesses check the vehicle, it was empty.

title: Headless Person
info: This headless shade was watched by witnesses as it drifted down the middle of the road.

title: Red Globe
info: An eleven year old girl, Jade Greenwood, was struck on the head by a red glowing ball, most likely ball lightning. A red mark was left on her forehead, and the girl experienced an electrical shock and a burning sensation in her leg.

title: Cavalier
info: A ghost would appear at the window of this building once a month; one writer suggested the phantom to be an optical illusion created by the moon. Another story from the site placed a headless Cavalier here, although the figure never returned after being shot at by a visitor.

title: Prisoner
info: A transparent, ghostly man with a chain attached to his leg is said to hobble down this road.

title: Readying for Battle
info: The sound of sword and horse is said to occasionally be heard around this area.

title: Victorians
info: This building is said to be haunted by two elderly female ghosts dressed in blue Victorian dresses. Another Victorian girl, this time young and blonde, is also said to run down a corridor before vanishing. Finally, the ghost of an US pilot has been spotted walking around the grounds.

title: Woman in Black
info: A former cleaning lady at the bank reported encountering a grey haired woman wearing a long black dress, carrying a pile of towels, who disappeared through a door.

title: Polish Airman
info: This man in uniform has been observed standing by headstones in the Polish section of the cemetery, leading some to speculate that he was a Polish airman from the Second World War.

title: Footsteps
info: The sound of footsteps in the loft and the smell of violets were said to haunt this bakery during the early 1990s.

title: Prince Rupert
info: Prince Rupert of the Rhine led the relief of Newark in 1644 - the town must have left an impression on him, as he appears to still haunt the building he rested at.

title: George
info: The phantom man in Victorian clothing and a flat cap, nicknamed George, was seen briefly by one member of staff as he vanished into a closed fridge door.

title: Thrown Stones
info: Investigated by NgritUK, the team reported stones being thrown and strange flashes of light.

title: Stomper
location: Newark - Old Kings Arms public house
info: This polt opens and slams doors, moves furniture around and creates stomping noises.

title: Lady Ossington
info: The coffee shop was constructed by Lady Ossington as a temperance tavern. Opening in 1882, the building failed to attract a crowd and soon became an hotel, but remained alcohol free. It is said that when alcohol was finally sold on the site, a portrait of Lady Ossington would leap off the wall in protest.

title: Footsteps
info: Disembodied footsteps are said to permeate the darkness once everyone has left the theatre at night, and doors open and close as if an unseen person has passed through them.

title: Presence
info: One of the hangars here is reputed to have a strange presence that upsets guard dogs. People have reported sudden drops in temperature.

title: Piano
location: Newark - Spread Eagle public house (ceased operation in 1968)
info: The family running this venue were awoken by the sound of the piano playing downstairs. Fearing an intruder, they investigated - opening the locked door to the room where the piano stood, the music suddenly ceased, and no one could be found. The building was also home to disembodied footsteps.

title: Hanged Man
info: This pub was said to be home to the ghost of a man hanged for a forgotten crime close by.

title: Grey Lady
info: This phantom grey woman is said to haunt the bar area.

title: Vanishing Man
location: Northampton - A4500 adjoining Sandy Lane, Duston
info: An old man stepped out from the central reservation and walked into the middle of the dual carriageway, forcing a car to abruptly slow down. The man then disappeared from the road without a trace.

title: Crying Children
location: Northampton - Auctioneers Public House, Market Square
info: A former landlord and his wife reported hearing the cries of children and the smell of burning timber - it is speculated that this ghost sighting relates to the Great Fire of Northampton, when in 1675 the buildings around Market Square were burnt to the ground.

title: Vanishing Figure
location: Northampton - Between Spinney Hill and Bailiff Street
info: Driving back in daylight from shopping, this witness and the driver of another car had to break hard after a tall figure stepped off the kerb and crossed the road. Once it reached the other side, the figure vanished.

title: Possessed Cabinet
location: Northampton - Birchfield Road East (private house), and 330 Wellingborough Road (Trends furniture shop)
info: This cabinet, sold to a house along Birchfield Road East, was quickly returned to the shop after the owner said that the figure of a woman dressed in 1930s clothing materialised several times by it. Similar occurrences happened at the shop after the cabinet came back.

title: Misty forms
info: Many of the pub's owners have reported lights that turn themselves on and off and pets that refuse to go into the basement. A misty man with a black dog was spotted in one room and a phantom woman was encountered on the stairs.

title: Black Rain
info: Black rain fell on the rectory, twenty four hours after the building had been shaken for an hour by a loud rumbling.

title: Running
info: A witness heard footsteps sprinting towards their position, but when they turned around, no one could be seen. The sound of the footsteps continued to echo around the area for several seconds after they had ceased.

title: Sounds of Movement
location: Northampton - Empty building near Market Hall
info: There have been several reports of the sounds of people moving around this building in the dead of night, even though it remains totally boarded up.

title: Floating Monk
info: Built on the site of an old monastery, it was perhaps inevitable that the building would become haunted by the figure that has been seen by cleaning staff after shopping hours.

title: Short Figure
info: A witness recalled walking amongst shoppers as a child and spotting a short man with piercing eyes, dressed in a black ring-master style suit. The figure appeared furious, but everyone else remained oblivious to his presence.

title: Lady with Gloves
location: Northampton - House at 18 Horsemarket, no longer standing
info: This lady, dressed in black lacy dress with white gloves, was seen several times over a fifty year period.

title: The Man with the Flickering Lantern
info: A couple out walking their dog after dusk encountered a tall man wearing a long coat and carrying a flickering lantern. One of the couple spoke to the man but received no reply. The couple turned to each other and then back to the man, but he had vanished.

title: Elderly Woman
location: Northampton - King William public house (aka the King Billy)
info: An elderly lady has been reported walking along the main corridor in the upper part of this pub. The Northants Haunted group conducted a seance on site, revealing that six spirits remained in the building, one of whom had the initials JG.

title: Cyclist
info: While waiting at a crossroads, a witness watched a man in a cap and Plus-fours breeches, ride past on a penny farthing cycle. The cyclist faded away.

title: Nun
info: A former teacher at the school, this shade now walks knee deep across a hall that was raised after her death.

title: Monk
location: Northampton - Old Jolly Smokers public house, no longer standing (was located at 25 The Mayorhold)
info: Accompanied by the smell of incense, this brown hooded figure haunted the pub before it was demolished.

title: Swinging Forks
location: Northampton - Private flat, St Michaels Road
info: One resident reported a presence in a room, while knives and forks would swing on their stand without reason. Footsteps would also be heard, and doors would open on their own accord.

title: Banging and Scratching
info: A former resident that the winter months would be haunted by scratching from the bottom of the staircase, bangs from the basement, and doors which would open themselves.

title: Grey Lady
info: No theatre would be complete without at least one shade, and this female entity is blamed whenever the electrics play up or props are moved.

title: Harry Franklin
info: A former landlord who took his own life in a 'horrific manner', Harry can be heard walking above the heads of the locals as they sip their pints.

title: Foggy Figure
info: A schoolboy and his friends spotted the upper half of a 'foggy grey' figure in front of the alter, moving towards the windows of the church. The witnesses all fled.

title: Strafford
info: Appearing to King Charles I twice before the Battle of Naseby while he stayed in this hotel, Strafford tried to give the King advice concerning the upcoming battle. Charles I ignored it, and lost the fight. A public house in Daventry also lays claim to this event.

title: Cellar Dweller
location: Northampton - Wig & Pen public house, Saint Giles Street
info: The entity in the basement rarely manifests on the upper levels and is happy to scare any dogs that try to enter its domain.

title: Wet Prints
location: Nottingham - 1 Queens Street, British Transport Police Station
info: An officer who was working alone at night in 1977 heard a heavy door slam. Going to investigate, he found a set of wet footprints leading to the toilets, even though the weather was dry outside. Following the prints into the toilets, he found the room empty. Thirty years later, another officer spotted a man walk into the toilets - realising that he and his colleague should have been the only people on site, the officer investigated the room and found it empty.

title: Charles Watkin Williams
info: A high court judge who allegedly died while with a 'working girl' was once said to haunt the upper part of this building.

title: AA Man
info: A patrolman belonging to the Automobile Association is said to ride his motorbike along this road. It is not known whether he stops to help broken down motorists.

title: Roar
info: Many across the city heard roaring during the night, with one describing the noise like a blow torch.

title: Footsteps
info: This station was home to phantom footsteps and opening doors. Two witnesses watched a shadowy man enter the toilets; concerned he was a trespasser they followed him in, only to find the area empty.

title: Victorian Worker
info: It is unclear whether this former mine was haunted by one miner or several. In one case a miner wearing old-style clothing was spotted walking into an area that was being sealed off. In another incident, a group of miners watched a figure wearing coal dust covered clothing, apart from a bright white scarf. As they approached him, the figure faded from view; a dirty white scarf lay at the spot he had vanished.

title: Roundheads
info: At least one witness has reported seeing spectral Roundheads on horseback ride through this area.

title: Robert Jackson
info: The ghost of Robert is said to walk through the restaurant, which is also haunted by two men who are seen sitting at a table before disappearing. The women's toilets are home to a female phantom, while a jester is said to stand outside the front door.

title: Figure in a Hat
info: At least one member of staff has spotted a figure wearing a wide brimmed hat and long cloak pass through a wall in the upper part of the building. Mild poltergeist activity is reported here (such as turning off beer taps in the cellar), and some speculate that Richard Bonington himself is still here.

title: Edna
info: During the construction of the complex where the theatre stands, the skull and bones of a female were discovered. It is thought that the bones belonged to 'Edna', an active spirit who opens doors, moves items around, and can be heard walking around in parts of the building that should be empty.

title: Man in Long Black Coat
info: Since a secret cave was found by workmen under a shop in 1969, this pedestrianised street has become home to a phantom man wearing a long black coat and tall black hat. His connection to the cave is unknown.

title: Cold Man
info: An employee reported seeing a male figure walking across the cold storage area, although he could not be found when the room was checked. Over the years other staff have reported seeing 'things' out of the corner of their eyes.

title: Old Lady
location: Nottingham - Church Cemetery (also known as Rock Cemetery)
info: An elderly phantom lady is said to haunt this area, fading away after being spotted. The area is also haunted by a Victorian woman, who when last seen, vanished suddenly.

title: Underground Figures
location: Nottingham - City of Caves, Broadmarsh shopping centre
info: This network of caves is said to be haunted by several figures. Dark indistinct shadows have been seen darting around, and an upset woman in Victorian clothing has been spotted. It has also been reported that a few people have heard explosions overhead - the caves were used as bomb shelters during the Second World War.

title: Lady in White
info: Seen wandering around the gate of the church, this woman in white is thought to be looking for an unknown item. The ruined church itself is home to a tall man who has been seen standing at the location the altar once stood.

title: Chaworth Musters
info: One of two ghosts said to visibly manifest in this area, Mrs Chaworth Musters reputedly hides behind trees on the land, concealing herself from the mob that stormed the hall in 1832. The second phantom is named as Mary Ann Chaworth, and she quietly haunts the corridors. Less quietly, the sounds of footsteps, children's laughter and voices have all been heard from the servants' quarters. One witness awoke to the sounds of shouting and the feeling of being poked by an unseen presence.

title: Children
info: The ghosts of a white woman and of two children have been reported in this wooded area. While the woman in white has been named as Mary Chaworth Musters, the children are thought to have been murdered by their father William Saville, hanged for the crime in 1844. The sound of horses has also been reported.

title: Brown Haired Girl
location: Nottingham - Cumberland Place - old Children's Hospital and then a laboratory
info: Two female technicians, and one of their sisters, watched a nurse in an old fashioned uniform glide through a door before vanishing. They said the entity had a pretty face and golden brown hair.

title: Singing Spirit
info: This entity made a couple of appearances in this house and was also heard to sing.

title: Average Man
location: Nottingham - Fanum House, and neighbouring building, Lenton
info: A female employee in Fanum House spotted a figure standing in a doorway that suddenly vanished. The building has a history of hauntings, going back to the 1960s, when an 'average looking' man was seen by staff. This figure would also quickly vanish. There was also a brief poltergeist outbreak in the kitchen - tea urns would transport themselves from one side of the room to the other. The polt outbreak also affected the neighbouring building, where the owner stored fruit machines. He came in one morning to find all the machines moved - a feat only achievable by a team of several strong men.

title: Flying Glasses
info: An exorcist was brought in to deal with the poltergeist that slid glasses around on the bar and created loud banging.

title: Lady in Grey
location: Nottingham - Flying Horse Hotel (now Flying Horse Walk, a shopping arcade)
info: While staying at the hotel, one male guest refused to re-enter his room after encountering a grey lady passing down a corridor. The beer cellar was also said to be haunted, with lone staff reporting feeling a tapping on their shoulder.

title: Footsteps
location: Nottingham - Food shop (since closed), Oakdale Road
info: It was said that footsteps could be heard in empty parts of the food store. After it closed, it reopened as a new business, which experienced doors slamming shut on their own accord and hand driers in the toilets being switched on and off repeatedly.

title: Young Girl
location: Nottingham - Former antiques shop, Mansfield Road
info: This young girl, said to be around ten years of age, had a pale face and large eyes. She wore dark clothing, a white pinafore, and her boots had holes in the toes. A medium was called to the shop, after which the phantom disappeared.

title: Moaning
location: Nottingham - Former Police Station, Canal Street
info: This building, while being used by a private company, was said to be haunted by moans and groans, banging and by a light being switched on by an unseen hand. The manager of the firm was not impressed with the stories and discovered that all strange activity (except the moaning) could be stopped by changing the electrics.

title: Matron
location: Nottingham - Former Trent FM Radio studio, was once a former hospital, 29/31 Castle Gate
info: The studios where Trent FM broadcast from until January 2007 were said to be haunted by a female apparition that resembled a matron. Another ghostly woman, elderly and dressed in black, has also been reported, as has a man in military uniform. Heavy soundproof doors developed a habit of opening and closing themselves.

title: Hanged Criminals
location: Nottingham - Galleries of Justice (were known as Shire Hall and County Gaol)
info: The courtrooms are reputedly haunted by criminals who were executed on the site. Actor David Shiba reported hearing footsteps and seeing a shadowy figure in the cave system who he took to be another actor, though he later discovered everyone else in the building were upstairs at the time of his sighting. A more recent sighting in 2010 involved the sighting of a happy young girl, around eight years old, who vanished while running towards the witness.

title: Terrier
info: This small white dog was spotted by two witnesses in separate incidents, on one occasion the hound was accompanied by an elderly woman using a walking stick. Other witnesses have only heard the lady walking around, her stick tapping on the ground.

title: White Lady
info: This piece of woodland is reputedly haunted by a white lady, a nun and disembodied screaming.

title: White Lady
info: Thought to be the same ghost encountered at the nearby church, this white woman is thought by some to be Mary Ann Chaworth-Musters reputedly Lord Byron's first love.

title: Older Man
info: Three members of nursing staff contacted security on the emergency line after they saw an unknown elderly male walking at the far end of a corridor at night. He was said to be wearing a flat cap. Upon arrival, security checked the building but could not find any sign of the male. The intruder alarm had also not been set off.

title: Young Boy
info: Two non-threatening spirits are reported in this pub, a young boy who has been observed by employees behind the bar, and the ghost of a former landlord whose reflection was spotted in a mirror.

title: Cavaliers
location: Nottingham - Hippo Club, Bridlesmith (no longer operational)
info: Staff on late shifts claimed to see phantom Cavaliers and other dark figures moving around the club. Some people also reported the sensation of invisible hands touching them.

title: Shaking Headboard
info: One occupant of this household would be kept awake by their bed's headboard violently shaking. The activity would cease for the evening when the occupant said they needed to sleep.

title: Footfalls
info: One of the buildings on this modern industrial estate is rumoured to be haunted. Footsteps have been heard above the ceiling, lights are flicked on and off, and unpowered machines start and stop.

title: Footsteps
info: This building is reputed to be haunted by the sound of footfalls heard moving around in empty rooms.

title: Sobbing Boy
location: Nottingham - Lee Rosys tea shop (17 Broad Street)
info: A local newspaper reported that staff and one customer had heard phantom sobbing from behind a wall. Puddles of water appeared without cause and cups would fall from tables without reason.

title: Pale Man
info: Built on the site of a former priory, this cinema is haunted by a figure that could be a monk, though it appears to dress in 'normal' clothing.

title: Victorian Girl
info: This little girl is said to enjoy playing along the corridors in the upper part of the building. The bar downstairs is home to a First World War officer, a Cavalier, and even possibly Dick Turpin who once stayed here en route to York.

title: Hello?
info: Since closing, the ghosts of this former asylum have found their voice. Workers on the site have heard their names being called by an unknown voice, and disembodied footsteps also heard. A woman has been observed walking down corridors, and a man has been heard to call out 'hello', though he can never be found.

title: Steam Engine
info: Two school children playing in the tunnel heard a steam engine rapidly approaching them - terrified they ran out into the fresh air. A few seconds after their escape they realised that the train could not have existed, as the north end of the tunnel was barricaded.

title: Romans
info: The Nottingham Evening News reported that the sound of someone speaking in a 'foreign language' and the noise of clashing metal led some to speculate the military installation was home to a Roman soldier. Local folklore said the site had previously been a Roman camp.

title: Marshal Tallard
info: More likely to be heard rather than seen, the phantom man reported here has been named as Marshal Tallard. Footsteps and voices have been heard, and people have reported the sensation of being watched by unseen eyes. Other entities reported here are thought to be friends of Tallard.

title: Spooky
location: Nottingham - NHS Walk-In Centre, Derby Road
info: A former AA building, the poltergeist here has been nicknamed 'Spooky'. He upsets items in the kitchen and creates loud bangs and crashes. The polt may be connected to the ghost of a man who has been spotted standing around, staring at people before vanishing.

title: Man in Check Shirt
location: Nottingham - North Wilford Power Station (no longer standing)
info: This power station was haunted by a blue-eyed man wearing a check shirt, blue overall and a cap. He smiled at one witness before disappearing through a closed door.

title: Lion
info: Two milkmen in the area reported seeing a large cat with a long tail which had a bushy end. Locals claimed that their pets had been quite restless during the night, though a large scale search by police using tracker dogs and helicopters found nothing.

title: Regent Mortimer
info: Heard pacing in his former cell, Mortimer appears not to understand that he was executed in 1330. Queen Isabella has been heard screaming, the way that she may have done when they dragged Mortimer off to his death. A phantom child is also said to haunt the site, and finally the gallery is reputedly haunted by the Countess of Nottingham, who only appears to people who will die within a year.

title: Blue Lady
location: Nottingham - Nottingham City Council, Market Square
info: The Ante Room is said to be haunted by this woman in blue, while the sound of disembodied footfalls can be heard emerging from Sheriff's Room.

title: Singer
info: Heard crooning when the pub is (or should be) empty, this female shade is also said to enjoy playing the fruit machines.

title: Bus Catcher
location: Nottingham - Outside Redhill Cemetery, Mansfield Road, Arnold
info: A slight retelling of the phantom hitchhiker myth, it is reported that a man waiting outside the cemetery caught a bus late one night. He walked past the conductor and climbed to the top deck. When the conductor followed him up, he was nowhere to be seen.

title: Misty Lady
info: Local folklore claimed that a misty lady would manifest over a coffin-shaped box containing her child. Two clergymen opened the box and found nothing but dust inside. The Rector reported hearing footsteps in empty parts of the building.

title: Roger de Clifford
info: The ghost of Roger became so troublesome that it was trapped within a bottle and buried under his monument. Despite this, he still returns, and to be touched by the hooded shade is an indication the witness shall die within the year.

title: Dreadful Eyes
info: A few entities were said to have made their homes here, including a black dog with dreadful eyes, a ghostly horseman, and a wagon containing a coffin pulled by four phantom horses.

title: Organ Plays
info: Several times, late at night, the church organ was heard to burst into tune, stopping as investigators reach the churchyard.

title: Return from the Red Sea
info: A ghost that haunted this building was exorcised to the Red Sea for fifty years. When this time expired, the ghost came back, extremely upset about its forced vacation.

title: Nun
info: This location is haunted by either a nun or a lady dressed in grey. Or maybe both? An upstairs bedroom is said to be the most popular place for the ghost to materialise.

title: Boots Made for Walking
location: Besford - Church Farm, local field named Dog Kennel Piece
info: A kennelman was sent by his master to discover what was upsetting a pack of hounds once kept here. The kennelman never returned and in the morning his body was found torn apart by the dogs with only his boots untouched. A ghostly form of the footwear now stomps around the field at night, while the sound of howling hounds drift in the wind.

title: Moving Shadows
info: Intensely bright phantom lights were seen outside the building, and a few months later, two witnesses watched a jet black shadow cross a wall, though there was no light source present that could have cast it. A strange face would sometimes look through the window at those inside, before slowly fading away, while a misty woman was once seen inside the building.

title: Steam
location: Bewdley - Severn Valley Railway,  Northwood Lane
info: This phantom locomotive is said to be invisible, though it leaves a trail of hazy steam as it passes. The Parasearch team investigated the site in 2008 but did not reach any conclusions.

title: Man in Black
info: A photograph taken in the bar after closing hours revealed a blurred unknown man in black in the background. It was also reported that furniture had moved itself and the jukebox would switch itself on.

title: Garden Tosser
location: Bewdley - Two adjoining properties, Dry Mill Lane
info: Mr and Mrs Edwards appeared in court, accused of assaulting their neighbour. The conflict began after manure was thrown over the fence before being thrown back, and over the course of a week, tree branches were broken and red shale tossed into the gardens. Both neighbours denied that they had thrown anything, leading a solicitor to speculate a poltergeist had been responsible and each neighbour had automatically blamed the other.

title: Devil
info: Local legend says that on the day Cromwell died, the park was laid to waste as the Devil passed though it to collect the soul due to him. Now, once a year, Old Nick rides out and returns to the park to ravage it once more.

title: Demon Bird
info: A large black bird was once said to protect a pile of hidden gold within the castle grounds. The hoard could not be moved unless the bones of Lord Beauchamp, former owner of the gold, were in possession of the treasure hunter.

title: Bedroom Shuck
location: Bredon - Cottage, exact location not known
info: Appearing in a bedroom, this dog had glowing red eyes and warm breath - it disappeared as it approached the bedroom door to leave.

title: Headless Lady
info: A phantom funeral procession arrives at the church, though for whom it represents is a mystery. Fields on either side of the church are said to be haunted by a decapitated woman, carrying her head under arm.

title: Lola Taplin
info: Once the landlady here, the short tempered spirit of Lola now haunts the bar, occasionally throwing food and other objects around the room. One witness reported a feeling of sadness and felt herself being poked in the side. One local legend says that Lola Taplin has taken the form of an owl and watches over the pub.

title: Spot Loggins
location: Bretforton - Well on Bretforton House Farm
info: Loggins was a cattle drover who drowned in a well located on this farm and is now said to haunt the area around the well. One myth says that if you are blindfolded and run around the well three times, you will lose anything you are carrying. A brand of locally produced ice cream is named after the ghost.

title: Grey Lady
info: Rooms were left empty as various strange events drove occupants from them, including the lifting of bedcovers and the sounds of footsteps walking around. An exorcism failed to dispel the entity. A phantom Victorian woman is also said to walk the manor.

title: George and the Dragon
location: Brinsop - Lower Stanks and Duck's Pool Meadow near the church
info: The village of Brinsop claims to be the location where St George had his famous battle with a dragon. The creature lived in Duck's Pool Meadow but was finally slain at Lower Stanks meadow. An old stone carving in the church depicts the final battle.

title: Tolling Bells
info: A set of church bells were hidden in the forest during the Reformation and forgotten about. They are said to ring at night, and were heard during the Second World War, a time when bell ringing was illegal.

title: Ephraim Rolfe
info: A village simpleton, Rolfe was popular with the locals; he was mistakenly killed by a landlord who mistook him for a poacher. His thin and bony form can now be seen in the fields surrounding the road.

title: Vanishing Boy
info: While at a re-enactment event, one participant spotted a boy standing by a fireplace in the Merchant's House. The boy was no older than thirteen, with shoulder length wavy hair, a red tunic and a brown leather belt around the waist. As the participant approached the boy, the young lad vanished.

title: Abhorrent Boar
info: The hero Sir Ryalas battled long and hard before killing a monstrous boar in this region. Upon death the creature transformed into a human, recognised as the son of a local woman. Sir Ryalas tracked down the woman and also killed her.

title: Mary Yates
info: A former owner of the building in the seventeenth century, Mary has been named as the ghostly elderly woman seen by several people on the site. She is also said to appear at a crossroads outside the park, the site where legend says she was hanged for witchcraft. Back in the hall, other people have reported a phantom old man with a pipe and an Edwardian woman.

title: Mistress Hicks
location: Bromsgrove - Road and fields surrounding Harvington Hall (particularly the A448/A450 area)
info: This woman was executed for being a witch - she was blamed for raising storms and making local women and children vomit pins. Some say she still walks the area.

title: Steering Wheel Fight
info: Many of the deaths on the road here are blamed on an entity which grabs the steering wheel and prevents people from turning at corners - the ghost is said to be that of a woman who once died while fighting someone as she sat in the driving seat of a fast moving car.

title: Where is Anne?
info: The ghost of a young gentleman who walks around the second floor of the building has been heard asking the question 'Where is Anne?'.

title: House of the Dead
info: The building which infrequently materialises on the hill was demolished long ago and was the site of several chilling murders.

title: Sheltering Lady
info: This location is reputed to have four ghosts: a woman murdered whilst sheltering from a storm, a Cavalier whose skeleton was discovered hidden up the chimney, a girl who walks from the courtyard to the orchard, and a strangely shaped entity which manifests in a bedroom.

title: Bert
location: Claines - The Mug House public house
info: A typical pub ghost, Bert is thought to be a former drinker at the establishment who died in the 1940s. He can be heard walking around the upper parts of the building.

title: Ghostly Mission
info: A Welsh gentleman was approached by the ghost of a clergyman. The phantom asked the man to travel to Clifford Castle, before revealing the location to where some money was hidden. This money was to be thrown into a nearby river. The gentleman completed the task, and never encountered the ghost again.

title: Monks with Body
location: Colwall - Road near village green known as 'Haunted Lane'
info: A woman cycling along the lane during the Second World War encountered a procession of cowled monks carrying the body of a young man draped in black. Pedalling away from the scene, the woman was overtaken by a ghostly horseman also galloping from the monks. Man and horse vanished as they reached the railway bridge in the village. Many years later two children walking home encountered a tall, hooded monk along a country lane. They quickly ran past.

title: Rotating Stone
location: Colwall - Stone in the centre of the village
info: Old Nick appears at midnight every night to turn the stone around.

title: Booted Person
info: Always heard, never seen, this entity would walk through the house, climb the stairs, and end the trip once reaching the attic.

title: Black Rain
info: This downpour of blackened water was so intense that local streams were still dark 24 hours after it had resided.

title: The Hummadruz
info: For many years people have reported hearing a strange humming sound around this area, without apparent cause.

title: Terrified Woman
location: Drakes Broughton - Residence along Walcott Lane
date: Unknown, but said to be a monthly occurrence
info: Entering the house from the rear, this phantom is said to vanish after passing the door to the living room. She appears to be running from someone (or something) and looks terrified.

title: Slams
location: Droitwich Spa - Friar Tuck Cafe (no longer open)
info: Although most of this haunting was poltergeist in nature (slamming doors, falling pans and violent bumps), on one occasion a ghostly blonde haired woman was spotted on site.

title: Neighbour
location: Droitwich Spa - Private residence in Roman Way area
info: A boy walking home from school briefly spoke to a neighbour before reaching his home. He told his mother about the conversation who then informed him the neighbour had died the night before.

title: Cavalier
location: Droitwich Spa - Three unnamed houses on Chawsen estate
info: Several residents from houses on this council estate reported seeing a ghostly Cavalier in their respective properties - one man watched the entity walk through a wall.

title: Horses and Carriage
location: Droitwich Spa - Unnamed road between Droitwich and Worchester
info: A pair of ghostly horses pulling a carriage pass through the gates of an unidentified stately house before setting off along the road.

title: Drink
location: Elmley Castle - Bambury (aka Banbury aka Bembury) Stone
info: The stone is said to travel down to the nearby River Avon for a quick drink at midnight.

title: Lynx
location: Evesham - Area around Unipart site, Shinehill Lane
info: A brown, pointed eared cat was spotted on this site by a security guard, the third such sighting at this location.

title: Sound of Silver
info: Hidden in the river when the local abbey was closed for business in 1539, the silver bells still ring their song around Christmas.

title: Colin
info: Named Colin, this shop phantom is said to move furniture and throws items around.

title: Snuff Box
location: Garnstone - Unknown pond (may no longer exist) and Field's End
info: The ghost of a farmer who committed suicide would manifest in the form of a calf. During an exorcism, the entity was trapped within a snuff box - the container was thrown into a pond, where ghost and box remain.

title: Witches
info: A piece of local folklore says, 'There will always be nine witches from the bottom of Orcop to the top of Garway, as long as water flows'. Depending on the story, the witches either helped a man recover his wife who had been kidnapped by fairies, or had brought her back from the dead.

title: Drowning Lovers
info: A failed escape from Cromwellian soldiers resulted in a young officer and his lover drowning in the river Wye. Their ghosts, mounted on horseback, have been reported struggling in the river, standing in the ruins of the nearby castle, or heard screaming during storms. In addition, an imprisoned Irish chieftain who died trying to escape is said to haunt the Macbeth tower.

title: Unlucky Strike
info: The Devil tried to throw several lumps of earth at Stevenage - he missed the town, but one of the shots knocked down the steeple at Graveley church.

title: Friar's Curse
info: Falling insane after penance took its toll, a friar cursed the church and anyone who stood in its shadow. Another tale reports it is the rock summit of Raggedstone Hill that casts the cursed shadow.

title: Black Human Shape
info: In 2009, halfway between Telford and Bridgenorth, both passenger and driver of a car spotted a black human shape wearing a long coat, on the side of the road. They thought the figure would step out in front of the car, but it disappeared before doing so. Twelve years later, another couple in a vehicle witnessed a dark figure wearing a long coat on the side of the road. The figure vanished as oncoming headlights appeared.

title: Girl in White Lace
info: A ghostly girl dressed in white lace is said to haunt this ruined site. A student managed to photograph a strange misty 'face' in 2004 and reported hearing scratching noises. (Image copyright 2006 Lawson Clout)

title: Maid
info: This spirit only appeared once, entering a bedroom and announcing 'Mass is at eight o'clock' before disappearing.

title: Laid by the Devil
location: Acton Burnell - Devil's Causeway, between village and Cardington
info: It was said Old Nick created this old road in a single night. He was said to appear to anyone using the road at midnight, taking the form of a man on a white horse (although he had the horns and feet of a cow). If the person encountering him had a good soul, they could pass unheeded. If they had led an evil life, the Devil would beat them to a bloodied pulp.

title: Demonic Frogs
info: The Devil and three imps are said to live here, manifesting in the form of frogs. While the imps are happy to be seen, Old Nick takes the form of a larger frog and spends most of the time hiding away.

title: RF398
info: The last remaining Avro Lincoln Bomber situated here is said to be haunted by a pilot seen in the cockpit, while a tape recorder left on board overnight picked up the sounds of a busy airport, though the hangar and the area were devoid of life.

title: Landing Craft
info: This ufo report was based on a story made up by two young people returning late from a leave pass. As time went on, the story grew, and it eventually became that an UFO had touched down near a hangar on the base, and was recovered and removed for reverse engineering.

title: Hooded Monk
info: A motorcyclist reported seeing a ghostly monk, his face covered by a hood, floating around thirty centimetres from the ground.

title: Floating Figure
location: Ash Magna - Road just outside of Ash Magna
info: Seen several years apart by two brothers, a floating figure is reported to haunt a road just outside of this village.

title: Hannah Phillips
location: Astley Abbots - Main road through the village
info: Hannah died a few days before her wedding day, slipping into the river where she drowned. Her ghost, wearing a long dark dress, has been observed by motorists along the road.

title: Mad Jack
info: John 'Mad Jack' Mytton was a local eccentric who lived with 2000 dogs and 60 cats while drinking six bottles of port per day. His money eventually ran out and he died in a debtors' prison. However, once a year on his birthday, his ghost is reputed to visit the hotel that has now taken his name.

title: Tom Moody
info: Tom was paranoid about being buried alive and took elaborate steps to ensure it never happened. His phantom still walks the hall, often accompanied by one of his favourite hounds.

title: Sunken Bells
info: When the nearby church construction was delayed by a supernatural agency, the bells were said to have been cast into the pool. Neither horse nor ox were able to drag the bells out, so they remain to this day. The site has also been proposed as a burial site for Owain Ddantgwyn, named by some as King Arthur.

title: Sunken Stones
info: The original Baschurch church was going to be constructed on Berth Hill, but after each day's work, the stones were pulled down and thrown into a nearby pool. When the construction site was changed, no further delays were experienced.

title: Headless Man
date: Unknown, but may have been heard 17 October 2009, around 22:30h
info: Having hanged himself, this headless gentleman is reported to still drive his horse and trap around the neighbourhood. One witness heard a horse passing close to her late at night, but nothing could be seen.

title: Cries for Help
location: Benthall - Benthall Edge - area of former limestone pit
info: A man carrying the week's wages for his mining crew was robbed and buried alive in this area in the late nineteenth century. Cries and screams are still reported coming from his living grave.

title: Owd Scriven o' Brompton
location: Berrington - Area once known as Banky Piece (no longer exists) and church
info: The wooden effigy on display in the church is known as 'Owd Scriven o' Brompton', and is said to have been a knight who encountered a lion in the area. The knight managed to slay the big cat, although was left with a large scar on his face, which is visible in the effigy.

title: Caught in the Tread
location: Bishops Castle - Lea Stone, located near the castle ruins
info: The Lea Stone was created when the Devil picked the rock from his boot and tossed it aside.

title: Meeting Point
info: It is a curious local legend that states that once a year all the ghosts in the UK meet at the stones, one assumes for their AGM. Another story says that if the stones ever sink into the earth, England shall be ruined; the Devil occasionally sits on the stones to speed up the process.

title: Edric's Sword
location: Bomere Heath - Pool (may no longer exist)
info: Legend has it that Wild Edric's sword was placed in a pool on the heath, ready for the day that Edric was ready to wield it once more. The blade was protected by a magical fish, which may or may not have used the sword to cut through fishermen's nets.

title: Knight
info: Two brothers stopped playing and ran and hid after spotting a ghostly grey knight standing at the top of their staircase. One of the brothers also reported waking at night to see a man smoking a pipe at the foot of his bed, while their mother said she had seen faces while on the staircase.

title: Running Lady
location: Bomere Heath - Small road between Bomere Heath and Walford, near the railway bridge
info: A driver and his wife watched an elderly lady wearing grey with a headscarf run across the road ahead of them. The scene was weird, as the figure looked wispy, and her clothes appeared to be moving slower than the woman herself. Stranger still, while the driver had watched her cross the road from the left hand side, his wife saw her cross from the right.

title: Drover
info: A drover murdered in a fight is reputed to haunt this inn. An energy-conscious poltergeist is also said to switch lights off during the night.

title: Walter
info: Walter is said to be the ghost of a former landlord who now haunts the pub.

title: Woman in Black
info: A mystery woman in black is said to haunt the dining room. Bells have been heard ringing in other parts of the hotel after dark.

title: Chambermaid
info: This inn is reputed to be haunted by the ghost of a chambermaid. While living, the woman discovered her husband was having an affair and, in a fit of rage, murdered the adulteress. The chambermaid was hanged for the crime.

title: Screaming
info: Screaming was once heard emerging from an empty cellar.

title: Secret Cavern
info: An old tradition said that there was a secret cavern under the caves which led to a chest of treasure and another exit located somewhere on the other side of the Severn. The floor of the cave was thoroughly dug in 1877 in an effort to find the hidden entrance, but the search found nothing.

title: Black Lady
location: Bridgnorth - Magpie House Restaurant (now Bassa Villa public house)
info: This phantom's children were drowned in the cellar of Magpie House when the River Severn broke its banks. The woman in black has been observed moving around the building and is sometimes heard crying.

title: Giant Arm
location: Bridgnorth - Road from Cleobury North, around one mile from Bridgnorth
info: A woman and her friends were travelling back to Bridgnorth in a horse-drawn carriage when the creature suddenly stopped. The woman climbed from the carriage and tried to motivate the horse but was flung on the ground by an unseen force. A giant arm and hand then manifested, wrapped around the horse's neck. The distant ringing of church bells caused the arm to vanish, with the horse able to resume the journey. The woman later discovered that her aunt had died at the same time the arm had appeared.

title: Arnold
info: Arnold was the name given to the ghostly figure seen by Mr and Mrs Reynolds, who believed he would manifest to warn of an impending accident. It may have been the same entity spotted by a soldier on duty during the Second World War. More recently, a phantom steam locomotive has been reported, although this 'ghost' could have been generated by activities surrounding the local annual steam gala.

title: Man in White
info: A man dressed in white clothing is said to manifest once the building has been closed for the night.

title: The Black Lady
info: The sight of the phantom woman in black clothing who haunts this area is said to have unnerved many a person, and it is said some locals still avoid the area at night (just to be safe).

title: Woman in White
info: This phantom woman in a long white dress is reputed to manifest before an impending death.

title: Black Dog
info: A gentleman who committed suicide in the village is said to have returned in the form of a large black dog.

title: Talking Faces
info: One person at this property watched two faces, which spoke, appear in a wall. Other people reported seeing a servant girl manifest on the end of a bed. A couple of years later, witnesses outside spotted a man standing by a window, although the property was empty. Disembodied footsteps were also reported.

title: Woman with a Candle
location: Broseley - Ruined churchyard (restoration work to begin in 2022)
info: This white figure, seen wearing a poke bonnet and carrying a candle, appeared in front of three witnesses before quickly disappearing. A photographer claims to have captured her on film, though this author has yet to see the image.

title: Undone Work
info: The old church here had to be constructed away from the planned site after the workmen constantly found all their previous day's work undone. The Devil was blamed and after moving the building site, no more delays were experienced.

title: Black Monk
location: Buildwas - Buildwas Power Station (aka Ironbridge Power Station)
info: Built partly on the site of a ruined abbey, several workers at the power station have reported seeing a ghostly black monk walking around the modern building. One employee also reported seeing a phantom woman floating in his path who vanished before his eyes. Both audio and visual paranormal experiences have been reported by residents from Leighton village. (Image copyright 2006 Lawson Clout)

title: Bottled Ghost
info: A local legend says that a ghost was bottled and buried under the steps of this pub by two clergymen. When the steps were replaced hundreds of years later, no bottle was found.

title: Bleeding Builder
info:
After Judge Leighton sentenced a builder to die, the judge agreed to lessen the punishment if the man helped build a new chimney stack on Leighton's roof. The builder agreed, but after the work was complete the judge hanged the man from the chimney before entombing the corpse within it. The chimney occasionally drips blood, and the ghost of the builder (sometimes accompanied by an unknown woman) is still said to walk the hall.

Another legend attached to the site says a group of clergymen met one night to play cards. The devil appeared, and all but one man ran away - his friends later found a man-sized blood stain on the floor that could never be washed away.

title: Royalist
info: The ghost of a Royalist on horseback is said to ride silently around the lanes leading to this village.

title: Madam Pigott
location: Chetwynd Aston - A41, and Chetwynd Hall & surrounding area
info: Having died in childbirth, Madam Pigott was seen dozens of times carrying her baby and combing its hair. Some also reported the lady also having a cat with her. She was eventually exorcised by twelve parsons, though in 1969 two motorists separately reported a white figure on the road near the church.

title: Mermaid
info: This mermaid was so upset at the way she was treated by onlookers, she drove to the bottom of the pool and never returned. It was thought that she guarded a mass of treasure.

title: Roll Call
info: Those who walk twelve times around the church at midnight on this date shall hear the names of the villagers due to die within the following twelve months.

title: Major Smalman
location: Church Stretton - Area around Wilderhope Manor
info: A diehard Royalist, Smalman's home was once besieged by Roundheads during the latter stages of the Civil War. The Major managed to escape on horseback, his ghost now seen galloping away from the building. The manor itself is also reported to be haunted by both Smalman and the shade of a young girl who smiles at any witnesses before screaming horribly.

title: Rustling Woman
location: Church Stretton - Area once known as Copper Hole (north of village, close to Hazler Road/B4371 junction)
info: A man walking from the village towards Hope Bowdler spotted a woman moving slowly behind him. He stopped to let her catch up with him, and even though she appeared to be walking, she never moved any closer. The man could hear the rustling of her dress but no footsteps. He paused his journey a couple more times, and finally the woman moved towards him, only to drift silently through a hedge and out of sight.

title: Wooden Legged Man
location: Church Stretton - Bottle and Glass Inn
info: The sounds of a man with a wooden leg has been heard walking around this public house.

title: Falling Down
info: The screams of a young girl haunt an old copper mine, where she fell to her death down an open shaft.

title: Wild Edric
location: Church Stretton - Hills around the town
info: The large hound with eyes that glow red like hot coals is said to be a manifestation of Wild Edric, local hero and protector of Britain.

title: Bushy Bearded Man
info: This cloaked, bearded gentleman was seen lurking around the attic and one of the bathrooms. A few unearthly notes from a non-existent music box have been heard in the bar area.

title: Madam Vernon
info: Madam Vernon's ghost returned soon after death, upset at how her family had split her wealth and land. The spirit caused much trouble, until clergymen banished the entity to a pond under the house.

title: Young Men
location: Barton under Needwood - Former RAF Tatenhill, now a business park
info: A witness who works on the site has reported the smell of old aftershave in the corner of a warehouse which is only detectible at 20:30h, and the sounds of young men in disused buildings. A loud crash and the shaking of a concrete floor resulting in one employee running to a warehouse, convinced that racking units must have collapsed, but nothing was disturbed. On one summer night, the sound of young children playing and singing could be heard by the main gate at 23:00h, a location many miles from the nearest residential site.

title: Woman in White
location: Bilston - Greyhound and Punchbowl public house, was once Stow Heath Manor House
