info: Emma and Edward were the children of different innkeepers who fell in love - Edward died of fever and Emma pined away soon after. Their ghosts are reputed to be regulars at the Inn, as is another young boy who haunts the cellar and a man in a bowler hat.

title: White Haired Head
location: Burnopfield - Railway track running through the village
info: A floating face was reported by several men along the line. The entity had a twisted face and white hair, and its prior to its materialisation, metallic clanging would be heard. The ghost was eventually named as a platelayer who had died after being hit by a coal wagon in 1879.

title: Tall Man
location: Byers Green - (Former) Marquis of Granby public house
info: This former pub is said to be haunted by a tall man. A plumber is also said to have fled the site after watching a stool move across the room unaided.

title: Anne Walker
location: Chester le Street - Exact location not recorded
info: The ghost of Anne Walker appeared to a miller, telling him the location where her body could be found. The miller ignored the ghost, but after she appeared several more times, he informed the authorities. Her body was discovered in a coal pit, as the ghost had described. One of her family and a family friend were later arrested and executed for her murder.

title: Lady Lumley
info: The 'Lily of Lumley', as the lady is also known, was killed by several monks after refusing to agree with their religious beliefs. When Sir Ralph discovered what had happened to his wife, he had the monks executed. The monks are sometimes seen walking in file around the area of the castle, while Lady Lumley walks within the castle's corridors and grounds. An Australian cricket player reported seeing the monks in 2005, while in 2017 a witness claimed to have photographed two ghostly faces in the windows.

title: Woman
date: Unknown, likely to be early twentieth century
info: A ghostly woman was said to haunt this stretch of waterway.

title: Madam Lambton
location: Chester le Street - South Biddick Hall
info: This shade has been reported drifting around the hall.

title: Nun
location: Coatham Mundeville - Hall Garth Golf and Country Club Hotel
info: Room 2 is reputedly haunted by the ghost of a nun bricked up alive within the walls after her affair with a monk was discovered.

title: Voices
info: Two ghost hunts were said to have detected tapping on mirrors and voices, although a similar overnight paranormal stakeout planned for charity in 2013 was declined due to 'health and safety'.

title: Red eyed Figure
location: Cold Hesledon - Lane leading away from the Pemberton Arms
info: The CFZ website reported that a couple walking along a dark lane encountered a seven foot tall, black, man-shaped figure with glowing red eyes. The couple watched it for around fifteen seconds before it screamed and dropped from view.

title: Misty Shape
info: A site popular with paranormal events companies, there are claims of doors being slammed unaided, cold spots and misty shapes.

title: Woman on the Bed
info: A family featured in the local press after being terrified by their haunted house. One of the children burst into tears after encountering a phantom woman sitting on their bed, while other family members experienced poltergeist-like activity. The former occupants of the property also experienced something strange, although the details were not forthcoming.

title: Mill Worker
info: The ghost of a mill worker who mysteriously vanished is seen along this lane.

title: Postman
location: Consett - Wooded area, Consett Lane / Pemberton Road
info: A phantom postman in 1950s clothing was said to wander this area.

title: Hunted
info: The hall has gained a reputation as being haunted and has been home to various ghost hunting events. The haunting entity here is thought to be connected to one of the cottages which stood here before the hall was built.

title: Ex-smoker
info: A child first reported seeing this ghost, telling her mother that 'a man's come out of the wall and he says he does the shopping in the sky'. Others detected his presence due to the cigarette smoke of which he reeks.

title: Wife with Child
info: This woman, holding a small child, is believed to be searching for her husband killed in the battle of Neville's Cross in the 1300s. She reportedly seeks a lift to the battlefield.

title: Lady Gerrard
location: Darlington - Area around town hall and South Park
info: Lady Gerrard had her hand hacked off by two soldiers who took a liking to her ring. She died soon after from blood loss. Her ghost is said to help those in need, though it lacks an arm. Gerrard may have been encountered by a young lad who found himself lost in the park, manifesting as a grey lady who pointed in the direction of the child's family.

title: Paul
location: Darlington - Black and Grey Public house
info: Nicknamed 'Paul' by the proprietors, this entity was reported to have made so much noise on one occasion, the police were called as the ghost's antics were mistaken for a break-in. The ghost was also said to open fridge doors and create disembodied footsteps.

title: The Tartan Lady
info: This ghostly Scot came to Blackwell after the Duke of Cumberland stole her portrait and brought it here in 1746. Though the painting has since been destroyed, the Tartan Lady still haunts the building.

title: Senor Rino Pepi
info: The theatre's founder, Senor Rino Pepi, is still said to sit to the left of the stage, wearing his top hat and long coat. The cries of a sobbing child (perhaps acting) have also been reported around the changing rooms.

title: Woman in White
location: Darlington - Former guest house (no longer operating), Corporation Road
info: The ghostly woman who haunted this guest house is said to have been killed on the road outside many years earlier. She would be seen standing on top of the staircase by the manager. Poltergeist activity was also reported on the site - items in the kitchen would be moved overnight, lights would turn themselves on, and the manager was 'held' at the top of the staircase by an unknown force.

title: Changing Entity
location: Darlington - Glassensikes (steam or river) and Harewood Hill area
info: The large black dog once said to haunt this area could also take the form of a flaming headless man, a headless woman, a white cat, or a rabbit.

title: Lost Souls
location: Darlington - Hell's Kettles, along the River Tees
info: Deep pools of water located along the river, the Hell's Kettles are said to contain the souls of sinners. Some report that these people (and animals in some cases) can be seen floating in the pools when the waters are clear.

title: Lady Jerratt
location: Darlington - Manor House constructed by Bishop Pudsey
info: Murdered in the building, the ghost of Lady Jerratt appeared to only have one arm, as the other had been severed during the attack. A bloody thumbprint and fingerprint were said to have remained on the wall, impossible to scrub away or paint over.

title: Hound Attack
location: Darlington - Old Darlington and Stockton rail station
info: A night watchman reported being attacked by a man and his dog as they came out of the coal house - the watchman defended himself and tried to punch his attacker, only for his fist to pass through the figure and hit the wall behind. The pair of entities then went back into the coal house and vanished.

title: Old Pinkney
location: Darlington - Old manor house (no longer standing?), Blackwell
info: The manor was haunted by an entity which wore a red cap and went under the nickname Old Pinkney. A well under the house was known as Pinkney's Well and was never used after dusk. The surrounding area was also said to be haunted by a headless man.

title: Mynarski
info: Mynarski was awarded the VC for trying to save a rear gunner when the bomber they were in caught fire. His ghost dressed in flying kit has been seen around the airport's hotel.

title: Pekinese and Pepi
info: The little Pekinese dog was buried within the walls of the theatre, its ghostly presence indicated by lightly padding feet moving across the floors, and soft panting. Pepi, the dog's owner and former manager, is also said to haunt the building, as are several other entities; a stage manager, a female dancer, and a hanging man.

title: Broken Apron
info: The Devil decided to sabotage the construction of Durham Cathedral; he visited Castle Eden and found an inferior piece of limestone that could added to the cathedral foundations. Placing the stone in his apron pocket, the Devil took to the skies, only for his apron to snap and the stone to fall. The Devil's scratch marks can still be seen on the rock, where he tried to catch it but and failed.

title: Spinning Tree
info: Cupboard doors would open and close, a bed lifted itself up, and the Christmas tree span with such forced that decorations fell from it. One man collapsed after seeing a ghostly shape walk towards him down a passage.

title: Witchy Neighbourhood
info: The people from this area had a reputation as being practitioners of witchcraft.

title: White Lady
location: Akeld - Small piece of woodland between village and Yeavering (may no longer stand)
info: A small strip of woodland was said to be home to a white female phantom.

title: Soldier
info: According to local press, the hotel was named the county's most haunted hotel by the 'Poltergeist Society', although the society appears never to have existed. Putting this potential marketing exercise to one side, the building is reputedly home to a phantom soldier, a small child, a chicken, ghostly whispers, and the sounds of someone screaming.

title: Creature from the Tomb
info: The vampire that once frequented this castle, a former lord of the estate, lived under the site and would emerge at night to attack the local villagers. An outbreak of plague was also attributed to the unholy creature, and this resulted in the villagers digging the monster up from its shallow grave and burning it.

title: Dancing within Limits
location: Alnwick - Fairy ring at Chathill Farm (ring may no longer exist)
info: Children would dance around a fairy circle here, although it was said if they circled the site more than nine times, fairies would spirit the offending child away.

title: Lancelot
location: Alnwick - Joyous Gard, possibly Alnwick Castle
info: Lancelot was laid to rest at his castle, Joyous Gard. Some believe that this fort later become known as Alnwick Castle.

title: Wishing Well
location: Alnwick - Pin Well (was in parkland, not known if it still exists)
info: Tradition said that your wishes would come true if you walk three times around the well before leaping across it and dropping in a pin.

title: Cursed Bottles
location: Alnwick - Ye Olde Cross public house
info: A collection of bottles on display in the pub are reportedly cursed - the last person to touch them died soon after, and now they are covered up to avoid further mishaps.

title: Handless Monk
info: This cowled entity possessed no visible hands, feet or face. During the 1980s the figure may have twice been seen in a home just outside of Alwinton.

title: School Boy
location: Alwinton - Private residence outside of village
info: A young boy, around six years old and wearing a school uniform, was seen in the garden by someone at home here. The child looked solid but disappeared near the garden gate. A local legend says that a young schoolboy had drowned in a nearby river.

title: Leaping Woman
location: Amble - Cliffs close to Cliff House
info: A ghostly woman leaps from these cliffs, fading away before she hits the sea below.

title: Short Woman
location: Ashington - Private house along Newbiggin Road
info: A girl reported seeing a short woman in her parent's bedroom, dressed in ancient Egyptian clothing.

title: Olde Knight
info: This armour clad knight is also often heard stomping about the castle, sometimes rattling his chains. A ghostly woman in a green cloak is sometimes seen falling from the top of the castle, vanishing before she hits the ground.

title: Free Money
location: Bamburgh - Rocky outcrop on which castle is built
info: Lucky people are said to be able to find money which has been left by the fairies, but if they failed to add a coin of their own to the hoard they had found, everything would slip away.

title: The Laidly Worm
info: This area was, for a brief time, home to a large slimy serpent - it turned out to be the daughter of the king, transformed by a curse from her evil stepmother. The king's son discovered the truth, saved his sister, and turned his mother into a toad. Another variant of the story says a dragon held the king's daughter hostage until she was saved by a knight who came from overseas.

title: Murdered Robber
info: This entity is heard engaged in a struggle during which several pieces of furnishings are knocked over - when the sounds are investigated, all rooms appear calm and undisturbed.

title: Thrown Objects
info: Before being removed by farmers, the standing stones which stood around the area were thought to have been thrown by giants engaged in combat.

title: Fairy Home
info: The moorland in his region was considered a place where the little people could hide.

title: Horses
info: Three girls unable to sleep in their dorm one night all heard the thunderous sound of horses and the clanking of metal pass through the room. One witness said they were so terrified they did not dare open their eyes.

title: RAF Pilot
location: Belsay - A696, just outside of village
info: Media outlets reported that Rob Davies and Chris Felton had filmed a figure which resembled a 'RAF pilot' standing on the roadside late at night. Although the footage was poor, the witnesses said the figure was dressed all in beige and held his arm out as if hitchhiking. When they turned the car around and drove back for another look, the figure had vanished.

title: Waters of Luck
location: Bertley - Village well (may no longer exist)
info: Miners would visit this well during the early hours of New Year's Day to fill their flasks, as it was believed any household which housed the water throughout the year would have luck bestowed upon it.

title: Walking Dead
location: Berwick on Tweed - Exact area(s) unknown
info: A former wealthy man who died was said to have returned from the grave and walked the streets at night. A pack of dogs were said to escort him. Finally, a group of local men dug up the grave and incinerated the body, though most of the men are said to have died soon after from an unknown disease.

title: Green Shark
info: A 1.8 metre long shark was discovered in this river, green in colour and no doubt a long way from home.

title: Scottish Piper
info: The ghostly Scot plays his pipes while pacing up and down one of the ruined battlements.

title: Woman in White
info: Several locals reported seeing a phantom woman with ginger hair, dressed in white or grey, in the early hours of the morning. It was said to have followed people as they left the area, while one other witness observed it reading headstones.

title: Victorian Woman
location: Berwick Upon Tweed - Gate House, Sandgate
info: It has been reported that a Victorian woman haunts beneath the gatehouse, ascending the stairs before vanishing. Some people have seen her peering out of the attack window.

title: Hoof Marks
info: A standing stone at this site was said to feature marks where the Devil had jumped and landed upon it (by mistake, as he was aiming for a building some half mile away).

title: Woman in Black
info: This ghostly girl forlornly drifts around the village - it is thought that she was accidentally trampled to death by horsemen many years ago. This ghost should not be confused with the other Black Heddon spirit; familiarly known as Silky, it jumps on the backs of passing horse riders, scaring them and often causing the horse to bolt.

title: Murdered Monks
info: Killed by a group of bandits, the monks of this abbey can occasionally be seen drifting across their land. The phantom pealing of the abbey bell accompanies them.

title: Dorothy Foster
info: Dorothy's brother escaped to France in 1715, and her ghost looks for someone who will take a message to him. The ghost of a monk dressed in white has been seen and heard moving things around in the Radcliffe Room.

title: Dorothy Forster
location: Blanchland - Old Hexham Road, and Lord Crewe Arms public house
info: The phantom Dorothy is still reported to drift down the road, heading towards the pub where she also haunts.

title: Living Elsewhere
info: Although the details are fleeting, this vicarage received a mention in a 1933 newspaper as a place where the occupants 'suffered weird inconveniences'.

title: Soldiers
info: Built in 1916, this defensive structure is reputedly haunted by nine British soldiers who drowned during the First World War.

title: Shaking Bottles
info: Having broken a lamp in the nearby Railway Hotel, an unseen entity moved to this pub and violently shook the bar, rattling bottles and sending a couple of glasses smashing to the floor. Discussing the incident in the local press, the owner also claimed that an unearthly tune occasionally emerged from the cocktail cabinet in the upstairs flat.

title: Footsteps
info: Two employees claimed as they began their morning duty of making wreaths, loud footsteps would start stomping around in the storeroom above. When investigated, the room would be empty.

title: Pianist
info: The owners of this pub heard the piano playing in the back room as they were tidying up. When investigated, no one could be found, and the piano keyboard remained covered. The event occurred a day after two other nearby pubs reported poltergeist-like incidents.

title: Older Woman
info: A witness stated that, when a child playing with toys in their room, a peaceful older woman would sit at the end of the bed and watch. The witness assumed the woman lived with the family at the house, although no one else in the family ever saw her. Many years later, the witness heard that a latter tenant had reported seeing an older woman standing by the foot of their bed.

title: Shadows
info: A former resident at this property described watching unexplained shadows in a room and hearing someone walking around on the landing when no one was in that area.

title: Flying Lamp
info: After an unseen hand threw a lamp from a shelf and smashed it on the ground, Bar staff blamed Peter, a poltergeist which occasionally caused mischief.

title: Edwardian Man
info: At least two witnesses have observed a man in Edwardian dress walking through this churchyard, vanishing into thin air when reaching the edge of the church itself. It is said the road outside the church is haunted by a man on a penny farthing bicycle.

title: Tall Monkey with Glowing Eyes
info: A late night fishing party reported seeing an eight foot creature standing upright, with radiant eyes.

title: Excalibur
location: Broomlee Lough (also referred to as Bromley Lake) - Waters of the lake
info: The lake is another contender for the claim for being the resting place for King Arthur's sword. Another legend says the lake is home to a treasure that can only be retrieved by chain made by seventh generation blacksmith that is pulled by a team of twin horses, twin oxen, and twin youths.

title: Grizelda the Highway Woman
date: At the end of every month (reoccurring), last seen 1987
info: Dressed as a male highwayman, this girl has been seen still riding her midnight black horse. She reportedly held up a stagecoach carrying an execution order condemning a friend of hers, which bought him enough time to escape the noose.

title: Warning Voice
info: During the castle's construction on the planned site, the walls collapsed and a disembodied voice announced that the structure should be built elsewhere - the advice was taken, and the building work went uninterrupted. Another version of the story has a more prosaic slant and suggests a lady requested her servant dress in a boar skin and knock down the construction at night; the superstitious builders reported the figure to be monstrous, which forced the construction to move to the site the lady preferred. The new castle is plagued by mysterious sounds, thought to be created by a phantom priest.

title: Dark Figure
info: While walking their dog, a witness spotted a dark figure with a smaller object, which was initially thought to be another dog. Each time the witness looked away and then back, the dark figure was much further along the path until, in the blink of an eye, the dark figure vanished.

title: Dunnie
info: A troublemaking entity, the Dunnie was said to take the form of a horse and allow itself to be ridden, only to disappear when the rider was above a muddy puddle.

title: Resting Warriors
info: At one time, the entrance to the Roman strong room in this fort was believed to contain five hundred spectral horsemen who woke each night and rode out.

title: Reiver
info: The ghostly figure said to haunt this range of hills was thought to be a Border Reiver, a raider who hid their treasures in the crags.

title: Fairy Home
info: As with Elwin Stream near Melrose, this small body of water was once thought to be the home of the fairies, the circular pebbles within considered elf plates.

title: Never-ending Cave
location: Cheviot Hills - Eelin's Hole (exact location not known)
info: A cave system here was thought to either be endless or to come out on moorland several miles away. One tale tells of a hunting party which chased their prey into the cave entrance only to never emerge, while another has the familiar piper enter playing his pipes, only for the instrument to abruptly end and the man never to be seen again.

title: Former Vicar
info: Churchgoers reported being able to see a figure standing at the windows of this building. The ghost was said to resemble a former vicar and had regularly returned for over a month.

title: Dart Throwing
location: East Boldon - Black Bull public house
info: In an interview with local press, manger Kelly Hedley said chairs had moved unaided, darts were known to be thrown by an unseen hand, and glasses would slide and smash. Ghostly children and a sad Cavalier are reputed to haunt the site.

title: Charlie Gordon
info: Charlie enjoyed the hospitality of this public house that he returned to it two years after dying. Seen dressed in a grey suit by the new landlady, she had no idea who he was until she described him to a couple of (living) regulars.

title: German Officer
info: One author has claimed that this modern piece of art is haunted by the ghost of a Nazi recruiting officer from the Second World War, though the reason why is not properly explained.

title: Middle Aged Man
location: Gateshead - Beeswing public house (no longer open), Felling
info: A middle-aged man in a waistcoat and spats would stand at the bar with an old-fashioned glass containing ale. Newcomers to the bar were said to have engaged the man in conversation, although no one else could see him. It was speculated that the man may have been connected to one of the Felling pit disasters.

title: Plate Smashing
info: Poltergeist disruption in a council house here was said to be so bad that the tenant finally fled after bottles were smashed and their crockery broken. An exorcism was performed on the site in December after which the activity ceased, until the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day when Christmas Decorations were shattered and chairs moved across the floor.

title: Bump
location: Gateshead - Dead Man's Arch (former site of Bensham Station)
info: A local piece of folklore says a train driver took his life under the arch. If one walks along the footpath at midnight on New Year's Day, you can feel the bump of a body against your own.

title: Sitting Man
location: Gateshead - Golden Lion public house, Winlaton
info: A photograph taken in this pub purports to show a strange man sitting in the background, slightly out of proportion to the rest of the environment. As the floor in the pub had just been raised, it has been suggested that this is the reason why the image looks slightly strange.

title: Dead Alien
location: Gateshead - Hedley Street and St Cuthbert's Church
info: Five-year-old Robert Hall, together with other children, encountered several strange figures shortly after observing an egg-shaped flying object. One of the figures resembled a short bigfoot, while another had a skeletal body and bat wings. After taking a sample of Robert's blood, the figures left. The following day, a short 'grey'-like alien appeared to Robert. The boy's screams brought his uncle to the scene, who killed the alien with a shovel. A local story says the alien's body is buried in a nearby churchyard (or concealed within a secret room).

title: Actor
info: The theatre is reportedly home to disembodied voices and footsteps that can be heard after the building is closed for the night. One story says the theatre is haunted by an actor who died on stage.

title: Former Wagons
location: Gateshead - Site of old Heworth Colliery, Leam Lane Estate
info: While little of the colliery remains, dog walkers and children have heard machinery and the shunt of old train wagons. Ghostly figures have also been reported.

title: Black Shape
location: Gateshead - Three Tuns public house, Sheriffs Hill
info: A member of staff was left in tears after being approached by a black shape. An article in the local paper claimed that there had been a hundred incidents over the years which resulted in people encountering something or leaving the site out of fear.

title: Woman in Black
info: One of three ghosts reportedly haunting this building, the woman in black would be observed disappearing into a wall. A male shadow has been seen darting across the bar area, and finally, a young fair haired boy has also been spotted.

title: Cats' Eyes
info: While walking along the track passing close to Seven Sisters, a witness spotted cat's eyes reflecting in their torch beam. The witness turned off the light, and when they turned it back on about a minute later, the torchlight reflected multiple pairs of eyes. The witness said the eyes were between knee and waist height and moved very fast.

title: Isabella Chaytor
info: The building is reputedly home to the ghostly Isabella Chaytor, daughter of Sir William Chaytor, the nineteenth century Whig MP for Sunderland.

title: Venerable Bede's Chair
info: Newlywed brides who sit in this famous chair soon fall pregnant, according to local legend. Another version of the legend says that anyone to sit on the chair is granted three wishes.

title: Overpopulated
info: A team of investigators claimed that this was the most haunted public house in England, with seven ghosts being 'detected' by their electro-magnetic apparatus. One of the shades is reportedly the ghost of a smuggler who tried to inform the authorities of his gang's actions - they found out and locked him away, allowing him to starve to death. A secret tunnel is said to run to another nearby haunted pub, the Jolly Sailor.

title: Legs
info: Cleaning staff reported this building to be haunted by a ghost of which only the bottom half could be observed; one member of the team fled after encountering the entity.

title: Jack the Beadle
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - All Saints Church, Quayside
info: Jack was a well-liked member of the community before being caught and tried for removing and selling lead from coffins. A local legend now places Jack's ghost in the churchyard.

title: Martha Wilson
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Area around Broad Chare
info: The phantom woman haunting the area has been named as Martha Wilson, a suicide buried at a nearby crossroads. One man who encountered Martha said she wore a veil - she lifted it up as he approached, in time for him to realise she had no face.

title: Woman's Voice
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Blackie Boy public house
info: A woman's voice was heard screaming 'Get out! Get Out!' from an empty cubical in the men's toilets, causing a member of staff in the room to flee.

title: Furniture Mover
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Board Room public house, Stevenson Road
info: Landlord Richard Bell reported shattering glasses, moving pictures and upset furniture at his pub.

title: George
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Carriage public house (former station), Archbold Terrace
info: George was said to have worked for the railways and died in an accident on the track. He is said to haunt the pub and is blamed when things fall or break. A woman and man are also said to haunt the site - they were killed while standing on the platform when a bomb exploded nearby during the Second World War.

title: Joseph the Monk
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Former La Dolce Vita nightclub (now closed)
info: A lover of dance when he lived, Joseph's shade would appear to have been kick-started when a nightclub opened near his grave. The tall monk dressed in his robes was seen dancing in the club several times by both staff and customers.

title: A Hound Follows
info: It was believed that a phantom dog would follow midwives as they travelled around the city. If the dog laughed as the midwife reached her destination, all would be well, but if the hound howled, then complications would follow. One report described the hound as Mastiff-like.

title: Mummy
info: It was reported in 2004 that this Egyptian mummy's ghost is still active, and now walks around the museum at night.

title: Door Opener
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Lit and Phil Library
info: Video footage released showed a fire door opening on its own accord, although a gust of wind or change in air pressure are the more likely mundane explanations. The building is also used by ghost hunt organisers.

title: Golfer
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Maisonette built over an old coal mine, near Battle Hill
info: Reported on BBC Northeast, the occupants of several maisonettes were haunted by strange sounds, unexplained footsteps and moving objects. One family took to leaving at night and sleeping elsewhere. Another man reported his golf clubs and balls were scattered across a room - he fled from his home. A BBC sound engineer speculated that the building's construction could be responsible for creating and amplifying the sounds.

title: Businessman
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Manors railway station
info: Wearing a smart three-piece suit and bowler hat, and holding an umbrella, this phantom figure stands on the platform as if waiting for a train. The man is said to look concerned and would suddenly disappear.

title: Black Shadow
info: A four foot tall black mass was photographed here during a ghost hunt, seemingly coming out of a wall.

title: Small Child
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Newcastle Keep, the Black Gate
info: A small child is reputed to haunt this area. Steve Taylor, the local ghost walk organiser, reported several strange occurrences, including stone throwing, growling sounds and strange black shapes. People on the site have experienced being bitten or scratched by unseen perpetrators.

title: Man with Dog
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Old George public house
info: A ghostly man and his dog have been spotted in the bar, vanishing if approached. Another ghostly figure has been seen sitting in a chair, while elsewhere footsteps without feet go about their business.

title: Faded Nun
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Private residence along Bentinck Road
info: A woman and her child moved away from this property after seeing the faded figure of a nun drift down a passage before vanishing. The woman had experienced poltergeist-like activity in the property prior to the sighting, including toys being activated in the early hours of the morning without cause and items vanishing for several days at a time.

title: Jane Jameson
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Quayside, area around John Wesley's memorial
info: Jane was executed in 1829 for the murder of her mother, although she did try to frame her boyfriend for the crime. Jane now calls out for her lover to find her.

title: Edwardian Man
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Robinson's Wine Bar, Cloth Market
info: This ghostly figure was seen leaning against a wall within the bar. A manager who witnessed the entity described it as a tall man with grey hair, wearing Edwardian clothing.

title: Cavalier
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Sallyport, Carpenter's Tower
info: This soldier died fighting against the Scots in 1644. His phantom reportedly gazes from the tower window. One witness watched him float from the ground into the air, disappearing into the ceiling - she was later told that a spiral staircase stood where she had seen the apparition.

title: Grinning Lady
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Slug and Lettuce public house
info: Two women who took a self-portrait in this pub caught a grinning female figure in the shot; the image appeared in several national outlets where the unknown figure was branded a ghost. Although the ghost could have a rational explanation, it is said that a phantom figure has been spotted several times since the image became known.

title: Fairy Court
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Small grassy mounds on Fawdon Hill (area now likely build over)
info: This hill was once believed to be the setting for the fairy court.

title: Girl in Blue Dress
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - St Andrew's Churchyard
info: A young curate who fell in love with the daughter of a local landowner was now about to set off to see the lass at home when he spotted her walking around the churchyard. The man ran into the churchyard, but she had vanished. The following day he discovered that she had died at home during the night. Though it is said she still walks the area, none have seen her recently.

title: Healing Well
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - St Mary's Well, Jesmond
date: Well still present, vision in late eleventh century
info: This well was once said to have magical healing properties, while at an unstated location nearby, an apparition of the Blessed Virgin Mary appeared just after England was invaded by the Normans.

title: Knight
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - St Nicholas Church (now Newcastle Cathedral)
info: Before this church became Newcastle Cathedral, there were reports of a tall shadowy knight who would walk around day and night, vanishing around corners and pillars. The clank of ghostly armour was also heard.

title: Crying Child
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Stevenson Street, North Shields
info: A house along this road was haunted by the cries of a child, and the heart wrenching sobs of a woman - an infant's body was later discovered concealed within the building.

title: Henry Hardwick
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - The Cooperage public house, alleyways near the building
info: Trying to escape pressgangers, Hardwick was murdered, and has been seen near to where he died. A man dressed in Edwardian garb has also been seen in the area.

title: Bob Crowther
info: The ghost that has been felt as it pushes past people is thought to be an actor killed when a stage prop travelling at high velocity landed on him. He also reportedly has a favourite seat, in which he is occasionally seen.

title: Prior Olaf
info: This Viking raider who eventually found God has been seen on the site where so much raping and looting took place. Other phantom monks have been observed on site, several appearing to pray at a stone in the graveyard.

title: Longhaired Man
location: Newcastle upon Tyne - Unnamed public house along Westgate Road
info: This ghostly figure wearing a red coat walked through a barman closing the bar.

title: William Coulson
info: William was killed in an accident on 16 June 1852 after being hit by a coal wagon. His ghost is reputed to haunt the area and may have been seen by a tour guide in 2018. Other reported manifestations include footsteps, booms and voices.

title: Heavy Footsteps
info: Just a small part of the phenomena, the footsteps were heard first. Over a period of weeks, these developed into bangs, whistling, the sounds of machinery, and finally a voice that spoke. Phantom animals were seen around the building. The family finally moved out, though the spirit stayed a little longer (but was much quieter).

title: Giggly Meg
info: Several spooky entities have been reported as haunting this site, including Giggly Meg, a Grey Lady, a Victorian gentleman, and a former barman.

title: Knocking
location: South Shields - Barr Porter / Thai Udon Kitchen (restaurant), Dean Road
info: Warned by a former owner that the place was haunted, Alex Barr and Lee Porter opened their new restaurant and soon heard strange knocking coming from the upper part of the building. A visiting psychic claimed the site was home to three entities - Margaret, a young boy named James, and a monk. A photograph taken in a venue room purports to show a ghostly figure.

title: Floating Coffin
info: Two men driving sheep and returning home to York spotted a coffin floating in the air ahead of them, dipped as if carried on the shoulders of invisible men. A Bishop walked behind the coffin, his mouth moving but with no sound being heard. The apparitions vanished close to a field. Both men were said to have spent several days in bed after their encounter.

title: Giant's Treasure
info: The giant's treasure slipped from his grasp as he crossed the area, the hoard sinking into the ground and becoming covered in rocks. The giant had to leave the treasure behind, but it was written that a mortal man could recover the wealth if a fairy in the form of a chicken or an ape appeared; the man would have to reach out and grab the treasure without making a sound, and if he failed to do so, the fairy would never appear to him again.

title: Banished Spirit
location: Aldwark - Roads near the stone known as the Conjuring Stone, close to Chapel-garth (currently on grounds of Aldwark Manor)
info: A ghost which haunted the roads around this area would terrify the locals after dark, so a holy man was dispatched to banish the entity. After a time, the ghost was tied to a large rock which was designated the Conjuring Stone.

title: Mr Rimmington
info: The ghost of Rimmington reportedly takes several forms, including a man on horseback accompanied by two hounds, and the slightly less intimidating form of a robin.

title: Golden Men
info: A youngster playing in the grounds of the school watched a round craft land and three figures dressed in golden clothing climb out. The child ran off to find friends to tell, and when he returned with someone the craft was already back in the sky - it quickly flew off.

title: Earth-shaking Sounds
info: Coming from deep underground, low unearthly groans would often knock ornaments from their stands. The cause of the disturbance was finally exorcised.

title: Barguest
info: Possessing glowing red eyes and a yellow tint to its fur, the dog-like barguest is a harbinger of doom.

title: Trolls
info: Living beneath the ravine, the trolls are said to emerge at night and track down their prey - humans. At least one farmer was lured to his death by their ability to trick people into straying from the road.

title: William Nevison
info: The woods were a popular place for Nevison, a highwayman, to lurk before riding out to commit his crimes. After he was hanged in York, his shade returned to the scene of better times.

title: Sister Hylda
info: This nun haunted the area for seven years, zooming around at low altitude and accusing a friar of murdering her. It finally grew too much for the Abbess, who summoned all the nuns from the district and, along with an Archbishop, exorcised the spirit.

title: Monks
info: It was once believed that any torch taken into a particular stone passage would be extinguished by the ghosts of the monks. Logic would suggest that the torch would be blown out by the winds.

title: Mary
info: This location is another haunt of the spiritually busy Mary Queen of Scots, who has been seen here wearing a black velvet dress.

title: Rector
location: Aston - High Trees house, former rectory
info: This Rector murdered his wife after he caught her having an affair with a manservant. He is doomed to walk the buildings walls, and the bloodstain that her body created cannot be removed from the bedroom.

title: Breaker of Everything
location: Attercliffe - 37 Candow Street (road no longer exists)
info: Every breakable item in the household was reportedly smashed by this poltergeist. Visitors had to dodge a flying basin, and one person fainted after witnessing the activity. The occupants finally moved in with neighbours.

title: Projectionist?
info: Visited during the day when a nightclub, a member of the Sheffield Paranormal Society and other witnesses reported hearing a series of bangs, experiencing icy cold temperature and a twitching curtain, and feeling compression on her chest whilst in the former cinema projection room. It was said that a former projectionist loved his job and may have never left. The site was also said to have experienced several people dying in a fight in the dim and distant past. The visitors were told that cleaners in the toilets had been hit by unseen hands, while two security guards experienced something which resulted in them never returning.

title: White Army
info: A local vicar, while sitting by the river, watched a line of white troops pass accompanied by white horses - he wrote that it took over an hour for the column to pass.

title: Murdered Man
info: This hotel is reputedly haunted by a man knifed to death back in the days when the building was three cottages.

title: Halliwell Boggle
location: Atwick - Between village and Bewholme, pool of water at the bottom of the hill where the church stands (pool may no longer be present)
info: This entity was said to terrorise anyone foolish enough to walk this area.

title: Headless Highwayman
info: This decapitated spectral bandit remains lurking in the shadows of his old ambush area. One version of the story says he remains on his horse.

title: Grey Lady
info: This restless spirit was said to have made an appearance at many church events over a period of four hundred years, before she finally departed this plane of existence late in the nineteenth century.

title: Best at the Bottom
info: A man with a group of friends either jumped or fell into a deep pool in the village. The man did not return to the surface, but a series of bubbles emerged from the water, the popping forming the words 'It's best at the bottom'. The man's friends all jumped in to see whether the words spoke the truth. None returned from the pool.

title: Lady in Black
info: Dressed in dark Victorian clothing with white gloves and a walking stick, this woman has been mistaken for someone living, though she never interacts with witnesses.

title: Crimson Lady
info: Two phantoms were reputed to haunt this crossroads. A crimson lady (who is now likely redundant) would scare passing horses by leaping out at them. The second ghost, a pale woman on horseback, would scream at witnesses, and was said to chase passing cars.

title: The Forgotten
location: Baildon - Holden Lane (was known as Boggart Loin or Lane)
info: A local legend says this lane was haunted, although the details are no longer remembered.

title: Webbed Footed Hound
info: A large dog with eyes the size of saucers once haunted this area.

title: White Figures
info: It was written that if this building were passed while travelling along an old dirt track from Bainbridge, white ghostly figures could be seen wandering around.

title: A Man
location: Barmby Moor - Private garden, was known in nineteenth century as the Quakers' Burial Ground
info: A nineteenth century piece of folklore says that by turning around seven times in this garden on St Mark's Eve would result in a man appearing just behind you...

title: White Lady
info: The area around the site thought to be Robin Hood's final resting place (one of them!) is said to be haunted by a white lady who drifts around the area.

title: Victorian Miners
location: Barnsley - Area of the Lundhill colliery
info: The ghosts of several miners killed in a disaster in the 1850s were reported when the surrounding pits were in operation during the twentieth century.

title: Falling Items
info: Several poltergeist-like events have occurred in this shop, formally a funeral parlour. Items have fallen from shelving without a 'normal' explanation, while the occasional strange mist appears on CCTV.

title: Sally
info: Said to be built on the site of a poorhouse, the sounds of children wailing can be heard on the Infectious Diseases ward. A ghost nicknamed Sally haunts another area of the hospital and reportedly touches the side of anyone who enters the side room in which she died, while an area of offices is home to a friendly phantom old lady who sits in a rocking chair.

title: Knocks
location: Barnsley - Private residence (likely no longer standing), Harbrough Hill Road
info: Over a ten week period, the Wite family experienced random heavy knocking and disembodied footsteps throughout their home. Mrs White heard something crying upstairs and another family member claimed that something had pushed their head underwater while they washed the dishes.

title: Veiled Woman
location: Batley - Howley Hall ruins, and surrounding golf course
info: A woman with a red veil has been reported here, sometimes accompanied by two male escorts. It has been speculated that one of these men could be a highwayman by the name of William Nevison. Civil war soldiers are also said to haunt the area.

title: Rocking Chair
info: Jessops Mill's ghostly past featured in several newspaper articles when the property was sold in 2022. The site had previously featured on a television programme, and former staff had claimed to have encountered strange shadows and witnessed a rocking chair rock unaided.

title: Woman and Child
info: A manager at the hotel called in a ghost hunting group after a phantom woman was seen walking along the upper corridor, and a ghostly young child was reported sitting in the corner of the restaurant.

title: Butter Makers
location: Baysdale - Unidentified spring or well in the area
info: The little folk would use water in this area in the creation of their butter.

title: Misty Figure
location: Bedale - A684 road, leading to Leyburn
info: The road leading west from Bedale is reputedly home to a grey misty figure. The mist is also said to haunt a nearby wooded area.

title: The Running Lady
location: Beeford - Road between Beeford and Brandesburton
info: This woman in white is said to run along the road between the two villages, close to the North Frodingham junction.

title: Flying Lamp
info: Two men were walking along the platform one night. The paraffin lamp one man was carrying was wrenched from his hand and flew several metres in front of him. After picking up the lamp, the event repeated itself again. Both men retreated.

title: Walking
info: The sound of phantom footsteps moving across the bedroom at night was too much for one landlady, and she relocated to another part of the building.

title: Housekeeper
info: Murdered in a house that no longer stands, this lost shade has migrated to the nearby river where she walks along the bank.

title: Bogie Goose
info: The village is home to a mischievous spirit that has taken the form of a large white goose.

title: Simmon Beeather
info: This ghost was said to be a prisoner who committed suicide while incarcerated.

title: Strange Haired Man
location: Beverley - Old Friary (currently a private house)
info: The jolly old man haunting this building apparently has an unusual hairstyle and is believed to be several hundred years old.

title: Jocelyn Percy
info: Sir Jocelyn has been reported driving his coach and four headless horses around the streets of this otherwise quiet neighbourhood. Another version of the legend says he flies above the street, pausing briefly over an unnamed house.

title: Beer Barrel Mover
info: This spirit is heard moving things around in the cellar. It is thought to be a murder victim from the early 1990s, who has become lost trying to find 'the other side'.

title: Hording Lizard
info: A dragon was said to reside in a tumulus, protecting its hoard.

title: Hooded Nun
info: Murdered by her lover, this nun still walks near the driveway of the hall, still in denial of her death at the hands of the man she loved.

title: Druid's Curse
info: A sixty centimetre stone head, thought to be Celtic, was deemed to be cursed after several people who encountered it became bankrupt, ill or died.

title: Landlady
location: Birchencliffe - Grey Horse Inn, Halifax Road
info: Staff in 2007 encountered shattering glasses and gas cylinders that were turned off with such force the handles were jammed. A story is told that one landlord during the 1990s encountered a ghostly figure that emerged from the cellar; this entity was a former landlady who killed herself during the 1940s or 1950s.

title: Highwayman
info: A horse-mounted highwayman stood on the roadside, looking towards Durham. The legs of the horse vanished at the knee, and the ghost vanishes if approached.

title: St Cuthbert's Mist
info: A Luftwaffe mission to bomb the city failed after a mist appeared and covered the castle and cathedral, preventing them from being hit. It is said that St Cuthbert created the mist to protect his relics.

title: Teenage Tearaway
location: Durham - Area around the Old Rectory
info: A postman spotted a ghostly shrouded child as he walked past the graveyard - he panicked and ran, the ghost in pursuit. Reaching home, the postman dived into his bedroom where both he and his wife barricaded themselves in. The phantom could be heard smashing up the room next door; both people took the opportunity to run away. A local wise woman who was summoned convinced the ghost to return to the grave.

title: Lady in Grey
info: The staircase here is reportedly haunted by a fleeting female in grey, while a beautiful woman in white has been seen in other areas of the building.

title: Grey Shadow
info: Reportedly the wife of one of the former Prince Bishops of Durham, this figure haunts the black staircase where she fell and broke her neck.

title: Passage of Horror
info: A secret passage is said to run from the cathedral to Finchale Abbey, though the journey is so terrifying no one can survive the journey. The Sanctuary Knocker at the Cathedral is hundreds of years old and appears to show a demonic entity with three tongues.

title: Murdered Inmate
info: A ground floor cell is said to be haunted by the scene of one prisoner murdering another with a table knife.

title: Northumbrian Pipes
location: Durham - Elvet Bridge (including Jimmy Allen's club)
info: The horse rustler Jimmy Allen died in this former cell days before his pardon arrived - he can still be heard playing on his pipes from beneath the bridge. The ghost of another man, who mysteriously vanished, would be spotted at the base of the bridge, standing on the river's banks.

title: Young Woman
info: A prisoner reported seeing a woman standing by a window in their cell. A guard later told them that someone had committed suicide in the spot the figure had stood.

title: Violet
info: A phantom woman who suddenly disappears when spotted was nicknamed Violet after the scent in the air which she leaves.

title: Coach
info: Seen galloping towards the hall, this coach is pulled by four black, headless horses. One legend says the coach contains a coffin.

title: Vanishing Lady
info: Observing the silhouette of a woman walking down the street, a witness watched as the figure promptly disappeared after passing under a streetlamp. Realising there was nowhere the figure could have gone, the perplexed witness searched the area without success.

title: Twisted Man
info: Emerging from the cellar of a property once owned by the city's chief constable, this little man, twisted and bent over, was said to wear a white ruffled shirt, black trousers and a nightcap.

title: Woman in a Black Dress
info: A sixteen year old girl screamed for her mother after seeing a phantom woman wearing a black dress appear in a bedroom. The following morning the family received a phone call informing them the girl's grandmother had died the night before, around the same time as the sighting.

title: Victorian Lady
info: Footsteps, strange noises and doors opening have been blamed on a phantom Victorian lady looking for two children who died in the former nursery room.

title: Girl's Laughter
info: Even though the only recent activity is said to be the sound of female laughter coming from the cellar, this pub is said to be also haunted by a grey lady, a cloaked figure (who could be a monk connected to the abbey that once stood here) and a man wearing a Guy Fawkes-style hat.

title: Children
info: Formally the largest wool mill in the world, children as young as six years old are reported as dying in accidents on the site. Children's voices are reported on the site and a dark figure spotted on a staircase.

title: Travelling Light
info: This phantom manifests as a light that moves around the cells. One former employee reported prison officers in Victorian uniform and the sounds of clanging chains, with the most paranormally active areas being the new wings which were constructed over executed prisoner's graves.

title: Suicidal Servant
info: A former hospital, this campus was named by local press as being haunted by several ghosts, including a servant who threw themselves down a stairwell and something which would open and close doors.

title: Black Cat with Cubs
location: Leeds - Between Headingley train station and Burley Park station
info: Workers on the track have seen a large black cat, around two metres in length, twice. On the first occasion the feline appeared to have two cubs, one light brown and the other black.

title: James Wood
info: A cobbler during life, a member of the cleaning staff encountered James' sorry looking ghost in one of the loading bays. The ghost was dressed in a muddy green jerkin and brown trousers.

title: Grey Haired Lady
info: The ladies' toilets appear to be home to a phantom elderly woman with long, straight grey/white hair. The figure was briefly spotted in the reflection of a mirror by one witness, while others have caught a glimpse of a figure from the corner of their eye or felt uneasy in the environment.

title: Unhappy Butler
info: This fellow took his own life when he realised that his mistress would never love him. His body was found at the bottom of the large spiral staircase, and it is the same area that he still haunts.

title: Pianist
info: Two ghosts have made a home of this theatre - one plays the piano late at night, the other is an unknown lady who brings with her a zone of cold.

title: Man in Jeans
info: Students and a dinner lady watched a man in a checked shirt and jeans sitting in the main hall wave and vanish without warning. Minor poltergeist-like activity has also been reported.

title: CCTV Figure
info: This apparition materialised by the doorway of the club - it could be seen quite clearly on the CCTV network, but not directly by human eyes. The entity vanished after several minutes, though made a very brief reappearance a month later.

title: Gabble Retchets
info: These local devil dogs were believed to be the souls of those who were not baptised as children and have returned to haunt their parents.

title: Man in the Cellar
location: Leeds - Golden Lion public house, North Street
info: Dressed in Victorian attire, this gentleman was often seen walking around under the pub. The upper part was said to be haunted by an old woman who appeared in the children's bedroom at night.

title: Abbot
info: The former Abbot of the abbey walks the area that has been converted into a museum. It is more usual to hear the spirit moving around than see him. Traditionally the entity is said to wear white robes, although the sighting in the 1970s reported the ghost's robes as being brown/red. The abbey grounds are also home to a white female entity named Mary who witnessed her lover committing murder and turned him in.

title: Grey Figure
location: Leeds - Kirkstall Forge railway station (since relocated)
info: The station porter and a passenger both spotted a figure in a long grey sheet with a long streak of red running through the cloth, standing on a shed roof. A booking clerk also witnessed the entity, which soon disappeared. Prior to this, lights had been seen flickering around the station.

title: Running
info: An employee at this hospital heard five voices and footsteps rushing down a corridor but could see nothing - there was a gust of wind as the invisible people passed.

title: Smoky Figure
location: Leeds - Old Lewis's building, The Headrow
info: A labourer working in the building with a colleague photographed a misty 'figure' with his camera phone. Another worker on site claimed to have seen something from the corner of his eye, though when he quickly turned, it had vanished.

title: Shaggy Figure
location: Leeds - Outer ring road, between Horsforth and Rodley
info: A driver began to feel overwhelmingly terrified while passing through a valley along this road. To quote, 'stood at the side of the road and looking directly at me, was a very tall, shaggy, brown or black, fur covered shape. At my estimation, it must have stood over two metres tall, around 1.2 metres wide, with no visible limbs or eyes, but I sensed that the eyes were there somewhere, as I could feel them boring into the car'. The witness accelerated away, but the feeling of dread lasted until morning, even after arriving home. Earlier the same year a large black cat was observed crossing the same road.

title: 'Bill Sikes' Lookalike
info: A witness walking through this park reported seeing three ghostly figures; one resembling Oliver Twist's Bill Sikes, and a man and woman wearing what could have been well-to-do Victorian clothing. The witness said there were no feelings of ill ease.

title: Carriage
info: Not reported for years, the ghostly carriage was supposed to be pulled by a team of four horses.

title: Two Children
location: Leeds - Private residence near a churchyard, Kirkstall
info: Two small children appeared at a witness's bedside in the night. Both children were very still and looking at the witness's girlfriend. The witness started to wake her, but terror prevented him. Not wanting to take his eyes off the children, the witness tried to reach the light switch but could not find the button. The children vanished and the witness stayed awake until dawn.

title: CID Busted
info: Leeds Criminal Investigation Department declared that the property's flying bottles and paint pots, and the strange voices, were not paranormal in nature, although it is not clear whether they arrested anyone in connection to the activity.

title: Elsie
info: A former shop worker, the ghost named Elsie was spotted in the hallway. Other activities reported here include disembodied footfalls, giggling, and lights switched on.

title: Brass Band
info: As one young man went to bed, he could hear the faint sound of a brass band. Within five minutes the band sounded like it was outside his house so he climbed out of bed and looked out the window but could see nothing. Ten minutes later the sound of the band was so loud it was as if it was in the house. Once again, the man looked out of the window - there was nothing there and the sound stopped. Thinking the incident could have been a dream he did not mention it, although several years later he started to tell his brother the story, who finished the story as he had also heard the same thing.

title: Man in Basement
location: Leeds - Retail premises along Hunslet Road
info: An employee at this shop spotted an old man in the basement. When they described the man to their manager, they were told the description matched the manager's grandfather who had also worked on the site.

title: Black Hound
info: This park, like many in Yorkshire, is reputedly home to a large demonic black hound. A photographed was published by the local press in 2019 which claimed to show the entity but was more likely to be a dog being walked by its owner.

title: Lift Travellers
info: A member of staff would often use a lift in the building, sharing with occupants who would travel upwards only to vanish just before the doors opened.

title: Golden Haired Woman
info: A crowd of people gathered to watch a ghostly female figure spotted outside the church, described as having golden hair and sparkling eyes. A woman arrested nearby was named as the 'ghost' and promptly placed in gaol for drunkenness.

title: Blue Lady
info: Not alone in haunting this mansion, the blue lady is the best known here, having a room named after her. Other entities reportedly include a monk in brown robes, a Knight Templar, a small boy who climbs from out a cupboard, and a non-descript misty form. Screams have been heard from the South Wing, as have the sounds of something or someone heavy being dragged across the floor.

title: Man in a White Coat
info: A ghostly man in a white coat has been spotted in the recreation of a Victorian Street within this building, while a grey lady dressed in nineteenth century clothing waves at staff along the second floor.

title: Charlie Peace
info: Held in the Bridewell (a small prison) under the town hall while awaiting his trial, Peace was later executed for a double murder. His ghost is said to remain within his cell.

title: Tall Figure
info: The knocking sounds from the attic occurred for several nights before a phantom six foot tall man in a long coat started to appear. The owner and all her tenants moved out in November 1932.

title: Armoured Man
info: Two occupants of a car spotted an armoured figure riding a horse towards Killingbeck. The witnesses were unclear whether it was a 'real' person heading towards the Royal Armouries Museum.

title: Gabriel Hounds
info: These hounds are said to have the faces of men, and have been heard passing the church on dark, still nights.

title: Former Maid
location: Sheffield - Ashdell Grove house, Westbourne Road
info: This building is reportedly haunted by a maid who committed suicide after her secret lover, a local policeman, left her. Her pacing has been heard down a corridor, and she also moves items around in the building's offices. The figure of a middle aged man has also been seen.

title: Pregnant Girl
location: Sheffield - Ball Inn, Darnall (no longer operating)
info: This thin, grey ghost is said to be a member of staff who committed suicide at the inn when she discovered she was with child. She walks the upstairs corridors, while in other parts of the building, strange noises are heard in the night and well secured shelves fall without warning.

title: Apprentice
info: Around a thousand people assembled on the street to watch a glowing figure, named as the ghost of an apprentice, in the window of a building. A police officer pointed out that the 'entity' resembled a light being reflected in a window moving in the wind. Once the window had been secured, the ghost could no longer be seen.

title: White Lady
info: This traditional white figure supposedly haunts the grounds of both the hall and the abbey. The latter location is also the home to a spectral monk.

title: Black Figure
location: Sheffield - Birley Woods and Golf Course
info: A local lad's grandfather told him that a wispy black figure in a cloak and hood was trapped in the wood and had been for hundreds of years. After the grandfather died, one of the lad's friends confided that he had encountered the figure while out in the woods.

title: Boggards
info: This lane is said to be named after the entities which live (or lived) down there. A private house along the lane is also said to be haunted by a phantom woodworker.

title: White Woman
info: Wearing a flowing dress, this pale spirit has occasionally been reported.

title: Broken Necked Lovers
info: A pair of eloping lovers were thrown off their horse down this lane - the fall broke both their necks. They now haunt this area where no bird is said to sing.

title: Saucer Eyed Dog
info: This creature, with its unusually large eyes, has been known to turn itself into mist if threatened. A ghost hunter in the area reported to have spoken to a couple who witnessed a large black dog appear out of nowhere as they travelled down the lane.

title: Lights
location: Sheffield - Captive Queen public house (now closed)
info: Floating lights and strange figures were said to have been seen in this building when it was a pub. Another local legend says that it was an entrance to a nest of secret underground tunnels used by Mary Queen of Scots.

title: Colonel John Bright
location: Sheffield - Carbrook Hall public house (as of late 2019, a coffee shop)
info: A close friend and ally of Cromwell, the well-built ghost of Colonel Bright has been observed standing at the top of the stairs. Other ghosts reported here include the sounds of children, an elderly woman from the 1920s, a phantom Roundhead, a monk, and another shadowy figure who throws items around the bar.

title: Riot
info: Around two thousand men and young boys gathered at this site after a rumour started a ghost had been seen (although the local press declared the entity was really a 'young fellow of weak intellect'). Neighbours complained, the police arrived, scuffles occurred, no ghost appeared, and people went home. Rumours of a ghostly figure in the area continued throughout the rest of the month.

title: Rings
location: Sheffield - Dead Man's Lane (aka Dead Lane), Ecclesall (lane may have been renamed, but in Greystones area)
info: An overgrown lane in the village (now a Sheffield suburb) was said to be home to fairies, with distinct fairy circles spotted in the grass. A headless woman also haunted the lane.

title: Pilot?
info: A man spotted a figure wearing a flying jacket and scarf walking across the foggy, open playing fields. While walking towards the witness, the figure suddenly vanished.

title: Large Cat
location: Sheffield - Field near Wales Bar Petrol Station, now a golf course
info: While crossing a field of sheep, a group of friends watched a large, cat-shaped creature amongst the sheep. The creature spotted the group and crouched, resulting in the friends fleeing the area.

title: Chip Shop
info: Walking home one evening, a mother and daughter spotted a chip shop which they had thought was new, as they had not seen it before. The shop was open, lights were on, and people were inside. A couple of nights later, they decided to visit the takeaway, but it was not there - a DIY shop stood on the spot, twice the size of the chip shop they had seen.

title: Norah the Maid
location: Sheffield - Firth Park Brushes (former school), Barnsley Road
info: The maid, who committed suicide on the site two hundred years ago, is still said to wander the area. When the high school stood on the area, cleaning staff reported lights that would turn themselves on, amongst other strange phenomena. A priest was called to exorcise the land in 2003; there have been no reported incidents since.

title: Life Saver
info: The family that tolerated a poltergeist in their home for almost a year were eventually thankful for the entity - one night it banged so loudly the whole family awoke only to find their rooms full of smoke. They managed to escape as the fire engulfed their building.

title: Grey Woman
info: While waiting at a bus stop, two people spotted a grey-coloured older woman walking past a tree. The woman had her hands placed under her chin, seemingly to secure a headscarf, and she wore wearing long clothing. The woman turned and looked at the people at the bus stop before vanishing in a flash.

title: White Lady
info: Little is known about this phantom woman, other than an interesting point to note is that the road was once called Dead Man's Lane.

title: Not a Ghost
location: Sheffield - Hill between Solly Street and Allen Street
info: A Barghast was said by children to have taken up residence on this hill, which at the time was common land. It later emerged that the ghost was a hoax.

title: White Figure
info: After a lodger spotted a ghostly white figure in the kitchen, this house was visited by a many people hoping to see the entity. One of these visitors, a Mrs Rollinson, collapsed after witnessing a white female form dash past her. After briefly regaining consciousness and sharing her encounter, Rollinson once again fell unconscious and died soon after. It is worth noting that other people were with Rollinson at the time of the encounter, but they did not see the reported ghost.

title: Peering Face
info: When the Sheffield Paranormal Society carried out a vigil of this property, photographs were taken inside the back room. When they came back from being developed, a face could be seen peering through a window, even though nothing was seen at the time.

title: Highwayman
location: Sheffield - Mail Coach public house, 149 West Street
info: Wearing the clothing of a robber, this figure was seen lurking in the shadows prior to mysteriously disappearing.

title: White Figure
info: The landlord of this public house moved out after only three weeks, claiming that his child and pets had been constantly upset by a white human form.

title: Mary Queen of Scots
info: Folklore says that Mary, wearing a long black dress, appears in the Turret House and glides along corridors and passes through walls. In 2015, a visitor to the site watched a glowing white figure of a woman wearing a long dress run towards and vanish behind a building.

title: Old Lady
info: This old lady has been seen wandering around the former Ward Eight, where she disappears when she walks through a wall. There are also stories of disembodied footsteps running on the stairs.

title: Governess
info: Now returning to the hall in the form of a white lady, the governess had her throat slit by the hall's Squire after she threatened to tell his wife of their affair. The sounds of their final argument can also be heard drifting around the hall at night. A man staying here also reported a phantom hound which awoke him at night.

title: Cain
info: A former police and fire station, the building is now a museum and used by ghost hunting groups. The site is home to a former prisoner named Cain,

title: Devil or Other
info: Sidney Oldall Addy, in a book about the local area, assumed that the woods took the name from a monster, water sprite, a goblin or the Devil.

title: Matron
location: Sheffield - Northern General Hospital, Vickers Corridor
info: At least two members of staff have reported the same 'dream' while sleeping in the staff room - they have awoken to see an angry matron-styled nurse with one hand over the witnesses' mouth and the other hand around their neck, trying to strangle them. One witness kicked and screamed before the apparition vanished in the blink of an eye. In 2012 two witnesses spotted a man in Victorian clothing drift past them while on the bell tower staircase.

title: Tunnel
info: A secret tunnel containing a box of treasure was said to connect the church to Beauchief Abbey. The box could only be removed by a white horse wearing shoes which faced the wrong way. The horse would have to approach the treasure tail first and could only drag the box out using rope tied around its head. In 1840 a ghostly woman was spotted watching the parish clerk play the organ at dusk - the clerk and his apprentice fled and vowed never to play the organ in the evening again.

title: Fireman
info: Perhaps unsurprisingly, the male entity said to haunt this building is named as a former fireman.

title: Beer Drinker
location: Sheffield - Old Queen's Head public house
info: Seen and felt sitting by the stone fireplace, the phantom of an aging patron firmly holding his jugs of beer still returns to the oldest pub in Sheffield.

title: Crossing the Road
info: A local story says that a figure or ball of light can be seen crossing the road, although some believe that it is an optical illusion caused by environmental effects.

title: Smoker
location: Sheffield - Private house in Swallownest area
info: This polt would hide and move objects, blow light bulbs, stack cigarette butts, and create the smell of pipe smoke. A phantom black dog was also seen by a child on the site.

title: No Head
location: Sheffield - Private residence along Townhead Road, Dore
info: A 23 year old woman encountered a phantom woman floating slightly above the floor of her home. The witness said that the entity wore a green Elizabethan style dress, had beautiful hands, and while the base of the neck appeared solid, the top had faded to nothing and the entity had no head. When Dore stood as a village, rather than a Sheffield suburb, the area was believed to be haunted by a young girl upon a white horse.

title: Man in a Mask
info: A child told his father that he had seen a black man in a mask at the door of the living room. A few hours later the child's Jamaica grandfather died in hospital, wearing a face mask.

title: Sitting Man
info: A resident reported seeing a phantom man sitting in a chair that was not there and a woman would walk up to the attic bedroom. After experiencing poltergeist activity in the bathroom, the witness shouted out in frustration - the haunting ceased after the witness's outburst.

title: Emily
location: Sheffield - Private residence, Moor Oaks Road
info: A resident here heard the voice of an older woman close by ask 'Are you there, Emily?'. The resident thought it may have been their landlady, but no one else was around.

title: To Be Seen Alive
location: Sheffield - Rawson's Arms, Tenter Street (no longer operating), and River Dun
info: This pub featured in local news as it offered a sea serpent 'to be seen alive'. The creature, pulled from the River Dun, weighed around twenty-two kilograms, a head resembling a mastiff, and fine mouse-like hair. Music would calm or anger the creature, depending on the number of instruments played.

title: Flying Lizard
info: It was said that there were three types of lizard in this area, the Running Asker, the Water Asker, and the Flying Asker, the latter being the smallest of the three.

title: Scratching Hound
location: Sheffield - Road outside the Botanical Gardens
info: A phantom dog attacked one witness walking along this road - it bit his calf and clawed his back, leaving red weals. The man developed a high fever but later recovered after a spirit exorcism was performed.

title: Old School Boy
info: It is claimed that a boy dressed in old fashioned clothing has been observed by students and teachers, standing on the playing fields.

title: Floating Feet
location: Sheffield - Schofield's department store (now Argos Extra), Angel Street
info: The boiler room here was haunted by a pair of feet which hovered a half a metre or so from the floor.

title: Smugglers
info:
The cellar of the inn is reputedly haunted by two smugglers who drowned during the 
Great Sheffield Flood of 1864.

title: Red Cloud
info: A red cloud which covered the roof of a house was seen by three people. Different coloured beams of light, mainly green, pink and blue, emerged from the cloud for around fifteen minutes before vanishing.

title: Dark Red Cloud
info: This 'cloud' which shot beams of light, heating up the cold winter night, hovered over the town before heading off towards Ireland.

title: Hell Hole
location: Sheffield - Somewhere between Neepsend Bicarage and Rutland Road
info: An entrance to the lower world was said to be located somewhere in Sheffield.

title: Smashed Grave
info: Local press blamed a poltergeist after a heavy granite cross was broken. One piece, weighing seventy-six kilograms, had been lifted from its base, while another slab of granite had been broken in two.

title: Bangs
info: After reporting bangs on the walls and the sound of footsteps, the pub called in the 'Soul Reaper' paranormal group who claimed the site was haunted by 'Hannah', killed by a bear close to the site.

title: Voice
info: It was reported in the local press that landlord Phil Birks called in paranormal investigators after hearing a disembodied voice, spotting a shadowy person, and watching 'orbs' on CCTV.

title: Fallen Horses
location: Wakefield - Denby Dale Road bridge, and river below
info: Walking her dog across the bridge, Amanda West was frozen with fear when the sound of horses passed her - with no horses to be seen. Without warning, she then heard a loud splash. Looking into the river below, the water was calm, but the sound of panicking horses could now be heard coming from below. She later found out that the original bridge had collapsed in 1836 and a team of horses pulling a cart had drowned.

title: Mist
location: Wakefield - Derelict brickworks off Wakefield Road
info: A student with a disposable camera snapped several photographs here which showed a white mist, not visible at the time the pictures were taken.

title: Miners
info: Old coal cart tracks are still visible today, even though mining operations ceased over one hundred years ago. On dark nights, one is said to be able to hear the former miners walking along the paths.

title: Falling Glasses
info: The pub is said to be home to a non-threatening entity which occasionally throws glasses from the shelves.

title: Mirror Breaking
info: This boisterous ghost had a habit of smashing reflective surfaces and moving heavy furniture around. One landlady claimed the spirit tried to smother her as she lay in bed.

title: Lady Bolles
location: Wakefield - Heath Old Hall (aka Heath Hall) (no longer standing)
info: The ghostly figure of Lady Bolles was said not to have been seen since being 'laid' in a large dip in the local river at some point before the start of the twentieth century, even though soldiers based here during the Second World War reported seeing her.

title: Shipman?
location: Wakefield - HMP Wakefield Prison, cell D336
info: The Argus newspaper reported that Harold Shipman's former cell is reputedly haunted by the serial killer, though staff at the prison attribute the 'scary noises' to men in nearby cells.

title: Victorian Woman
info: A phantom woman in Victorian clothing has been reported moving around the subway that connects platforms 1 and 2.

title: Lady Margaret
info: This sad ghost came about after she became locked in an attic and went undiscovered for quite some time.

title: Falling Glass
info: In a video featured in several newspapers, a glass is shown falling over on the bar, apparently unaided. The owner claimed that this is only one of several strange occurrences.

title: Little Girl
location: Wakefield - Old Vicarage Bookshop, Zetland Street
info: This bookshop is reputedly home to a phantom that died from the plague - his ghostly form is riddled with symptoms. As a side note, this area is also said to riddled with secret passageways.

title: Terrier
info: This small, yapping dog has attacked and scared creatures many times larger than itself - when touched the phantom pooch fades from view.

title: Mirrored Shadows
info: Racks would be knocked off surfaces by an unseen hand and shadows spotted in mirrors. It was claimed in the press at the time that the shop was built upon an old graveyard.

title: Blue Lady
info: Her origin unknown, one story says that the phantom blue lady walked straight through a van while crossing the bridge. The driver was convinced he had hit someone until he spotted the figure continuing to walk unimpeded across the bridge.

title: Crawling Man
